column13: This is really a wine bar, not a restaurant. The tables and seating make for very uncomfortable arrangements. The menu is extremely limited. However, the food is very good.

This is Southern food for fine dining, akin to the great New South places in Charleston. Great grits, perfect catfish. Room for improvement: fried chicken plate needs some more pep and color (we made up for latter with very good brussel sprouts side); cobbler was just okay, but not up to standards of rest of meal; atmosphere a bit too sedate and way too dark; service was efficient but not as warm and welcoming as you'd want (no Southern hospitality at all). However, the plusses well outweigh the minuses, and highly recommend.

column4: 1515 N. Main Street Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Waiter was great! And so was food!
Terrific, delicious food. Very attentive service. Our family had a great dinner. Lamb chops with noodles our favorite dish.

column4: 231 South Ellsworth Ave. San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: First impression: dowdy, dated interiors. The evening we were there the kitchen and serving staff were out of sync. The menu was aspiring, and the execution of the dishes was good, but not inspired. There were extended periods between courses, wrong dishes presented, but the serving staff remained professional and apologetic throughout and at the end of the [very long] evening, quietly made an adjustment to the bill recognizing their faux pas.
I had a sensational dining experience.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Local to the Opera and that was nice. Food was tasty, a bit salty. We had Fish and Chips along with Fryed Chicken. Basic, filling and tasty. Takes a while to get the food so get there early enough to handle that. Staff was very nice

column4: 601 Van Ness Avenue Suite F San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Second time at the 2G. First time service was 4star. This visit three servers including the owner. They couldn't get their signals straight. Ordered oyster app(excellent by the way) from the owner he left and never returned. Had to remind our regular server. We ordered one salad from one server. Another server brought a different salad. We ordered the sushi sampler. We got the sashimi sampler from a different server. We didn't complain because the sashimi was also excellent. But the point was that it was not what we ordered. We ordered a second glass of wine from one server when it didn't arrive I reminded our regular server who told us they were out of that particular wine. Seconds later the wine arrived. The wine they ran out of???

When I booked this on Open Table, I didn't expect to find myself in a hotel dining room. It was the menu that had attracted me and the food proved to be really good. It's an odd space, huge and modern, but the food and the service are both great. Try the chicken salad or the roasted brussels sprouts. Parking is free; just get a stamp on your ticket before leaving the restaurant.

column4: 4290 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: Too loud, bad service. Waiter had no time for us. Not enough help.

There were WAY too many people there. Clearly the food and service suffered. The food was just OK at best...spicing and sauces were off, mostly. Disappointing and expensive. Even outside was noisy, and there were people standing within inches of where we sat. There was no reason they couldn't have been directed away from the tables.
It's official...this is my fav place in SF.There was nothing bad about this place.The food was to die for!!!Loved every minute of it!!!

column4: 71 N. San Pedro Street San Jose, CA  95110
column13: Nice cozy place with patio dining. Sporadic street noise(ie loud motorcycles and car alarms in the parking garage across the street) can be distracting. The flavors of the dishes were great, but my chicken and my husbands pork were dry. Service was pleasant, if not as professional as I would expect from a white table cloth place. No big deal, just the small touches. Would still be happy to go back.

column4: Hilton San Francisco 750 Kearny Street San Francisco, CA  94108
column13: The only way this brunch could be improved is by the addition of turkey at the carving station!!!
Our waiter rebecca did a n outstanding job. Also, the other gentleman who made sure we were taken care of from the beginning to end... Will defenitely be back! thank you for everything...

This is best for couples and smaller groups who wish to converse, wine, and dine while enjoying one of the world's greatest views. The menu is small but they have perfected what they serve altho the brussel sprouts were not as special as we'd hoped. Service is knowledgeable and low-key. We'll be back.
Fun, different, but very expensive for what you get.

We celebrated with our daughter on her 24th birthday. She is a real foodie and ordered everything. We had about 4 courses and shared plates, splitting two orders three ways. All was excellent. I was not up on the wines of southern Italy, being a Tuscan red lover. The wine list is focused on wines of Southern Italy and sommelier was great and guided me into an excellent wine that was just what I wanted in my price range. (Good American wines as well, but why order an American wine in such a great Italian restaurant?) Our waitress was attentive and very professional. It is a bit crowded, space-wise, and not what you would call "romantic", but we were there for fun and food along with some good wine. A-16 delivers this totally!
Fabulous selection of ales and knowledgeable staff to suggest pairings. The food was very good and our server was excellent. Overall, it was a very enjoyable experience and we will be back.

column4: 973 E. Hillsdale Blvd Foster City, CA  94404
column13: The food is always very good, we come here when we have out of town guests.
Great fresh fish and prawns. Very Chinese and very good.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: The menu seems to change with availability & the seasons. My husband's gazpacho made with heirloom tomatoes was especially sweet and flavorful, not acidic.
Great variety and tasty array of appetizer and entrees, it was a great find and really enjoyed being there, will come back again!
Consistently fabulous restaurant. Fabulous food, excellent staff and gorgeous atmosphere.
Simple food prepared perfectly.

I've been going to Fiesta Del Mar Too for well over a decade and love their Margaritas. Their bar was full last Friday evening, so we decided to try out their new restaurant: Agave. The bar was empty up until 5:30pm or so and we just picked a table for dinner instead. The menu was glorious. We couldn't get past the yummy sounding appetizers so we didn't even try an entree. The queso fundido and toastadas de tinga were to die for. I love cevhiche and theirs was not bad but not my favorite (I like bigger chunks of fish and not quite so much spice). Still good though. We had nice strong house margaritas served up and they were perfect. I've found a new favorite spot in downtown Mountain View!

column1: Agriculture Bar & Kitchen at Dawn Ranch Lodge
column13: In a word...SPECTACULAR! Great menu, AMAZINGLY WONDERFUL service, excellent presentation of food and delectable eats! We were treated like royalty. I highly recommend...

This is a "hole in the wall" little place, but the food was great and we will go back. They don't serve alcohol but were fine with people bringing in their own wine/beer. This is not an "atmosphere" restaurant - go for the food. Everything we ordered was delicious.

My daughter and I checked Trip Advisor for recommendations and they were spot on. We loved it from the time we walked in the door until we left satisfied and talked about the food and overall experience. We will go back as one of our "must go restaurants" when I come to visit.The waiters explained the food well and we had our choice of spice levels. The lighting was a warm pleasant glow and the ambiance had a quiet but happy sound.
Will definitely make this our downtown Sushi restaurant! Everything was perfect.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: I was here with a group of 6. We all ordered different things and everything was delicious.We loved the choices of fish, cooking methods, and sauces. The calamari salad was amazing.As we went on Wednesday night with the free corkage, it was an excellent value. We wouldall go again and I want to go next time I'm in SF

The food was tasty, the service was great and our only complaint was that there should have been larger portions for the prices. We ordered a paella and 5 tapas and when the food arrived, all of our jaws dropped at how small the portions were.
our first visit when the restaurat first opened had more owner interaction..this time it lost the owner- on -premises feel.. for a small intimate restaurant I expected a warmer reception

The appetizer shooters were to die for -- a veritable party in your mouth. The steaks were outstanding and the sides all delicious. And who doesn't love the originality and SURPRISE of cotton candy for an after dinner snack. Can't wait to go back.
Took a long time for us to get our food due to some other large parties. They gave us free hamachi shots as compensation
Not great as per their ads!!! Meat was tough and over priced.

Central location in Fisherman's Wharf area . . . Very good food. Service left a bit to be desired, but you could see it was because it was a popular place. Great view of marina and Golden Gate in the distant background.

column4: 1602 S. El Camino Real San Mateo, CA  94402
column13: A subtle presentation of flavors from India in dishes like short-rib, black cod, and pork loin. The restaurant is hidden away in a small Victorian house off El Camino. The dining rooms were quaint, the food delicious, and the service outstanding--professional but friendly.
An absolutely wonderful experience. The food was incredible and the service was perfect.

Amber was great but it was a very quiet night, very few tables were filled. No one really at the bar, it was a Monday night and they don't show the games on TV. Food was great, services was outstanding.
Lets just say I was not wowed with the food. I was expecting Indian fusion, but there is no fusion, it's all Indian with mild spice levels.
The food was very good, although the serving was rather small for the price. Rice has to be ordered extra for any curry. The place is very nice, but overall the experience was not overwhelming.

column4: 25 Yerba Buena Lane San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: extraordinary food, excellent service, beautiful facility.

column4: 2290 El Camino Real Suite 9 Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: Great ambiance and authentic dishes
Food and Service were first rate, would recommend.

Maybe it was because we had so highly anticipated our visit to the American Cupcake that I was so disappointed. My street tacos were bland, they were out of 90% of their cupcakes and the girl helping us seemed either just plain exhausted or totally aloof. I don't know which is worse. The one redeeming quality was the wasabi aioli served with my basket of tots (which by the way could feed a small army). My limited selection of cupcakes let me to get the cotton candy cupcake. The cotton candy was good, the cupcake was average. Overall, this experience did not live up to the hype.
Spectacular service, and absolutely delicious food. Erica and Camille gave us the red carpet treatment!

Our meal was really good. The menu is eclectic and interesting with a nice balance of old and new world recipes. The ambience was elegant and very grand, and listening to the jazz trio on Friday night was a great way to end a busy week. Surprising to find a truly enjoyable restaurant nestled in the heart of "tourist" row on the Wharf.

Service was friendly and attentive. Although my meal wasnt great, the appetizers were very good, and everybody else enjoyed their meals. It was very loud but because there was a huge table that took up most of the restaurant celebrating a baby shower.

We had not been there recently. They have dramatically shrunk the food menu (but now have a very large beer menu). The few items left are ambitious in concept. Whomever is in that kitchen has no idea how to prepare that food. Oversalted, overdressed salads. Fish that was poorly cooked.
My dining experience at Andalu was great! Loved the ambience. The food was so delicious and I totally recommend this restaurant- especially for a special occasion!

Really good food! The coffee-rubbed steak was amazing! The hamburger on a Model Bakery english muffin was perfect, and the ceviche was very well done. The wait staff was attentive and very eager to please. The ambiance and decor were very cool--very modern lounge, with an awesome fireplace and comfy seating. The only problem what that the food took forever to come out. We had a 7:45 reservation and didn't get appetizers until close to 8:30/8:40, and then didn't get main courses until well after 9:00.
Good food, great location and setting in the middle of Alameda.
Thank you ,this was a fabuloud lunch on Sunday ,the service was perfect.Guess i will be back soon
The musical performances are definitely a plus.

Absolutely ABYSMAL service, waited for staff to engage our table for over 30 minutes with nobody around. Ultimately, they had the busboy handling our orders. This proved challenging because of a language gap and his lack of menu knowledge. Ultimately, at the end of this horrible experience, which they readily acknowledged, no apology AT ALL. I like this restaurant generally, but this visit experience was absolutely UNACCEPTABLE.
Service was excellent, food was great. We were seated right away.
Super as always,the only bad part is when it is time to leave,will be back very soon!!!!")))
Had dinner on a Monday evening and the place was empty. The sushi was decent but the service was a little slow for how empty the place was.
The Potrero Hill stalwart, and still a pasta performer, hard to go wrong here. While frogs try to own the hood, Aperto still rules. Brunch this. Or just repast widda' pasta... Bene.

This was not at all what a Michelin star restaurant experience should have been. After being seated, the waiter quickly arrived at our table and asked if we were ready to order. He did not introduce himself, welcome us to the restaurant, offer a glass of wine, or discuss the menu or any available specials. We literally hadn't even had a chance to look at the menu. The restaurant did seem busy but we were at the Farmhouse Inn (another Michelin rated restaurant) the previous night and they managed to maintain more than adequate service even with a full house. We both had the scallop to start and the halibut for our entree. Both were good but the horrible service by John B. left us with a bad taste!
Very nice dining experience in the Mission, San Francisco. Selections good for meat eaters and vegetarians

column4: 100 W San Carlos St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: I liked the spaciousness of the place. The staff accommodated our request for a booth since my son disabled. Tables weren't too close to each other and the place had relaxed atmosphere. Service was prompt and the wait staff very helpful with wine parings. The filet mignon was cooked as ordered with just the right seasoning and the meat just melted in my mouth. The desserts were delightful and it capped off a wonderful birthday celebration for my son. It was certainly worth the 1 1/2 hour drive to dine at Arcadia. Hope to come back soon.

Of course, Sunnyvale and Santa Clara have no shortages of Indian restaurants along El Camino Real. However, I hope you realise that there are all sorts of different kinds of Indian restaurants. Arka is special. It is more of a modern and chic, fusionish Indian restaurant. Right off the bat, you'll notice the stylish, loungey atmosphere. The dining rooms and bar are well-decorated, and I like it when they play house music. However, what i like most about Arka is that they have gluten-free items marked on their menu. I'm actually on a grain.free / paleoish diet. Most people probably think you can't enjoy Indian food without grains, but I'm with the camp that believes grains are so good for your body but still enjoy Indian food.

This was my fifth dining experience at Artisan Bistro. The food is every bit as good as a 5 star SF restaurant with the convenience of home. Our waiter, Joe, was fabulous. He recommended a wine that was everything he said it was. He was attentive without being overbearing. It was the perfect evening to celebrate a special birthday with friends.

column4: 2700 W El Camino Real Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: The food was really nice. One of the most authentic Indian food in the US. The Paneer Tikka Masala was very tasty and actually had flavor. No music was being played and that bummed me out a bit. But overall, a great, if not slightly pricey experience.
We went there on a Saturday evening. It was exactly what I expected. We really enjoyed the food and music.
First time here. Our waiter was taken away to help a lady who had a timing problem, one of the owners took over. She was exceedingly pleaseant & knowledgeable.

If you're looking to "experience San Francisco", this is the place. The food is amazing and the show is funny, exhilarating, original, and full of sass. This was my first time here and I had a crazy amount of fun. They also have a nice bar and dance floor in the basement. So after pigging out, you can go burn a few calories on the dance floor. Just don't bring your uptight conservative friends here. Highly recommend getting reservations well in advance.

We have thoroughly enjoyed the delicious food and overall experience both times we have been. We have have brought out of town guests--both vegetarians and omnivores-- and everyone has raved about it.
The presentation of the food was AMAZING!!!The food itself was no different. The garlic bread is like no other garlic bread I have ever had or tasted.

A wonderfully unique dining experience. We had the 5-course meal and every bite was a delight. The whole concept of eating food with attention paid to taste, texture, presentation, and ingredients in concert with the earth, sea, forest, etc was sublime. Portions are not large, but we were comfortably full at the end. We chose the wine pairings and the sommelier's choices were matched beautifully to the courses - much better than we could have done on our own. Service was impeccable and the owner-chef, Dominique Crenn, visited twice. This all comes at a price, $500 or so for 2 with tip and tax, so it is not an everyday thing, certainly not for us. But what a memorable meal!

column4: 234 South B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: We have been there before. Food and service were terrific again.
Superb brunch for six. Service was great, food was a delight, terrace was nicely laid out and view of valley was great. Superlatives all around.

column1: Aurea - The Stanford Court, a Renaissance Hotel
column13: The jazz band was excellent--very interactive and friendly, but also talented.We had appetizers and desserts--both very satisfying.Parking was easier than I expected--and validation was a welcome surprise.

We have been there twice and both times had a wonderful dinner with excellent service. It has changed hands since we lived in the neighborhood and had not liked it. Now it is a very nice place and we have added it to our "go to" list.

The staff made our large party welcome, and presented the birthday cake (which we took) beautifully. The food was delicious from the prompt presentation of the wine, the shared appetizers, and all the demands of our party. Thank you Aurora for making it a very special evening. We plan to return.
The food was delicious. I highly recommend the basteeya. It was sublime! I appreciated the valet service as parking in that area is not easy.

column1: Azúcar Latin Bistro Mojito Bar & Lounge
column4: 71 E. San Fernando Street San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Food is WAY overpriced for the size and quality of the meals. It also didnt help that one of our dinner guests found a human nail in the sauce. Yes, the dish was free and we got drink coupons but still it was a bad experience. Service is not good. If it wasn't for the live entertainment and great dancing atmosphere this would gave got a worse review. This is definitely the place to go for salsa dancing after you eat dinner elsewhere.

Needed to find a good early dinner spot. Normally attend during normal hours for dinner or lunch.Started with kimchi quesadillas, and had our regular selections for dinner - Japanese meal of salmon, poached egg, rice, fried rice, pickle, and intense plum, with broth- it is delicious. My husband had an Indian dish with chicken, hard boiled eggs, apricots and rice- chicken biranyi. And topped off by drinking a Burma Cooler - beer, ginger and lemon juice which was very refreshing.Attentive servers, quiet environment as people can be seated in the main dining room or in the back.Delicious and relaxing experience.
Nice for a comfortable dinner for two. Food is always consistent, wine list very good. We always enjoy coming here, usually a few times a year.
LOVE the Mac-n-Cheese! BBQ never disappoints!

column4: Doubletree Sonoma 1 Doubletree Drive Rohnert Park, CA  94928
column13: Very attentive service. Food is excellent.
First visit. Had delicious meal, nice bottle of wine, excellent service and all at a reasonable price.

Baci is a great restaurant - the service and food are all outstanding. Everything that we had there was perfectly delicious and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their salads and entrees. It is unfortunate that Baci is not a larger place. They have done very well using the small space that they have, but because it is a small restaurant and they have tried to maximize the space so they could have many tables, when it is full of patrons (including the bar) it can be so noisy it becomes unpleasant to enjoy one's meal. I realize that the restaurant must work with the space they have, and also that the restaurant can't control the noise, so I would go on a day that was not typically a busy time.

Delicious food, wait staff was fabulous and so accommodating to our large group. The homemade pastas were great. A few in our group thought portions were ann the small side. It is New York style noisy, but you can opt to eat in the bar area if that doesn't suit you. We loved it!

Baker & Banker was an overall winner. Great food - the lamb agnolotti and duck were very good; I had the scallops bouillabaisse which was stellar. We arrived on time for our 6:15 reservation. The hostess seemed puzzled or distracted when she seated us, but our server was extremely gracious and helpful. Dark woods and other masculine decor accents make the space intimate; quite a few groups of 4-6 as well as couples.

Really cute place, and the food was amazing. But the service was sloooooooooooooow. It was a Tuesday night, so maybe it was because there was only one waiter. The menu was dropped off, and we didn't see the waiter again for about 10 mins. The menu didn't even include the wine list, which we had to ask for 10 mins. later. At least serve your table drinks while they wait. Other than that, it was great. We weren't in a rush, but would have been nice to have a glass of wine while waiting.

I like the ambiance at night with the lighting, and the table arrangements are done quite well, but the attention to detail needs to be improved. Our table did not have salt, and the wine pouring was way too slow, (I had to pour most myself).

The food portions were small. I had good fish tacos with beans. My husband had an okay grilled salmon on a bed of spinach. The spinach was good; the salmon, while fresh, not remarkable. The best dish we had was the roasted(?) squash. The bread was chewy on the inside but not crisp on the outside. The waiter's voice was too loud. I actually backed away when he spoke. I would not recommend this place.

Every time I go to Bambino's the food exceeds the last visit. If I were a weekly visitor, I would expect the kind of service I get, but I am not there enough for them to recognize me, and they still treat me like family. This visit, I got the pasta carbonara, and it was fabulous! My 2 friends really liked it as well.

2nd time there for a business diner! Cocktails and food were amazing, but definitely too small, it costs the "whole paycheck" ! And you're still starving after the meal. Outdoor patio is very nice, eco friendly, and you don't feel you're in San Francisco, the city by the wind.

Our table was patio area, there were a couple of heat lamps. They were soooooo hot, we were so uncomfortable, could not enjoy our meal. Our waitress was not friendly. The food was very good, but the environment and service were bad. Not sure we want to go back anymore.
We ate from the Raw menu and the plating and food was delicious. The actual restaurant itself was a little tight, and extremely warm (we sat on the 2nd floor). The service was on point and attentive.

We have eaten at Postrio many times over the years. The lobster club remains on the menu, which is one of the reasons we keep coming back. This late Saturday lunch, 2 PM, was unusually quiet with only a couple of groups remaining in the restaurant enjoying their meals. It is usually packed and noisy. A pleasant change

Excellent service; friendly, efficient and courteous.We enjoyed the expanded space and more elbow room.Good food, but not totally blown away - considering the price and the hype; p.s. not a fan of the bread options, at all.Great wine selection.
Service was impeccable and the food was delish. A first experience, but will definitely be coming back.

First time we ate at Barbacoa we liked it so much we brought friends. The Barbacoa house special wasn't as good as our first visit but we were there on a Monday evening this last time and the time before we were there on a Saturday evening. We will return to try some of the other dishes. Thanks, Steve

column4: 3900 D Bel Aire Plaza Napa, CA  94558
column13: It was a little difficult to find, since I don't live in Napa---but worth the effort! The food was delicious! Waitstaff was friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back.

As a bar/restaurant that celebrates beer culture, Barley & Hops also holds options for vegetarians and people who avoid gluten. Their selection of "on tap" and bottled beers and ciders is exceptional. If you're going to be near Occidental at meal time, take the time to book a reservation on open table.
Our server, Katharine, is excellent. We requested her section from our last vista to Barndiva.

I've been going to Barolo for a few years now and I have never been disappointed. Everything on their menu is fantastic and authentic. I recommend it to friends and people new to the area and they are blown away with the quality of food. This time I came with a new date and no surprise she was impressed. I came on Fog Fest weekend and they were much busier than usual; normally it's very quiet and sort of slow-paced. I had the lamb shanks and polenta after sharing a couple of appetizers (gorgonzola stuffed figs and prosciutto with peaches), we shared the hazelnut gelato and vanilla panna cotta with brandied cherries for dessert. Everything was amazing. If you are looking for high-quality food look no further.
I ordered the bento box and the baked scallop roll and it was great! Service was attentive and the food was good! Will definitely come back!
Everything was great except the beer was not cold. Even draft beer. They need to do something about that.
Another excellent pre-symphony meal at the Basil Canteen. Explored some more of their Thai cocktails this time and was not disappointed.
Outstanding for brunch. We have friends who come up from San Diego and always want to go to Basil Leaf for brunch on Sunday. They claim it's the best ever. I don't disagree.D.Dornan-San Ramon

The service was really good. The entrees which my husband and I ordered were so-so, but we enjoyed our appetizers and dessert immensely. We sat outdoors, on their patio, and although I felt a bit too close to another table, it was pleasant and romantic.
If you want to get out of the Embarcadero lunch rut and want a short walk. . . this is your place. Interesting menu and the tapas are fun and delicious.

They didn't have my Open Table reservation but could seat us. There were very few diners in the restaurant which is part of the Doubletree Hotel. There was a large corporate reception in the corridor leading to the restaurant and the number of people made it difficult to pass.The menu was average at best and when no one came to take our order after 15 min we decided to leave. I search for about 5 min to find someone to tell that we were leaving but could not find anyone.I would not recommend this restaurant.

column4: 223 Twin Dolphin Dr Redwood City, CA  94065
column13: Very nice food but it is wide open to hotel, and gives you the hotel feel. Very clean modern feel, we especially liked the wine flight choices.
Reliably interesting, creative, up-to-date, and well-executed. A neighborhood gem that always surpasses our expectations. Should be a destination restaurant for locavores and foodies.
The food was delicious, and the service was very attentive. They even gave us a complimentary appetizer. I will definitely be back.

Huge windows overlook ocean beach. The servers looked busy but they still made plenty of time for our table and got everything right. Excellent service! And finally, the food was fantastic. Everyone was happy. There was a wide selection to choose from on the menu. We were all so happy with our meals that we had to get dessert! oh, and I almost forgot to mention, they brew their own beer. They had a lot of options, the one I chose was crisp and refreshing.
Love this place. Great food and friendly staff.

Generally a good restaurant, with excellent food and decent service. However, it's perhaps a little pricey for the amount of food you get. We ordered an appetizer and two "big plates" (which weren't that big) and a dessert, and it ended up being $95 or so (We didn't get alcohol). The food wasn't all that filling. Again, the quality of food was good, but I would prefer it if the bill were about $20 or so less I think. I think if if we received full-on attentive service and a quieter environment, the $95 would be a lot easier to swallow.

We have been several times over the years and it is an old school place. Nice ambiance and quiet which is rare these days. Older crowd usually and they have a good prix fixe menu that is a good value. Nothing creative, but good rack of lamb, roasted fish, and grilled steak. The salads are simple and good. It is a comfortable place where you can get a good value and nice service in Los Altos. We'll be back.

Fun, pub atmosphere. The wait staff was good - our table was ready when we arrived and staff was ready to take our orders. The service wasn't slow or fast - just the typical bistro/bar - which allowed for our party to visit without feeling rushed. Paella wasn't as good as advertised on the menu. Probably best to stick with the old standards (e,g, fish and chips, burgers)

We were seated right away (inside at our request), but it was several minutes before our server greeted us while we sat there taking in the scenery. The restaurant itself is quite small with a bar that runs the length on one wall and seating along the opposite wall. At the front there was a two piece jazz band playing some cool renditions of popular songs (Blondie's Call Me) making it quite loud, but not in an unpleasant way. I ordered a Caipirinha to drink...refreshing! The carpaccio appetizer was alright, my man praised his meal, the chicken breast, while I found my pork chop too salty and a little too pink. I liked the vibe and would go again, I would just try something else off the menu.
The staff here is wonderful and the food was great. Presentation is also very nice.

Okay -- we are totally biased because we had our wedding reception at Bella 10 years ago. It is still this amazing, small, hip, romantic place with great great food. The only downside was that David (the owner) wasn't there when we went in for our 10th anniversary -- he is such a great host and neat guy (I guess he can't be there ALL the time).

My husband and I were all excited to go out for our 32 Wedding Anniversary. We arrived and were 10 minutes late due to missing our exit on 280. When we arrived we had to wait 45 minutes for a table that we made reservations for that night. When we got to our table no water or bread or even a hello came for 15 minutes. Our food was good but we waited for a very long time for that as well. When we recieved our bill thy charged us for a $60 bottle of wine we did not even order. The view was spectacular but not sure we will return again.
Great service at a wonderful neighborhood friendly spot! Will definitely return

On this visit - I went with a co worker that was celebrating a birthday. Having been to Benihana's before knew it would be an enjoyable experience. I can say on my previous visit had an much more interactive an entertaining chef then with this visit. He wasn't bad but the chicken was cooked a bit too long and wasn't as engaging. The waiter more than made up for the chef! Very responsive and friendly. I certainly would recommend Benihana's for a fun time with friends or on an date with a nice ambiance and very reasonable pricing.

Chef was new so he wasn't good at the usual display of showmanship. However he did take suggestions as to how to prepare the food so it wasn't bland. Benihana concord is a very good restaurant and we enjoy celebrating birthdays.

column4: 10123 N Wolfe Rd Suite #2074 Cupertino, CA  95014
column13: We always have a good time at your place! The only problem we had was that we had a reservation at 430.We didnt get seated for almost 40 minutes. They took two groups off the street in front of us? When I mentioned I had a reservation the guy said he didnt know?? Instead of making it right he seemed to want to make sure we knew that he had just started work. I told him its there on the paper? That was at twenty minutes and another 20 minutes went by before he would even talk to me?? So he asks what is your name again (for the third time)....really?? Anyway a little embarrassing fo me in front of my party but the chef and waiter were perfect!sincerely, Eric Miller our visit was 10/7/12 at 430 in Cupertino

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: My kids love Benihana, and it's not hard to see why. The food is consistently good and served in generous portions, the service is always friendly & welcoming (albeit a little slow occasionally), and the chefs always put on a fun performance. We went there for my son's birthday with a bunch of his 12-year old friends, who were all fairly noisy. The staff & chef were unfazed, and provided a really nice evening for everyone. I would recommend Benihana to any family with kids looking to have a fun evening.
Way too loud, couldn't hear conversation with others at our table. Remodel looks nice, but they forgot sound dampening.
Food was very good but not on par with other similarly priced restaurants.
Always my favorite when I am in SF. This time I brought my teenage kids and they said it was best food they had ever eaten. Biggest hit were the lettuce wraps and the firecracker shrimp.
Enjoyed a lovely meal before a concert at the Masonic Auditorium. Service was great. Food was excellent.
I really enjoyed the brunch from the Travelzoo deal. I ordered the eggs benedict and they were very tasty. Bottomless mimosas for $5 with the Travelzoo deal= Yay!!
glad that my reservation notes were fulfilled when we received kid's menus; waitress was Ok but didn't order the right thing for one of the children

Went with a Gilt City voucher for a prix fixe meal. Given the price, was very impressed that the prix fixe didn't come across as cutting corners -- a great app of gnocchi with squash blossoms, baby squashes and cherry tomatoes or a corn soup that was smooth as silk. For main course, had the pork chop (which was actually a double chop) cooked perfectly with a barley/almond side. Dessert was OK butterscotch pudding. The wine we chose was a Rhone - Vindemio "Imagine" - which was pretty good. Probably would have benefited from aging a bit longer/decanting but enjoyable. Really enjoyed the evening, nice spot that also has outdoor area.

All the steaks we had were very good. The filet, NY strip and ribeye were each cooked perfectly to order and had their own character and flavor. The apps and sides were just ok. Wines by the glass are just ok. They mix a good Manhattan. Good location for business meal. We had very good service.
Surprisingly good gumbo, great small venue to hear music, good service.
This place is fantastic. The food is spectacular and the vibe is super fun. It's within walking distance of the Muni station in Castro which makes it even better for those Sunday brunch trips.

This place used to have the best gambas. Now, it seems to be too busy for the chefs or the chef changed. Food was decent but it used to be better. Was really looking forward to dinner and now sad that the flavor is gone.

column4: 1130 Market Street, 10 UN Plaza, 6th Floor San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Delicious and absolutely lovely.
Great food. Attentive service. Decor and atmosphere weren't there: a bit sterile.

We were a group of 5 dinning at Bistro 1907 for a special occasion dinner and were extremely disappointed. The ambiance is charming; the wait staff friendly and professional but the evening went downhill from there.
A non-assuming bistro with impressive menu and presentation, all for a moderate price. A rare find in the area.
Great time! Perfect place to have dinner with friends before going out! Our server Nick was cute too.

column4: 160 Jefferson St, Upper Level San Francisco, CA  94133
column13: A historic, "touristy" place in the middle of the Wharf district. Excellent views of the bay, and great value. Where Sourdough began!!!

First timer. Live in the Richmond and had not heard about this place. Great find on Open Table. Very friendly staff and service was great. Food was outstanding and a real taste of France. I will be back.

The food was terrific. Try the ravioli but ask for both red and white sauce. You will be amazed with the white sauce. The food preparation was excellent and very tasty. Definitely a great restaurant for food.The waiter was very knowledgeable and very helpful with the menu selections. As the restaurant was very busy, his service was was not acceptable. We waited an inordinate amount of time for someone to finally come to the table to welcome us and ask for beverage orders. After the entrees were delivered we were asked if we wanted pepper and Parmesan cheese, we said yes, they never arrived. I give the service a fair rating only because of the waiter's knowledge.I recommend only for the food.I would try again to see if the service improv

Weekday lunches were nice, but on crowded evenings (esp. Saturday night,) the noise level of the restaurant makes table conversation very difficult. The tables are too close together.However, the cuisine is excellent. Service is friendly, but seemed a bit short staffed for the weekend crowd.
Great food and service. Noise level was so loud my husband and I could not have a conversation without shouting. Do not go on the weekend and ask for a table out side. That may help some.
This was a welcome surprise, the entire dining experience was above our expectation! Food was really good and the service was impeccable. Would recommend this to my friends.

column4: 641 Santa Cruz Avenue Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Authentic french food the escargots and the coq au vin were to die for highly recommend bistro vida for authentic french fare .

We were promptly seated at banquette and perused the myriad of unusual foreign and domestic wines by the glass, carafe or bottle. Our waitperson gave me sample of lovely Sancerre to compare to the French Chablis (her first suggestion was right on). We then had appetizer salad split for the two of us. and salmon entree (6oz) with crisp skin and juicy interior medium rare and some fish tacos. A side of perfectly prepared brussel sprouts ($6) accompanied the meal. The chef, owner, visited our table and answered some questions. We were too full to have dessert. Cost incl. tip and carafe of wine was than $80. We feel privileged to being served a meal that in a different setting would have cost 50% more. A true neighborhood gem fit for foo

Located in an alley in the Financial district of San Francisco BIX has a supper club type atmosphere. Service was excellent as was most of the food. Limited wine menue. My only criticism was the food presentation - quite lacking and unappealing. Salad dressing was oily.

column4: 1011 Blossom Hill Rd. San Jose, CA  95123
column13: Had a reservation for 6:30 but not seated until 7..very crowded..service slow compared to previous visits..waiter helpful...

The food was very good as always. The waitress brought our appetizer quickly and our salads but then proceeded to bring out our main entree just after giving us our salads. We didn't have time to finish the salad before the main course came out. She needed better timing. But overall very good.
For a chain restaurant, the food is consistently good and a good value for what you get.

column4: 3195 N. Main Street Pleasant Hill, CA  94523
column13: Service in the bar area by the girl with the lisp was very slow, she was not very nice, simple things like having to ask for bread with the meal.
Nice Steakhouse, good food & good service. Like the layout of tables, your not on top of each other and booths give you privacy in a large resturant.

column4: 740 E. El Camino Real Sunnyvale, CA  94087
column13: We have dined at Black Angus a whole lot of times. They put out these great coupons that are really great. The coupons are meals that include appetizers, meal, and dessert that two people can share and still make individual choices at the same time. There were quite a few guests this time and we were able to split up and use the coupon effectively. We were able to get a variety of desserts and appetizers to share. It was really nice.
The filet and prawns tasted very good.
The food was good. The bar and dining area was really noisy. Hard to talk over dinner.

I I didn't realize how casual this place was. I expected a coolHot spot. But it wasn't. Bright lights, paper menus withfood spatters- need I say more? I also felt like they were 'nickel and diming' me in the sense that I kept getting charged for tea bags and the sparkling water was an already openedNOT Voss water. But of course, they charged as if it were.

column1: Blowfish Sushi to Die For - SF
column13: I always enjoy going to Blowfish, although this time the service was less than desirable. We ordered 3 rolls, and after a long wait for 2 of the 3 rolls and a reminder to our waitress that we ordered 3 rolls, we were told that we only ordered 2. Not True! After reviewing her notes, she finally realized that indeed we ordered 3. She was apologetic, but it was not the standard of service that blowfish usually offers.

column1: Blowfish Sushi to Die For, San Jose
column13: Took 15 minutes to get water and another 15 minutes to get a drink. Food was good for the most part, but the Tokyo Ceviche was not worth it. All cucumber and very little fish & crab. Not worth $14. The sake list is good, but again the glasses are very small and expensive. Sushi is too expensive in general to put up with this kind of treatment. Nobu they are not!

column4: 747 Market St, 4th Floor San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: What happened to this place? Empty in the middle of the Open World conference? They once boasted an all star chef and innovative cuisine. Now they are slinging sandwiches that pale to the corner deli's. At the Four Seasons no less. And even with an empty dining room, they still manage to be painfully slow. The club sandwich, at $12 something, was not even a proper club. No double decker quartered classic here. You'll get composite, gelatin-fused turkey breast between two scraps of toast Wonder wouldn't even claim. Lame. They did fair better on the appetizer end: the chips and guacamole we decent, though how are you supposed to dip a chip in a salsa that comes in something the size of a shot glass? Brought a party of 9. Wish I hadn't.
The chicken in both entrees was DRY. SO VERY DRY. Surprising at lunch at the beginning of service. Unless it was leftover ?
Grasshopper role, yum.....reasonably priced, good food.
Always fun with big portions of yummy food & great drinks!
Still the best Fried chicken in San Francisco. I love this place, especially on a chilly night when I need some comfort food.
Special Drinks at the bar like the Lychee Martini were delicious and different!

column4: ONE Yerba Buena Lane San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: This is our new favorite place. We were more than pleasantly surprised to find out that their butcher is in-house. I highly recommend the Chef's special meat tray and cheese tray. By far the best pairings I have seen in awhile! We will be going back many times.
Great neighborhood spot, food is very good, service is great, and the vibe is very cool and casual. Not a scene (in a good way) like their neighbor!

I came on Tuesday, October 2nd to celebrate my anniversary with my significant other. The food was delicious and the portion was moderate. Not to mention the good service and the drinks. The only thing that i can complain about is the air conditioning. We were sitted on the 3rd level, I liked my spot but it was very unpleasant to have a great dinner, great service at a great location and poor air conditioning. I believe they had to open the door to have some air come in.

column1: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
column13: We had a large party of eight men and our service was excellent. As for the food, when all eight or us took our first bite of the meat, you could see smiles from ear to ear on each and every one of us. Outstanding! Wine List is very good. Would also recommend the chopped up lobster meat sautéed in garlic and butter sauce as side to be shared by the table. Can't wait to go back and eat there again.

Had a great meal as always; really appreciate that our server went over to Boca to get chocolate cake for our younger son since the pizzeria ran out! Hubby and I fought over who got to eat the leftover pizza for lunch (I won!) Will definitely return.

column1: Boca Pizzeria, Village Mall at Corte Madera
column13: I thought this was a great lunch stop. Good food, good service, and reasonable prices. I will definitely go back.
Just underwhelms in all respects relative to the price.

Outstanding food, sort of semi-tapas style, family style really. "Huarache" was incredible, ribeye was great, fried green tomatoes were delicious. But the croissant-based (brilliant idea!) bread pudding was one of the best desserts I have ever had anywhere. drooling as I remember..
not a good restaurant experience-would not recommend or go there again.- hostess was also waitress & bartender-terrible drinks, ok service,medium food. Paper napkins at dinner? Really? Wake up!

Second time here, and we come to see and hear Juke Joint. Food issues? Well, five tiny shrimp and a trace of pancetta for twelve bucks? Come on, get real. Pasta was fairly tasteless despite overdose of oil. The seabass was very good and a major value (our daughter paid $32 at Gather) but WAY too much oil bathing the entire plate. Thanks for the "sale" on Racer 5, it was excellent. Service was pretty bad, I actually had to go to the bar to get the beer which our waiter forgot. The very nice server at the pick-up end brought it to our table. I guess I would not come here for the food, but Juke Joint is worth the effort.

Service was good, but the food was not. The hanger steak was very tough.I also did not like the way I was forced to choose a tip of 0, 15, 20, or 25%. The serving staff deserved 15%, but the kitchen did not.

column4: 651 H Maloney Street Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Small one room restaurant with great food.

column1: The Boon Fly Cafe - The Carneros Inn
column13: Cute place, kind of a barn theme but clean and modern. We were wined out from tasting and the cocktails were a nice change of pace. Best fried chicken I have ever had! I would come back just for that. It is a half chicken so could easily be shared.
A nice neighborhood restaurant. The food is good and the cuisine is different. Service is very friendly.
Great little restaurant. Interesting food great service

column4: 6525 Washington Street Suite A9 Yountville, CA  94599
column13: Everytime my husband and I go to Bottega I am ever more in love with it. Every experience has been wonderful and my parents and brother had the best time there. thank you.
Great for brunch! Awesome deal on mimosas and amazing food. The kitchen was incredibly backed up and service was slow. Good for the leisurely brunch but some patience required.

Terrific little hole in the wall type find near union square. Food and wines by the glass very good and very reasonably priced. Walking past the frenetic narrow kitchen and waiters running up and down the steep stairs to the dining area all part of a great experience. Only small complaint would be lighting, dim candlelight may be romantic but does not do the food justice. People adjacent were using their iphones to read the menu and see their food. Dont let this deter you, the food is tres bon.
From food to service, immpecable as always!

We had not been to Boulevards in several years and what a mistake. It was better than I remembered and will be back again soon. It's worth the price since every single thing was a 10+. We shared the scallop appetizer-to die for and I could have eaten 10! I had the lobster/clam bake-OK the portion size was tiny (this isn't Maine after all) but it was so incredibly tasty that by slowing down and savoring each bite, I actually felt full. Boulevards has staying power for a reason-it's top notch in every area from the service to the pace to the food. This was an anniversary dinner and they gave us a great table and beautiful dessert (complimentary).Run don't walk for dinner or lunch but you do need a reservation.

My husband and I had a wonderful dinner on Saturday night. The service was impeccable. The food fit for a 'King'. The room is beautiful and you can hear yourselves talk, the acoustics are well done. Bourbon Steak is not for the faint of heart when it comes to price, however, you don't eat here every day. For special occasions it is worth the price.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Southern comfort food, cooked perfectly, seasoned carefully, and absolutely mouthwatering. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. I've been here several times and I never regret it!

When I arrived at 8:15pm, there was noone at the front desk. Waited around about 2-3 minutes, then peeked into the restaurant and there was no one dining. Guess is was slow for a Monday so the Maitre'd had other things to do. Looked like everybody was dining in the lounge so I ended up eating in the there as well. There was only 1 hard working server to take care of 20 tables so service was a little slow.
It's okay and cheap if you are in the Castro and happen to want Chinese food. There is nothing bad about it but nothing in particular to recommend it, either.

We went to Brandy Ho's for dinner two of the three nights of our honeymoon in San Francisco-and we wish we had gone there all three nights! The food was wonderful, full of flavor and promptly served. We especially enjoyed the dish Brandy's Dinner, but really everything we tried was great. Wish we could take this restaurant back home with us.

We went to celebrate our 11th anniversary.I'd shared this fact in my reservation request and the greeter was very nice about acknowledging us. The dinner, however, was a big disappointment. My husband's fish was too salty and my pulled pork sandwich was w/o bbq sauce. When I asked for some, she said that they didn't have any. A generous amount of pork, just no sauce!! Our carrot cake dessert was exotic in its design, but disappointing in its delivery. For the price, we'll head elsewhere.
Great food, great service!
really enjoyed lunch at this place. Good food, excellent service, nice ambience and reasonable prices

column4: 1050 Contra Costa Blvd Pleasant Hill, CA  94523
column13: great little Italian restaurant. good for couple for special occasion.

column4: 55 Tamal Vista Blvd Corte Madera, CA  94925
column13: My husband and I both enjoyed the welcoming and comfortable feel of the restaurant. The oyster sliders and the gnocchi starters were perfect.
Limited overpriced food served a la carte.Rude waitress.Items on menu not available.
We throughly enjoyed the dining experience. Great menu selection. Great service.
One of my "Go-To" spots when I'm visiting San Francisco.
Food was unusual but good - waitstaff wasn't the friendliest in the world and wasn't very willing to accomodate special dietary requests.
Great to watch Stanford game with bunch of buddies.
Nice dinner with good live music entertainment.
Very fun experience for my Birthday with about 12 people. The servers weren't the friendliest, but the hostess was great and the bubbles were delicious. Live music which was very fun.

We ordered three kind of pasta. It came out good but two of them are lack of sauce. The waiter fixed it right away when we made complaint. Overall, pretty good meal for 7 of us. $180 included tip, tax, meal!! pretty good price for Italian restaurant!

We had a party of 8 and were rushed the entire meal. One of the people at our table were still eating and they cleared our plates. Then they asked us if we could leave because another party was coming soon. Food was fine but the service was lacking.
Food has great flavor and abundant. Our server was exceptional. Good time, great value and love to go there and will go back. When we return we will ask for the server Megan again.

column1: Buca di Beppo - San Jose - Oakridge
column4: 925 Blossom Hill Road Oakridge Mall Suite 1529 San Jose, CA  95123
column13: What a surprise! I'm a runner and had a 20 mile run planned for Saturday. Of course, that means carbo loading with pasta on Friday. We stumbled on Buca because our normal "go to" pasta places meant waiting an hour for a table. I found Buca on Open Table, was able to get in. It's a family place that exudes Italian heritage. First, the host and wait staff were incredibly friendly & inviting. Second, the food was out in seconds. Third, and most important, the food was actually really good. It's not gourmet, but it's good Italian comfort food. Fourth, it's reasonably priced. We haven't gotten out of a restaurant with a bill that small in ages. Thanks to Buca I had a great run the next day, ended up doing 21 miles. How Fun!

We asked for a booth in the bar and we were happy to get one. We all ordered burgers, which were good. The service was slower than I have ever had at the Buckeye and it was actually a slower Sunday night. Perhaps our waitress was new. We had to wait about 20 mins before our order was even taken and we waited about 45mins for our food.

column4: 44 E Blithedale Avenue Mill Valley, CA  94941
column13: Chef Robert prepared a very tasty vegan dish, the kids food was top quality and our waitress was very attentive.Bunglow 44 is consistently the best restaurant in Mill Valley.

column4: 224 Grand Avenue South San Francisco, CA  94080
column13: This is a great place to go if your meeting a group of people halfway between the South Bay and the North Bay! The wait staff is fabulous, food is good, but they neglected to read the comments section I submitted when I made the reservation. It was my husbands birthday and they didn't acknowledge it let alone bring out the birthday dessert. But I'll still go back. It's a great neighborhood place and always fun!

The food was excellent, the service was second to none and the private booths make for a great dining experience. You can actually have a conversation. Afterward or before there is a phenomenal bar to grab a speciality cocktail and listen to some Jazz. I highly recommend it!

Bushido is an izakaya restaurant that offers tapas style dining on Castro Street in old town Mountain View. The menu offers a nice variety of sushi and rolls and cooked food. Try the sashimi platter which offers items more exotic than the standard tuna or yellowtail. The mushroom fried rice was good, but could be better if it had more mushrooms in it. The pork cutlet curry was quite tender with the perfect amount of breaking. On Wednesday nights, most of the cold sakes are half off. A great value! Try the three tasting flight which comes with a geneour pour. The staff are friendly and knowledgable. Be adventurous and try things you normally wouldn't at a Japanese restaurant.

column4: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay Street San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Butterfly is one of my go-to restaurants, great food, lovely ambience, consistent service.
our first time at Ca Bianca, tucked away in a side street of downtown Santa Rosa - exdellent service, and well presented food. Worth a visit definitely.

column4: 610 First Street Oxbow Public Market Napa, CA  94559
column13: We are locals and will definitely be frequenting Ca' Momi Enoteca! Our waitress was a lot of fun, the food was fantastic and definitely the best pizza we've had in a very long time.

Lunch was tasty. Service was excellent and attentive. My companion was waiting to eat her salad until my entree arrived and another waiter noticed and asked us if we'd like our entrees brought immediately. Salad Nicoise exactly as you would expect. Nice wine list. Tasty french fries, very garlicky sauce though.
I go there often and they always have great service and delicious food.I would recommend it.

We can always count on a good meal at Cafe Campbell. My calamari steak was cooked perfectly, very tender and a nice sauce. The service is attentive and very nice - we are treated like a long, lost friend everytime we go there for dinner.
Went with my new fiancé the first night of our engagement trip in San Fran and it was wonderful!
Good breakfast with a nice French feel.

The menu has changed since my last dinner at Cafe Des Amis. It is less expensive. I think this is an improvement as the food is still delicious but no so foo foo. I think this will open itself to a larger audience. It is a great looking restaurant with a vibrant Brasserie feel. A good fit for Union street and worth the visit.
The pizza was edible. Had way better. Our server was Mr No Personality. Must of had a real bad day.....

It was my second time there, so I wasn't particularly surprised, but everything was as good as I remembered. Wait staff can be a bit overly familiar at times, but the service was excellent. The food is terrific, and the menu extensive, varied and interesting. The decor is lovely, as is the view, especially after dark. It was my mother's birthday, and they brought her a piece of flourless chocolate cake (with a candle and a happy birthday song) that was one of the best I've ever tasted. It was a wonderful dining out experience, and I'll definitely be back.
We had the pork chop and the pork ragu tagliatelle which were both EXCELLENT! The salads were also fantastic. Service was very good and friendly.
love this place, i keep coming back to it .... servers are great & food excellent :)

This place is obviously loved by the locals and tourists who try it for the first time - they all keep coming back. The food is fantastic, prices are reasonable and the decor and ambiance fit this open grill restaurant - a great option to the other restaurants on the wharf. It's a busy place on Saturday night so make sure you reserve.
I'd go back. Waiter made a good suggestion re: a glass of red wine. Friendly staff--moved me when I said sun was in my eyes and uncomfortable. Fast service.
I wouldn't bring a large group, because as usual they are jerks about splitting checks. Everything else wonderful.
Great quality of food for amazing prices! Service a bit slow, but ok!
The pasta was undercooked. The service was not great.
Cafe Torre has a nice wine list, but does not have mixed drinks. While Cafe Torre has pasta without animal products, it would be nice if Cafe Torre would add a true vegan entree.

A lovely find tucked away in the quieter part of San Mateo (where it's easy to park). Food was very good, and you can't beat the prix fixe menu for price.. A very pleasant Algerian wine by the glass complemented the delicious tajine. Fantastic creme brûlée. Very enjoyable, good service, fresh food with delicate spices, casual but upscale.

We were able to make a reservation Saturday afternoon for that evening and got right in when we arrived. Wait staff were friendly and helpful. Food was average. We were not able to visit much at our table as the tables are placed in close relation and it was quite noisy with all the energetic conversations going on.

Many thanks to the staff at Caffe Fiore for accommodating our ever increasing group on a busy Saturday night, all the way up to closing time. Service, food and wine list were great. Our group especially enjoyed the dozen different varieties of crostini and the pappardelle; I hated to share my orriciette which was served with a pleasantly spicy olive oil/broccoli rabe. Had one of each dessert - all pretty good, but the panna cotta was remarkable. Yum!

On one of the warmest nights of the year, we thoroughly enjoyed our meal in the patio of Riace...divine weather to remind one of Sicily. Service was fine, food good...halibut special and pasta Norma (with eggplant). Will return.
Stacey is hands-down the heart and soul of the restaurant. She made us feel at home and directed us on how and what to order.
Always a great meal with excellent service

Five women went for a birthday brunch. We felt like royalty with warm muffins and scones at the table, bottomless mimosas in with lavender, rosemary or raspberry-orange flavors, and a full and delightful menu. Everything was perfectly prepared and delicious. There was also a bottomless bloody mary choice with an open bar to prepare your favorite selection. The restaurant is wide open and unpretentious, with an expansive outdoors patio ringed with lavender. The chef is experimenting with new menu items--this morning there was a crepe with duck eggs and butternut squash that was a huge hit with our group. All in all a wonderful experience.

My husband and I had the steak as well as the PAELLA' .This was a great choice as they did a great job on both of them. The Paella' is only a summer dish and so one would want to go soon.We did share both and would of even been great to just share the Paella'. We had a light breakfast and no lunch that day so this hit the spot perfect.Our waiter was awesome

The food is excellent and the service was good. My only problem was that I had a reservation and the table was not ready when we arrived. We had to wait 30 minutes. I was not certain that having a reservation really made a difference. Part of the problem was that we had a table for seven and there were really only two tables that were available for a large party.
We had a great time Saturday night for our anniversary! The food was excellent, the service impeccable and the ambiance was fun. We sat by the kitchen and watched the chefs...5-stars!

Ate at Campanula on a Saturday night before seeing Beach Blanket Babylon. Everything was delicious and the service was very good. Our table was right next to the window with a view of colorful and active North Beach.
One of my best food experience in USA. Excellence service!!!!

This was my second dining experience at Canela. On both occasions my group arrived late. . .quite late the first time. . .but they accommodated us both times. Which is saying something since the first group consisted of 6 people, and meant holding open 3 tables. They primarily serve small plates and the portions are appropriate [but not generous]. So order accordingly and I would suggest sharing even the large plates. Last nigh we had the lobster, which was delicious. The garlicky shrimp appear to be a staple, signature dish, and are also very good. A nice wine list - probably the best one of any restaurant in that neighbourhood. The place fills up fast and, as is common in most restaurants, the noise level rises. I'll be back.
Simple, pure, perfectly executed food. Butter poached shrimp were the highlight.

column4: 651 E Blithedale Ave Mill Valley, CA  94941
column13: The food is always very good as is the service.Only problem was the young lady didn't mark us off as Open Table . I asked her twice and she just smiled.It's always very good.

The service was very personable, the maitre d went out of his way to make sure we were satisfied. The food is traditional italian and very dependable and very tasty. I had no negative comments and at an excellent price point. An overall fun experience.Would definitely come again

We love the place. My wife and I have gone twice and never regret it. We got the Chicken Risotto, which we think is really good. For drinks: wine (they always know what goes good with that), and for desert: Budino de Panne. M-M-M...delicious!

The food was very good and the service was outstanding. However, the prices for lunch was too expensive. Therefore, I wouldn't recommend Capers for lunch. I would instead recommend this place either for dinner or a very special occasion.

While there are no ocean views, the food at this eatery is excellent. There was a abundance of fresh dungeness crab in the crab cocktail I ordered. While I found the lobster ravioli to be a bit "sour" to the taste ( perhaps lemon was added which I do not care for ), the crab gnocci was superb. My husband and I both loved the margherita pizza ( the restaurant has a wide array of selections ) and our friends found their filet mignon cooked to perfection. We will most definitely return to Capurros the next time we visit S.F.
Fabulous eats! A great wine tasting too. We had a wonderful server and had a very nice evening. Would definitely go back.

The food here is amazing. Each small plate we ordered was skillfully prepared and tastefully presented. The fried olive appetizer and the mushroom flatbread with truffle oil were outstanding. There was not a bite of food that failed to satisfy the senses. The service was fabulous- the owner came to our table several times and was very helpful with wine selection suggestions. The ambiance was vibrant and the restaurant is small so when it is crowded noise can be a bit of a problem. When we requested a different table away from a loud group we were graciously accomodated. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Napa who really enjoys food.
Best mexican restaurant in the South Bay. We love it!! Highly recommend it to everyone!

We had a great time. We had dropped our daughters off at the shoreline for a concert and I googled places to eat so we could eat and hang during the show. It was perfect, fun and lively, in our age group and great food..
This is a real French restaurant, to be precise, real Nicois. French-Italian. Fabulous.
Had great time - service and food were excellent. My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary - the service and attention to detail were great. The food, wine, and libations were perfect.

I saw the review in the Chronicle and had to go to check it out, more than satisfied.Raved to my wife for months would be great and the food was fantastic.When previously in Cow Hollow, used to go to Izzy's - no more!!

column4: 500 Main St. Suite G Napa, CA  94559
column13: We had heard so much about this restaurant being wonderful before we visited. On the plus side we were seated immediately. On the minus side our waiter was somewhat abrupt and arrogant. We ordered an appetizer which was very good. My date ordered one of the specials and the waiter returned and told him that they were out of that dish and offered him 2 other choices. The appropriate thing would have been to apologize and return with a menu so he could choose from various options. The entrees were okay but they were far from stellar and I am pretty sure I would not go back to this restaurant or recommend it to others.
Nothing special about this restaurant. They serve basic good Mexican food and the service is good.
My wife and I like to use the vouchers we get from Travelzoo to try new places. If we like it, we will go back and bring some of our friends and we will be back with friends.
Wow! Another amazing dining experience. We will be back!

No one in our party of 6 had dined there before. We all thought our dinners were excellent. The service was superb, never an empty glass and he arrived before we needed to summon him for anything. We will all return... :)

We dined at Central Park Bistro early on a Sunday evening. There were not many people in the restaurant while we were there. Pleasant surroundings, good portion sizes, well-prepared food, and generally attentive service. Prices seemed reasonable for the quality. I would dine there again when I'm in the San Mateo area.

column4: 1332 Park St on Redwood Square Alameda, CA  94501
column13: They put us in small secluded alcove for our anniversary...made it feel special! Thanks

When we got to Cesario's they had no computer to tell if we even had a reservation. They were using a hand written sheet. Since we were carrying briefcases, we asked if they had somewhere to store them and they said no, we would have to keep them with us at the table. We had a reservation for 5 and they gave us a table for 6, but with everyone having briefcases, we asked if we could move a table up beside us for some more space and they refused. The tables themselves were completely inadequate for even 6 - everyone was squeezed in. We decided that this was not the dining experience we wanted so after reviewing the wine list and determining that it was not very good, we left $20 on the table and left for a much more pleasant dining venu

column4: 845 Main Street Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: Every time we visit, we are treated like cherished friends;even when the restaurant is bustling. The starters are always fresh and with a touch of imagination, so there is always something new to excite the taste buds. The smoked lamb shank falls off the bone and the pork chop also tender and juicy. Desserts such as the rich chocolate bar and panacotta are the perfect ending to the evening. Staff is friendly,professional which makes the evening very special. Wines are reasonably priced and a true gem is the Liquid Sky Cab.

column4: 405 N San Pedro Rd San Rafael, CA  94903
column13: The noise level on a Saturday evening was intolerable. The attitude of staff was brusque and unprofessional. The food was mediocre at best. We couldn't wait to finish dinner and leave.
Great smoked Albacore Tuna!Good atmosphere for dates!

As a restaurant manager in San Francisco who dines out very frequently, it's rare that a restaurant is so wonderful that it makes me completely forget what I do for a living. We've eaten almost everywhere in this city, and this is easily in the top five. Initially, it feels like an ordinary Richmond/Sunset restaurant, with an unremarkable interior. It's tasteful, but feels almost minimalist, with none of the French Bistro detail of L'Ardoise, Des Amis, Cafe Claude, etc... The service is friendly and prompt as it should be. The food is absolutely off the chart good. Duck Cassoulet and Skate Wing. WOW.

column4: 132 The Embarcadero (between Mission & Howard) San Francisco, CA  94105
column13: have had spotty service -- bring wrong lunch entree, spill wine, etc.They did attempt to make up for the mistakes -- provided a complementary salad while the others in the party ate lunch while it was hot; poured a splash of wine that was spilled. I may or may not recommend Chaya. I'd likely suggest other places first. This lunch was a result of a voucher provided for my last visit where service was spotty.

I find that the selection was quite limited. I ordered the pork chop, as recommended by our waiter. It was only mediocre, nothing extraordinary about it. It is something I can make it at home. My brother had the lobster taggliotelle. I had tried a little of his, it was rich and tasty. the portion is a third of what normal size should be. It cost $22, too expensive considered he wasn't even half full. My sister had the gumbo, its portion was small tooeven though she ordered the larger size. I t was served in a wide rimmed fancy soup bowl with very little food in it. Besides, the gumbo came out Lukewarm, which is not at all acceptable.The Beignet appetitizer is a disaster. The custard filling is just wrong when it oozes out of the beign

Outstanding food and wine. The food portions are generous and the service was great. The outdoor tables could use an upgrade though. The chef is delightful. I will definately be back soon. I suggest anyone in the bay area make the drive to Lafayette to try Chevalier.
Excellent food and service,only after being seated.

This restaurant is good but it lacks the 'wow factor'. The set menu is a good idea, only if you like what is in offer as there is no choice and I would recommend checking in advance what is being served. This may be difficult to do given the advance booking requirement and difficulty in getting a reservation. On this particular evening we started with Gazpacho which I can take or leave, followed by a lovely Pasta dish and the entree was Lamb which was terrific. I am Irish and we like to think that we raise the best Lamb on the planet so my praise is not given lightly.Overall I suppose I was slightly disappointed, but I would go back.

We were very please with just about everything. The food was excellent and the place is quaint and unassuming. We loved it. The only thing I was disappointed about was the fact that I mentioned we were celebrating our anniversary and they didn't say a word about it. I guess they didn't bother to read the message. That aside, we'll definitely be back. Even our 6 year old insists we have to back soon.

column1: Chez Papa Resto at Mint Plaza
column13: Food was nothing special. Ambiance was somewhat swanky.

To write a review for a restaurant is always difficult because the experience is always related to the food. I have been to Chez Spencer few times. The first time was a great revelation, it was really what I was looking for: a real French restaurant in San Francisco, the manager was speaking in French, the food I chose was great and I felt to be in France. This last time I came to Chez Spencer I chose a roast duck which was a bit difficult to eat because it was full of fat and therefore was a bad choice. Further more I left the restaurant still hungry but I had two bread rolls..The menu' was a bit poor and not many choices. The champagne was tasty.
We have dined at Chez TJ a number of times over the years & we thought this was the best meal of all. Everything was perfect & very well prepared. Can't wait to go again for a special occasion.

Beautiful interior and nice bar. Hardly ever saw our waitress after we placed our orders. We sat next to the kitchen and saw our dishes sitting on the hot plate for 20 minutes before they were served to us....by the hostess! Other employees, including the manager, looked at our dishes and didn't even serve them to us! My gnocchi was mushy and the bolognese sauce was practically meatless. My husband said his pasta was sticky and mushy also. When it came to refills on our drinks, we had to stop a waiter who wasn't even ours. After trying this place and Muscios here in Novato, this town definitely lacks a good, authentic Italian restaurant! I'll be sure NOT to bring my Italian in-laws here because I'm sure they'd curse out the staff!

We had an amazing time at this restaurant! Our first time there and our server explained everything to us really well. By the end of the night, we were so full! We were also celebrating a birthday so our server took a picture of us and gave us a little memory to take home. We will certainly be going back!

The food st Chotto's is creative, modern Japaneses and superbly prepared and tasty. Good selections of saki. The decor is modern and energetic and the staff young, professional and fun. A gret place for either a date or with a group in an upscale lively urban scene in the Marina. Highly recommended.
Very enjoyable evening. Table next to ours was very loud. Room is very small
Great food and service.Wonderful neighbood feeling on Fillmore.

The food at Cin-Cin continues to be excellent. We started with the flatbread appetizer, adding the optional Serrano ham, it was so good. The beef short rib and halibut were also incredibly good. The noise is still a bit of a problem but eating early and not sitting in the middle of the room helped. The food is just so good we decided to put up with the noise. I'm so glad we did because we had a great experience.

column1: Cindy Pawlcyn's Wood Grill & Wine Bar
column13: We ate there for both lunch and dinner. Our lunch outside in the garde was fabulous. We had the oysters on the half shell and an array of appetizers. For dinner the next night, we ate indoors. That too was lovely and the dinner menu and extensive wine list made it difficult to chose. Everything was delicious and served by a wonderful waiter who helped make suggestions that were outstanding!

Great food overall, and the service was good. I would recommend a few things, a. heaters outside (it was very cold for us, but we enjoyed the outside environment) and b. I wish the staff smiled more and chatted with you a bit more. Other than that, I had a great experience...

Went with a couple native San Franciscians. Though the majority of patrons were tourist, the ambiance was great. The food and our server were great. Our server was informative and personable. As a local, I would go again, which shd speak enough as to the quality of he environment and food.
I love Emerson the Bar Manager....he's the reason we go!!!

The space was perfect for our boisterous group of 7. We didn't have to worry about bothering other diners since we were in a separate alcove. While some of the dishes were quite good (ceviche and curried mussels appetizers, and the side of grits were the favorites) others just seemed to miss the mark (absinthe spinach was odd, crab soup had shells). Short ribs tasted great, but the plating was unappealing. The filet looked beautiful, but wasn't all that special in flavor. Service was incredibly slow. Overall, I expected more out of this place based on the price and other reviews and the promising menu.

column4: 55 Cyril Magnin Street San Francisco, CA  94102
column13: We really enjoyed and will be returning soon.
Great food, great service, could use a more extensive wine list.

column1: Clay Oven Cuisine of India - San Mateo
column13: On Friday night, the restaurant was very relaxing place to dine for a family with a small child. The food was delicious and we were very satisfied.
