Comfortable environment; nice presentation of food dishes down to the salad with three dressing choices was positive.Only negative feedback was hostess seated me for a 9:30p reservation and she informs me they are about to close the kitchen; I must hurry and order my food. Disappointedly, I was hoping to relax to have a nice dinner and read the newspaper. They don't close until 10:30p. However, aside from 1 other couple in the restaurant section, I was the only other patron eating at the time.I felt rushed. After ordering, though, the hostess/waitress was courteous.As to food, mild dishes still were a little spicy.I was passing through Vacaville for the night. Nice restaurant if you like Indian food. Convenient to freeway.

column1: Clay Oven Indian Restaurant - West Portal
column4: 385 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: We have been visiting India Clay Oven restaurants in the SF area for 20+ years now.... and we still come back on a regular basis.This particular location is our new go-to since it's the easiest to get to now. We love the food, the portion sizes are average and the price is par for San Francisco too.

Lovely little spot, but the food seemed "only okay" to me. Excellent naan, the lamb was tender, the tandoori chicken fine - so why would I not go back? I want a restaurant to really make me say "WOW" and this one did not. Big take out business, so maybe my taste buds were having a night off. I don't know.

column4: 18070 San Ramon Valley Blvd San Ramon, CA  94583
column13: I was looking for a new place to eat in San Ramon and happened upon modest neighborhood place with a distinct New Orleans touch. The staff was extremely attentive & even surprised my sweetheart with a birthday treat!

column4: 446 San Mateo Ave San Bruno, CA  94066
column13: I hadn't been here in a couple years so was surprised they had moved to a new location.Great looking facility and easy street parking. Got here an hour earlier than my reservation but the place was not full at all so they seated us immediately.Food was fantastic and was just non stop gluttony. Delicious!

column4: 350 Smith Ranch Rd San Rafael, CA  94903
column13: I have been there before and had better service and better food. this might have just been an off day. i ordered a steak salad and the steak was super tough and over cooked. the waiter never came back to check on me and i just ended up eating with a complaint. In the past the food has been excellent and the waiters very attentive. again, this was probably an off day. i was a server long ago and always like to follow the rule of checking in w/ the customer within 5 min to make sure all is good. but this did not happen.
Always a great experience. Food was delivered prompt with great flavored.

Excellent foodie food in a modern and unpretentious clean lined cozy atmosphere. Deep fried green beans with Aoili...yummy, Squash flower flat bread, light, crunchy crisp. Fresh catch of the day, pan seared salmon with a perfect caramelized crust and cooked to perfection served over a bed of cous cous...tasty. Very good experience overall. For a business lunch with 6 attendees, we arrived at 11:30am and the noise level was conducive to have a good conversation as their nice background music did not drown out our conversation.On a separate occasion sat at the bar with my wife had a lovely charcuterie platter with cheese and honey and a nice glass of pinot noir...we just ate a bunch of apps...all yummy...this place is consistent.

Food was very creative and presented beautifully. I recommend going to the COI website and looking up the menu. You can see all of the items planned for that night. My favorite item was the Emigh Ranch Lamb. I have never had such wonderful lamb. My second favorite was the Spot Prawn. It was prepared perfectly. I would recommend the wine pairings as Matias clearly has an incredible ability topick wines that went remarkedly well with each dish. Be prepared for a hefty bill at the end. If you are not in the 1% you will probably only want to go on a very special occasion.

We had a 8:15pm reservations. We showed up on time. We were not seated until 9:00pm. The service was slow and we were not served our dinner until 10:00pm. They were so sorry at the bad service that they comp the corkage fee. Great food! I am not sure I would recommend the restauant because of the service.
Colibri is one of the restaurants we visit every time we are in San Francisco. The guacamole is a must-order. And the chocolate cake is served warm and is delicious!

column1: Colombini Italian Cafe & Bistro - Nob Hill Hotel
column4: 835 Hyde Street Suite B San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: We ha e bene the re bifore but out return Washington very disappointing. Service was marginal at best - food ordered got mixed up, was to long between salad and main corse was way to long. 2 in out party ordered the salmon, online to be told later that they were out (this at 6:00pm).Unfortunately, we Will not return.
Very Nice restaurant. It was our first time and would return for sure.
Wonderful experience. Would come again and again and again...

Lovely experience throughout. We'd noted that one of us was a pescatarian and they had a special pescatarian menu brought to the table without us asking. When one dish on the menu included something that I didn't like they quickly agreed to substitute. Service was flawless. This was a splurge for us but we'll be back on another special occasion.
Love the ambiance. Food was better than expected for a bar. But the service for food was horrible. Only one dedicated waiter for the dining room. Took forever to get our orders taken.

One of my favorite restaurants to bring visitors from Europe. Gourmet Mexican food is not what people expect and are delighted. While more expensive than other Mexican restaurants, the ambiance of Santana Row add to the overall experience.

Lively atmosphere. Interesting and delicious food served with great timing. As soon as we finished one plate, another would magically appear. Hip, but friendly service. Minimal "cool attitude". Would go back. Lots of fun.
Great food, appropriate portions. I can eat good tasting food, be satisfied and not gain weight. Specials are always great. The regular menu is good standbys. We enjoy this restaurant each week.

The prices are unreasonably high. Some of the dishes were good and some were not. The chicken tinga tacos surprisingly bland. I had a seafood ceviche and it had very little seafood and lots and lots of onions - very hard to eat I felt like I wasted $14. The guacamole was good and the 24 hour carnitas was the best thing we had.
Nice place good staff, good food

We were a twosome going to celebrate a birthday with a nice dinner. The food was excellent but being a twosome we were seated along a row of too close 'tables-for-two'. We felt like we were seated with 4 of our closest strangers...and with the walls open to the outside it was difficult to hear as everyone had to speak loudly to be heard. I would definitely request a booth next time.
Delicious food and great service!!!!
great experince, food and the service were all excellent. Highly recommend

column4: 260 Capistrano Road Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: Had a wonderful meal, the food was excellent and the dessert was amazing.
A bit on expensive side but very good

column4: 544 West Alma Ave. San Jose, CA  95425
column13: We picked Crekside because we had a large group, 11 people, and we knew from past experience that they could accomopdate us comfortablyand that it would be quite enough that we could talk easily. The food was good and the service was fine.

column4: 344 El Camino Real San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: As usual, had a wonderful dinner at Creola! Thank you!

We have been to Crogan's three times over the past six months and have enjoyed it each time. We had various family members (all adult) with us and everyone enjoyed it as well. The menu is varied enough to please everyone and the prices are reasonable. The food has been pleasing though not always fabulous. I had the cod dish, which was ok but the fish was a little soft and the asparagus was a little hard. My husband had the fish and chips and he said it was better than any other he has had in the East Bay. The Brick Chicken was deemed fabulous. The chocolate brownie dessert was great! We had a reservation for Saturday night but didn't have to, there were tables and the place is pretty big inside, including a small sports bar. We'll be back!

Have to say I was disappointed. Highlight was the pot stickers and they were delicious.However, our main courses, beef with mushrooms and cashew chicken tasted as if they were made with the same sauce(Hoisun). There were too few cashews and the sauce was too salty as well as just didn't taste fresh. Although the beef was tender and juicy, same salty sauce tasted stale. Couldn't taste any other flavors but the sauce. I have never had cashew chicken with a heavy dark sauce before. Portions are ample and staff is nice. But, they need to revisit these two dishes. Would I come back? Yes, saw next table that they ordered a chicken with broccoli and it was in a light sauce so will try other entrees. Prices are reasonable.

column4: 510 San Anselmo Ave San Anselmo, CA  94960
column13: I love Cucina. The staff is amazing, and the food is highly notable. Always great specials available, and the food is FRESH!!!Wednesday nights are great for family, and the owner donates some profits to YES to support local schools. Great Deal!!!

We made a last minute reservation her for my daughters birthday- having never been before.The food was FANTASTIC!! My three kids are pretty picky and they loved the food and even tried a few new things!!The adults had a great time too, great food and a good wine selection.Will definitely be back.

column4: 845 Market Street, Suite 400, Westfield San Francisco Centre San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: The pizza was fantastic and very much like the pizza I've had in Italy. We were also excited about the pork belly tortelli, but were disappointed with what we got. Very little pork flavor and none of the wonderful melting succulence of properly cooked pork belly. The cocktails were very tasty, but I didn't recognize a few of the ingredients and when I asked the server to describe them, all she could tell us was that they were some kind of apertif. Overall, we enjoyed our meal and will most likely return.
Nice Boutique restaurant has pleasant service, reasonable prices and good food.

Combine fresh ingredients, culinary creativity, knowledgeable sommeliers, an extensive wine list, and immaculate service and you have Cyrus. What a tremendous experience. My wife and I had the 5 course tasting menu and wine pairing and we both left satisfied and in amazement. Come on, Michelin, these guys deserve that 3rd star!

Daffodil might have been great in its day, but that day is long gone. The interior is stuffy and outdated, which might contribute to the empty dining rooms. The menu offers fine selections, but the entrees are over- or under-seasoned and less than delicious. Nice affordable house wines.

This was our first visit to the Daily Grill...and we'll be back! The overall experience was great and capped off a perfect Sunday in San Francisco. Helpful, friendly waiter and staff....excellent food....generous pour of wines by the glass. Our salads were excellent [caesar]. I made an entree out of the Mac and Cheese side dish. Great atmosphere, just off Union Square in SFO.

column4: 6025 W. Las Positas Blvd Pleasanton, CA  94588
column13: One of my favorite restaurants in the Pleasanton area! Creative specials that change every day as well as a great menu in general. I never get tired of this spot!!
Garlic Dungeness Crab! Oh, yum! Funky menu! Busy place.
My second visit to Depot - we sat outside beside the swimming pool on a balmy night, and had an excellent meal. Food fresh and flavoursome - well done!

I have heard about the great food at Destino for several years now, but had not tried it until this past weekend. It certainly lived up to all the hype!! The food was delicious from the small plates to the little larger entrees, to the dessert! I am definitely going again to try the items on the menu I didn't get to try that evening. Exquisite!!
Have been to Didar before, food as good as always. Love the lamb chops! Looking forward to trying new menu options.

column4: 210 E. Main Street Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: My favorite restaurant in Los Gatos. We go here every week with our 2 frenchies.

Food was excellent, but service was medicore and slow, and it was not very busy for a Sunday night. Salad came after the main course, as if they forgot until the last minute. Water glasses were not refilled in a timely manner.
We love Divinos. One of the best places for authentic italian food on the peninsula!

column4: One Letterman Drive, Bldg D, Suite 150 San Francisco, CA  94129
column13: WOW...What a great find. The food and service was amazing. You could actually taste each individual ingredient which show the time, care and execution of each dish. The courses were well-timed and the staff working very well as a team to deliver excellent service.
Otherwise, this is a real neighborhood gem. The food is great and they have a few good beer choices that really compliment the menu.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Delicious food, especially smoked salmon preparation, fried green tomatoes, and chicken with peppers and potatoes. Fried Brussels sprouts wereVery good as well. Nice attentive service. Rolatini of eggplant was a disappointment. On a previous visit it was lighter and fresher tasting.
A wonderful dining experience. One of our favorite restaurants in thew Napa Valley

The food was not spicy (hot). But is was absolutely delicious. I'm not sure why I was expecting fiery salsas, but I was very surprised and pleased not to have them, so that the seasoning could come through. Especially interesting, was the Budin de Elote (corn & zucchini pudding) - yum!!

Donato Enoteca is the best Italian restaurant on the Penninsula. We were very impressed by the fresh garlic/oil dip for the bread, warm olives, the excellent salads, fabulous pasta and a Skirt steak served just like we had in Milano. This is an excellent restaurant.

first time to this Dosa's on Fillmore....quite impressed with the ambiance, service, wait staff, good suggestions for dishes by our wait person....will now try their Sat/Sun brunch menu some weekend soon.
wow, by far the best Indian food I've ever had! Loved it!!!! Great everything. Ate too much!!!

column4: 2299 South El Camino Real San Mateo, CA  94403
column13: Fun place to eat great dosas, both veg and non-veg! There is no table service - you order at the "monitor" bar - yes, the menu is displayed on 4 monitor displays - easy to read and very cool - then find a table and it is brought to your table. The people behind the counter were very helpful at explaining the menu and making suggestions. There aren't a whole lot of tables but the turnover is fast because this is pretty much a "fast food" place. Food arrived hot and was excellent - they also have a few other non-dosa items on the menu.

My girlfriends and I went on Saturday evening. Although a busy night for the restaurant, we were seated in a timely manner and our server took care of our drink orders soon after we were seated. Our salads were excellent and our entrees were generous portions. We were all very pleased with our selections, and I must say you will not go away hungry. All in all we had a great visit with each other, and would go back for "Ladies night out" in the future.
Saturday farmers' market tasting menu was delicious
Ducca used to be a wonderful restaurant. Now just a hotel dining room.

column1: Duck Club at Lafayette Park Hotel
column13: If we had a friendlier, more attentive waiter, our experience would have been pleasant and relaxing. We had looked forward to celebrating my nephew's 30th birthday, and we had a party of 7 that included 2 very well behaved children (ages 4 & 7). Instead we spent a good amount of our 2.5 hour dinner looking for our waiter, waiting for him to come take our order, check on us, bring our dessert options, bring our bill. We would have be out of there in 2 hours but his inattentiveness added 30-45 minutes of wait time to our evening, which, for the amount of money we were paying, is unacceptable. We had 6:45 reservations, were seated promptly, but didn't leave until 9:15 pm!
Great for group dinner, noise level was just perfect for having a great dinner and a good conversation.

I have always enjoyed the Eclipse Restaurant. In the past, I frequented this restaurant often as a way to unwind from my job and reboot for difficult meetings. Until recently, I had not been at the Eclipse for several years yet, it still hold that same magnetism that kept me coming back in the past. The staff is great and they always ensure that patrons are provided high quality service. I for one always feel special at the Eclipse. Bravo!
It worked perfectly for our birthday celebration. The menu is very varied and everyone enjoyed their food. The highlight may have been our waitress who was friendly and attentive throughout our stay.
Sushi is always good here. service usually better, was very slow this night. I will keep going.
The food is good and we love their happy hour! $3 margaritas are a winner!

The service in this place is simply top-notch. There was an incredibly minor mixup with our reservation (our fault by the way, not theirs) and it resulted in them sending us FOUR free appetizers. It was amazing. We didn't even mind, it just meant more wine and time at the bar. The waiters, hostess and bartenders are all friendly and everything was efficient. It's also clear the waiters know and love the food.

Our introduction to Peruvian food was a pleasantly surprising one. The food was very authentic, no frou-frou extras to make it seem more "American". Everything was delicious and the service wonderful! El Hueco will be a part of our regular restaurant rotation.
We enjoyed our dining experience at El Mansour; however, the volume of the music made it very difficult to carry on conversations.

First time at El Paseo, and thoroughly enjoyed the meal and service. The setting couldn't be more romantic (okay, looking over the Siene, maybe, but for Mill Valley...). Our only mild irritation was receiving a dessert for my wife's birthday, then being charged for it on the bill. A bit tacky.
The food and service were outstanding

column4: 1677 N Main Street Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: The food and service was great. But so expensive. $10 cocktails and $27 for a cubed filet mignon. The filet was delicious but the price still hurt a bit at the end. Two entrees, two appetizers, and two drinks.....over $70.

column4: 2049 Fillmore St @ California San Francisco, CA  94115
column13: Aside from the extraordinary noise factor on a Sunday afternoon (we practically had to shout if we weren't seated directly across or next to one another; there were five of us), Elite provided good service and good food. It was not as expensive as I thought it would be, even with the added restaurant tax and the ubiquitous 18% (we were supposed to be six, but were five, and were still charged the 18%, which we would have given anyhow). The maitre d' was very gracious and the wait staff was excellent.
Small but interesting menu of classic Italian food
Table next to window to view America's Cup and Blue Angels. Prices are reasonable for this high level of quality setting and lunch options.

column1: Equus at the Fountain Grove Inn
column13: I had their entree special which was grilled scallops that was exceptional.The server was very mindful and caring.An overall great experience.I'm sure I'll dine there again.Great place to dine if your already catching a show at the Wells Fargo Center of the Arts!!

In general we had a very nice time at this restaurant. The food waas great and the service good. We were disturbed, however, by our neighboring diner who talked on his cell phone in Chinese for 15 minutes while waiting for his food to be served. We thought we were daved when the food came, but he started eating while he was talking! Soon, that proved fruitless and he gave up the conversation (whew!. We had a few laughs with the waiter about it, but I would have preferred if the resaurant had a policy of not using the cell phone (for phone calls) at the table.
Our dining experience Sunday evening was perfect in every way: excellent food, attentive waiter (Andrew) and a relaxing atmosphere. I had salmon and the pumpkin bread pudding (both outstanding).

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: The Palace of Meat! Everything was great, the service the food even the happy birthday song that my girlfriend ambushed me with the entire staff. Well worth the money but come hungry because it takes a hungry person to get a taste of all that is offered!

column4: 710 South B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: first time there, will not be the last time
All the food was excellent except the octopus appetizer. It was tough and flavorless.

column4: 99 East San Fernando Street San Jose, CA  95113
column13: We enjoy going early, pre-SJ Rep -- more intimate than later in the evening -- so just right for us. Great service and food.

The downstairs area is great for group reservations. I have booked both larger groups 10+ and smaller - under 10 and the space works for both. For groups of a smaller size - you can reserve a private room space enclosed in glass that feels really special. For smaller group size, I always let the owner choose our dishes after providing guidance about vegetarian and other needs. Each time it's been amazing. This meal in particular featured dishes I would never select - shrimp with fried apple, lobster soup, spare ribs, other yummy dishes that were phenomenal. My group was so pleased, they were glowing after the meal. After checking availability for your group on OpenTable - call restaurant and request this room.
The food is all great, but for the price, main course portions are lacking in size. You have to order a few courses for a satisfying meal.
They were very understaffed, 1 server on who was doing her best, manager prancing around, not helpful. Swing and a miss on service! Food was good.
FABULOUS! Food was fantastic and so was the ambiance. Loved it.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Love love love Farmer Browns. Great food, service and ambiance! As a destination or going to a show, it's a great way to start the evening! Cheers!
Remarkable menu beautifully prepared. Definitely a star experience with each course impeccably presented and delicious. it is the next notch in dining one would expect from a notable chef.

With only one exception, everything was very good to excellent. That exception was the noise. It was challenging to hear just across the table. Please, hang some sound absorption panels from the ceiling!
Food is just OK. I am afriad I am not going to return anytime soon.

Really nice, food was yummy and the service very very nice. It was a quiet night and warm enough to sit outside. I ran in to a guy who writes a food blog and he was back for his second time and was very positive. I will go back soon too.
Never disappointed in the food at Faz......love that you have the option of INDOOR or OUTDOOR DINING...

The restaurant had plenty of choices for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike. This is a Mediterranean restaurant but it felt like a mix of Mediterranean and American to us. We mostly ordered the mediterranean dishes and the food looked authentic and tasted great. I only wish the kids menu also had some mediterranean items in it. The adult items were very mild and the kids enjoyed the adult meals more than their own.

A very reliable business lunch, dinner and happy hour spot. A big league QB could throw a football and hit our Sunnyvale office from there, which means most everyone who has a meeting goes there. Our pizza, steak salad, and Greek salad were very good. They have extremely good kabobs, hummus, and Mediterranean specials there; and their happy hour mezze plate is excellent.
Not a good place for vegetarians, every sauce had some meat broth in it.

Many SF Bay Area restaurants make heroic stabs at cuisine creativity, but 5th Floor rises to the top. The experience starts with their far from standard cocktails, featuring blends of an array of standard and rarely used spirits with exciting flavors. These are accompanied by little taste treats that open the palate for what is to come. We were excited to have our routine taste sensibilities challenged by such juxtapositions as slices of New York steak accompanied by a delectable scoop of braised oxtails, or Dungeness crab fondue infused with a light touch of kaffir lime. The wine selection included some of our favorites, including a half bottle of 2009 Hirsch San Andreas Pinot Noir! Eat, drink and enjoy life!

column4: 5100 Clayton Rd Suite A14 Concord, CA  94521
column13: Delightful restaurant with attentive, not intrusive, service. Restaurant accommodates food preferences. Servers were cheerful, owner makes one feel special.

This was once my favourite neighbourhood restaurant. But food quality has now suffered the last several times we have eaten here. This time chicken over-cooked; beet salad mostly missing the beets; stringy, bitter greens.

column1: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
column4: 101 Cyril Magnin Street San Francisco, CA  94102
column13: I've been meaning to go to this place right near Union Square/Powell Street Station for several years. My date and I shared a delicious salad with mixed greens (mostly spinach), candied nuts, gorgonzola cheese, ...., crabcake sliders, salmon tartare, and lobster macaroni small plates. We'd also ordered a pecan crusted halibut as our waiter told us the appetizers were small, which they were not! After the salad, sliders and salmon, we asked if we could cancel the halibut. Fortunately, our waiter had waited to put that in until we'd gotten through the appetizers, so we were able to cancel it. That earned him points. It was plenty of food for two. For wine, we tried the Pinot Noir flight, which was very good - from medium to full bodied.
One of the great reasons to dine in SF - intimate, friendly service, and delicious food prepared with creative flair.

The food was excellent. The sommelier made an excellent wine recommendation. However, between our appetizer and entree the wait was over 1 hr. Also, we were seated outside and it was a bit cold even though there were heaters overhead.
Very ordinary food. View was best part of experience. Would not return.

column4: 10151 N. Cabrillo Highway El Granada, CA  94018
column13: Delicious food, carefully prepared and presented, including awesome desserts. Great service.

column4: 3607 Alameda de las Pulgas Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: The service was excellent, every course of the meal was heaven including the dessert! Will definitely be back.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Palo Alto
column4: 180 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94304
column13: The food was "ok" for advertising as a premiere steak house. The steaks were not seasoned well, and the famous potatoes were very greasy. I would go ahead and go to Alexanders for the price.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Walnut Creek
column4: 1685 Mt. Diablo Boulevard Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: food and ambience excellent. noise level in back room quiet. Room too coldyu
Champagne was flat,one fish course was a bit past its prime,too pricey for what we had.

We love the deco tile Floral Building & Flora continues the deco design inside. The sustainably sourced food is prepared well. The arugula, duck liver, frisee, fennel & walnut salad was perfectly dressed with just the right amount of a delicious banyuls vinaigrette. I personally would have liked even more fennel flavor, but lots of people don't, so they played it safe. The sea bass was moist. The pork chop was enormous. The standout entree was the sausage stuffed chicken breast with the chili oil sherry sauce. The combination of flavors was masterful. Desserts are rich beyond belief. The malt panna cotta hazelnut chocolate-porter ice cream was fantastic and the pistachio cake (like a cheesecake) was not far behind.
FLORIA has been a favorite from the time it opened. The food is always tops as is the service and ambiance. Thanks for another fine evening.
Delicious,Pasta galore!Order every starter.And order every dessert.The only place, you can really sit back and enjoy the moment.Every drink you order will be good.Every dish you order will be good!
Outstanding location, had wonderful seat by window, excellent service and food that was out of this world!
fantastic meal..will be back soon. enjoyed everything.
Excellent service and food. Have been there many times and will go again.
Felt like I was at a sales presentation when we were picking out our wine and meals.

column4: 206 N. Santa Cruz Ave. Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: An anniversary dinner at Forbes Mill is a special occasion. From the ambience to the wine list and excellently prepared food, Forbes Mill is such a treat. I'm already looking forward to my next meal there.

The thai food is very good. The pizzas are excellent, but the rest of the Italian food seems increasingly "odd" and limited. I had a caprese salad which was pre-made tomatoes and mozzarella was short of bad and EXPENSIVE. The pastas are limited unless you like their flavors. Meats, forget it. The Italian menu looks more and more limited
A fun time with delicious food and cool vibe.

Decidedly one of our favorite restaurants. The food is great as well as a great value. We are not desert people, but Jana, one of the owners, talked us into a seasonal pumpkin cake desert that was fantastic. Go there!

We were blown away on Saturday night by the food and service at Frances. Each dish was unique, flavorful and well-prepared. We had a 9:45 pm reservation which was honored with a very short wait but had a chance to talk with folks leaving the restaurant who said "it is a 10".... They were right.

I have been patronizing the Franciscan for years now. It is my favorite restaurant in the city, and because I am a native, I feel that I have very good taste in seafood, and restaurants.I cannot say more than I have in the past reviews I've submitted.

My wife and I have dined at Frantoio literally dozens of times over the past decade -- kind of a neighborhood standard. But dinner on Saturday was a disaster. Service very slow (it is never fast), my wife's beef was cold by the time it arrived -- and my appetizer and main course were frankly dreadful...I was up much of the night with indigestion.

My main course of pan seared grouper on a bed of lentils with arugula and cherry tomatoes was just outstanding! The chive beurre blanc in the recipe gave the dish a hint of tang. My husband ordered the Italian sausage risotto, and despite an extended conversation with the server before ordering, the dish initially had almost no sausage. But the server and the kitchen quickly added more and saved the day. My husband did love his Burrata caprese appetizer and my yellow pepper soup was very good. We each enjoyed one half of a blueberry peach cobbler. The evening's special pour of a glass of burgundy was great and the coffee at the end was also very good. All the staff members are warm and genuinely friendly without being overbearing.

Sat outside for lunch. Lot's of road noise, one waiter who I think was one of the owners so the service was a little thin. Couples with their kids got more attention because of the kids of course. Finally got the food and finally got the check. All in all, too much work for lunch. Should have brought a small high-maintenance child with us for better service.
The most amazing dining experience of my life. Each bite of food was perfection. The staff was hospitable and warm. The night was perfect. Experience surpassed expectations.
The food was great, the service was great, the seats were comfortable and the place is tastefully decorated. Only complaints would be the noise and the tepid soft rock on a loop.

We were given a table next to the waiter's station even when there were at least two other tables-for-two available. After asking the hostess to change us to a different table, he explained those tables were reserved. We left the restaurant and the tables were still unused. The food was mediocre. We tried a sampler of 3 ceviches. The one with coconut was weird: sweet ceviche? don't order it. The Papa rellena was tasty but very greasy, and tequenos filled with cream cheese??? very greasy. I will not go back.

column4: 24 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: Very small restaurant and so not very friendly on choosing your table. Server appeared upset when asked if we can switch to a bigger table. Food was good. Would recommend this location for lunch only.

column4: 5755 Mountain Hawk Way Santa Rosa, CA  95409
column13: Another great meal at Fresh. We eat there all the time and love it.
I loved this restaurant! This was for many reasons, but the first must have been I decided to bring my 2 and 4 year old boys to dine with us and it all went off beautifully.
food was great. a little disappointed that they no longer have the po-boys on their menu.

The food was great and the service equally good. The reviews say this is a place for locals and it is right on. The restaurant was very busy but with our reservation we were promptly seated.Great friendly atmosphere. The owner is very proud of his restaurant and makes sure his guests are treated well.

column4: 45 North B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Food is excellent and the portion is good for the price paid. The waiter or (owner)is very friendly. Will visit again!

Gajalee was a really great experience! We went there with our 3 year old son, and they were just adorable. The service is excellent and the food amazing. i orderd the fish tali which came on a round plate with many diffent things to taste. My husband had a lamb dish that was also excellent. We would return any time and can only highly recommend this place!

This is really the best Indian restaurant in the area -- I can't figure out why more people don't come here. It's really good. The owner is incredibly friendly and the staff are very attentive. It's hard to find (in the back of a strip mall), but don't let that stop you -- you must try Ganesha!
This is a great place, simply said.
Love the new menu. Great veggies, upscale meats & fish! As always, the people are warm & welcoming. New remodel & menu have moved this restaurant up overall. Highly recommend.

column4: 2 New Montgomery St. San Francisco, CA  94105
column13: Visiting the Garden Court Bruce is a MUST DO when planning our USA trips which must all go thru San Fran to be there for the Sunday GC Brunch. It is worth every cent and a truly wonderful food and atmosphere experience. Lovely setting, quality through and through even with the HUGE Oracle conference on in San Fran at the time. The music trio adds to the atmosphere and the many people celebrating special occasions such as 90th birthdays as well as those like us travelling through and wanting to have a wonderful food and champagne experience which is so San Fran. Please keep this institution it is pure class.

Always an enjoyable evening with delicious entrees, great service, wonderful ambiance and a very nice selection of wines. I love the now famous chicken milanese. Others tried the pork chop, salmon and pasta entrees all of which were equally as good. Severs here are pros and both friendly and helpful. There is also a full bar.The upscale sophisticated atmosphere adds to the overall experience.
Thought the food was very tasty and healthy. The service was a little lax especially post dinner.

column4: One Embarcadero Center, Promenade Level San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: We went to Gaylord restaurant because we had heard good reviews. But food is not so great and it is pricey. The owner keeps giving uncomfortable looks and makes you feel awkward especially if you are women who have ordered alcoholic beverages although you are well over 25! Overall it was a very bad experience for us and not so great food.

We had high expectations after reading the menu on-line. Unfortunately the food did not live up to its descriptions. The Caesar dressing was definitely not. The scallops arrived cold and we had to send the order back. The gnocchi was soft and gooey and the pesto had no flavor. Salmon had little flavor and seemed farmed although the menu said wild. The waitress was indifferent at best. The noise level was high, but to be fair, it was during the Giants game.
Good service, perhaps not the best place for lunch, place was completely empty.

column4: 398 W. El Camino Real, #114 Sunnyvale, CA  94087
column13: The last time I went, the service was poor. I was told that they were short staffed, but it wasn't that busy. We were ignored most of the time. Fortunately for us, we've been to Ginger Cafe plenty of times, and that was an exception.

The food was great and I was especially happy with the impressive selection of vegetarian rolls. I was a little disappointed with our seating because although we were placed right by the window, our view outside was obstructed by some construction scaffolding.
Very good food. Great service. Will go back!

This was our first dinner in our week long trip to Sonoma County and San Fran. It met all expectations. Our server was perfect on all levels. Delightful, attentive and informative. He selected our cheeses for us in our first course of a cheese/meat plate. Excellent combinations. The watermelon/tomato salad was a huge surprise for me. Sweetest watermelon I've ever had and just yummy. We shared the two piece duck confit with farro under it which I loved the most. My husband is the duck fan. The only complaint was the temperature indoors - a bit warm. And its a bit of a tight space in the middle of the room when servers walk by. But easy to ignore because the food was so good. Highly recommend this restaurant.
Good place to go for a first date. Although, the food was a little lacking.

column1: Glen Ellen Inn Oyster Grill & Martini Bar
column13: We loved this place! The mussels with the fresh cut fries were to die for and the oysters were wonderfully fresh. Our favorite of all was the hot buttered popcorn ice cream - truly heavenly. The waiter and waitress were both great too!

We were very lucky. On one of the few very hot nights in SF we were seated next to the open kitchen with grill blazing. Very uncomfortable. And we were under the loudspeaker where the music was way too loud.

Our first time here. Very nice traditional restaurant with a bar. Food is Greek / Mediterranean influenced and that's a plus. I had Osso Buco which was terrific, and my partner had a Greek fish (whole) that was also great. Prices are reasonable, wine list is adequate. Service was attentive and pleasant.

Restaurant is in a house that has a great feel Incredible outdoor seating with lights. heaters, pom and fountain - very nice! My twin sister and I celebrated our birthday here during out get-away to Napa. Their pan roasted chicken breast with corn succotash, mushrooms, arugula and piquillo peppers was over the top delicious!!! We really enjoyed our evening!

Food was good but nothing revelatory or memorable. Sauces and dressings were on the sweet side. Food presentation was nice verging on trendy. Service was excellent, friendly and relaxed. Everyone seemed to enjoy working there. Live music in the bar was excellent but was too loud for the restaurant. Made it more of a party atmosphere and less intimate. Lighting was a too bright. I wouldn't recommend it if it were a restaurant in SF, but I don't know the restaurant scene in Petaluma, so it might be fine.
Great food and a great waiter. The special hash was amazing. Great place for my husband's birthday dinner. We always love it here.

column1: Grandviews at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco
column13: This is an incredible place. All was perfect.
I recommend the UPSTAIRS only as the lower floor is way too noisy. The food was good and presented well. We will go back again.
Food and service is always great! One of my husband and I's favorite places in Petaluma.

column4: Bld. A, Fort Mason San Francisco, CA  94123
column13: I have been going to Greens since 1981 and each meal is still a delicious surprise! There is a view from every table because of the huge expanse of windows. Greens was doing farm to table since they've opened and every dish is full of flavor and perfect seasoning.
We had a delightful dinner. The view from the terrace was fantastic and my wife and I had a memorable experience.
This was a bad experience. We were seated for 15 minutes and no one came to wait on us. We left without being helped or even noticed.Jane

column1: The Grill on the Alley - San Jose
column4: 172 South Market St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Service was not memorable. Seemed rushed. Late in taking drink orders.

I had printed out their menu two days before we went, had what I wanted to order all planned, when we got there the menu had changed, I was very disappointed. I ordered the shrimp corn dogs and I liked them, another person in our party ordered the bruscetta and it was a generous portion and good. I ordered the mac and cheese with caramelized onions and lobster, after a very short time it got gummy, the taste was nice but texture got weird. I took what was left over home and the next day had a bit for lunch and added milk, that helped.It's not that I didn't like the restaurant that I won't go back, there are so many other restaurants that are better and of course the parking was horrible, but that's to be expected in that area.
Very good food homie atmosphere loved the family photos and friendly staff

column4: 19620 Stevens Creek Blvd, Suite 150 Cupertino, CA  95014
column13: We waited for looong time to have dishes.

column1: Hachi Sushi & Nabe (hotpot) Izakaya & Sake Lounge
column4: 1711 W. El Camino Real #B Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: This was our first visit to Hachi. The location is odd, right on busy El Camino Real and there is very little parking available in the lot shared with Domino's Pizza. The food was unusual as well as delicious. We had the opportunity to sample a number of tapas as well as a sake cocktail.

column4: 390 Capistrano Rd. Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: I went here on a recommendation from a work friend, and I was not disappointed. The food was great. I really enjoyed my grilled fish tacos. Most of the ingratiates of the taco were placed off to the side, so you could put in the desired amount of each, like that with tacos! I also had the new special Buster (Posey) Bleed Orange Ale, fantastic! Being a huge Giants and Buster fan, I had to give it a try. It's kind of a roller coaster of bitter and sweet, a little hard to explain. I'm usually not a big beer drinker, and I polished this off right away, so that's saying something. The service was great! Once we were seated, we never felt like we were waiting around to be helped, and the wait staff was kind and courteous. Thanks!

column4: 101 Golf Course Drive Rohnert Park, CA  94928
column13: Hana is now the best Japanese/Sushi restaurant in our area. We had an incredible waiter who knew more about Sake and the preparation of the food then anyone could imagine. We are not new to Sushi bars, have been to ones all over the country and our experience at Hana was one of the best. Great Sake and Sonoma County wine list, inventive menu and great energy.

column4: Pier 39, Suite M.209 (Beach & Embarcadero) San Francisco, CA  94133
column13: Food was lousy and for 2nd time, they did NOT WANT TO HONOR $ 50 certificate I had which was signed by the manager!
Barely makes for a quick lunch. Nothing to talk about. Dissappointed that I invited someone to eat there.
Had a poor waiter. Too bad, because the food is excellent.

Was there on a slow night. The service was prompt and paid attention, but nothing special. Menu was interesting, but the wine list was limited. Overall an "okay" or slightly better hotel dinning experience, but nothing stands out.
The food was very good and the service couldn't have been better. A tad pricey, however so plan ahead.

column4: 2100 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: Our second time there, we really enjoy the tables in the bar area with the band. Great food, service and atmosphere.
Helpful and warm service, beautifully presented and balanced flavors, couldn't find a miscue anywhere, can't wait to get back

If the restaurant is busy service can sometimes be lacking and the orders might be backed up. We came when they were entertaining a large group so they explained to us that the kitchen was tied up, and service was fairly slow as well.

column4: 44 Webster St. (At Embarcadero West) Oakland, CA  94607
column13: Surprisingly good value for fixed-price chef's market menu. We had 6 courses and one amuse-bouche for $55. Quality and creativity were outstanding, and we had more food than we could eat. We left happy with the experience and not hungry.

I want to love Hawk's Tavern. It's in my neighborhood and I love the ambiance. But the food is just too heavy. I am not afraid of butter or a rich meal, but I had large amounts of grease dripping out of my sandwich during my last visit. And on our prior visit, both my husband and I felt our salads and entrees were also overloaded with oil or butter.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Acceptable to Good. Old school waitstaff, personable host, convenient. I would give the sand dabs a 5 on 10-scale. Mushy. Naturally a good place if you are catching an event and afterwards fine for a late night dinner, but don't expect a wow. Maybe it needs a shot on the arm?
Very disappointing..Food was not memorable.Horrible noise from some motor in the building throughout our meal

Lunch is better than dinner. This is the first time having dinner there and I would not go back. there were flying bugs in the soya sauce used for the sushi and they were in more than one container. There were no service. The sushi was okay but other than that, there was nothing positive about this dining experience.

I've eaten here a couple of times. Each time, there's usually one thing that just doesn't go right. Previously, the chicory salad was unnecessarily salty and bitter. Or the fish was slightly overdone. Or the wine recommendation was OK but not bad enough to be rejected. Overall, Heirloom is a good locavore restaurant in the Mission - just not outstanding for the prices they charge.

column4: 2424 Van Ness St San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: This was our first time at Helmand Palace and we were delighted. The menu was full of lots of interesting and delicious options, with an added bonus of a terrific selection of vegetarian dishes. We all ordered different dishes, from lamb to vegetarian and each was better than the next. Service was excellent....we never felt rushed, yet the waiter was right there when we needed him. In addition, we were very pleased that the noise level was quite low and we could easily talk (and hear each other!). All in all,this was a wonderful experience. We definitely will return.
Took my fiance here for dinner and it was amazing! Staff, food, and the atmosphere was great. We will be dining here again for sure!
Excellent food.Lots of vegetarian and vegan options.

Sushi was impeccable. We got the large combination Hiro Platter. Beautiful to look at. A few herbs and flowers strewned throughout. The fish unusual and extremely fresh. Delicious. The tempura we ordered was a little soggy and too greasy but you won't be disappointed in the sushi.

column4: 1015 Alameda De Las Pulgas Belmont, CA  94002
column13: eventhough we had reservation, we waited 20 minutes to get seated. not enough waiting area. the host was lost, busy and noncommunacative. The food was good and servers were ok.they charged gratuity even for 5 people, so I almost paid 40% tip, but checked at last minute.
It was okay, I had hope for more. It is what the name refers to. It's a Tavern

We had a few hiccups with the food we ordered, but, our waiter was the most attentive we had ever had here, and we were given the two food items for free due to kitchen error. That was really generous! We had a great time though - we sit outside usually. On this day the bar was busy with people watching the 49ers game.

Excellent food: a healthy, contemporary version of fantastic southern food in the heart of San Francisco. Had a unique seat, too, immediately next to the kitchen. While not for everyone, I enjoyed watching the dynamics of the kitchen. Service was very good, too: I was well taken care of an because of my seat got to spend some time with one of the owners.

column4: 60 San Leandro Marina San Leandro, CA  94577
column13: It's a great spot, with romantic views of the marina, evocative at sunset and the service was excellent. The only criticism was that the food is expensive and the portions are not particularly generous.

column4: Hornblower Landing at Pier 3 San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Beautiful views of the SF Bay, very romantic! I was on the Dinner Cruise - lower level - with the live band -- loved the atmosphere! I was with my fiance - there were mostly other couples around -- upper level of the boat was a DJ and more of a party atmosphere. Outside on the desk was very nice - great date night!
great food, low key, unpretentious service-

column4: 3055 Olin Avenue Suite 1005 San Jose, CA  95128
column13: The menu is quite expensive, especially for lunch but the food was good and our waiter was attentive and professional.

column1: Houlihan's at the Holiday Inn San Francisco Airport
column4: 275 S. Airport Blvd South San Francisco, CA  94080
column13: Great spot for eating while attending a conference at the conference center next door. A good spot if you live in the area and when time permits prior to taking a flight from SFO. Good food and good energy.

column4: 1906 Van Ness Ave. San Francisco, CA  94109
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: The House of Prime Rib lived up to my expectations!! Was perahsps the second best meal I have ever had. Outstanding prime rib and the whole meal over all!!! Wait staff were execellent, nice place t ogot as a group or on a romantic date!!! would go back again if ever in San Fran!

Arriving early for our reservations we had a drink in the bar first. There is an excellent cocktail list, incluing the Dealer's Choice where the bartender (in our case, Alex, an excellent mixologist)will custom craft a cocktail for you when you tell him what you like. Then, moving to the dining room, we started with a great cheese plate and crispy squash blossoms, followed entrees of olive oil poached halibut and grilled hangar steak. A very good Tcho dark chocolate budino with espresso ice cream was a nice finish. Paul was our very competent and accomodating server. We dined early,5:30 as the restaurant is very popular and does get filled up later. Reservations certainly advised.

column4: 180 S. Airport Blvd South San Francisco, CA  94080
column13: My wife and I ordered the prime rib medium rare and it was close to well done. We had to order three different bottles of wine until we found one they had in stock. The meal was inexpensive however and a good value for the money.

The wild boar dish was absolutely delicious! And the gazpacho soup was so tasty and refreshing. We met Chef Bob Hurley himself when he came out of the kitchen and into the bar - nice and friendly, just like the rest of his staff.

column1: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
column13: The lobster bisque was fantastic! My fiance enjoyed his entree - stuffed shrimp. I had one of the specials, it was a white fish with vegetables and a potato - very bland and unimpressed. Fortunately the great lobster bisque managed to fill me up so I wasn't starving. The service was poor. Very slow to even bring our water - that's never a good sign.. When the waiter did stop by he was friendly but I just think the place was under staffed although the place wasn't packed. We picked the place last minute because all the other places we really wanted were full - this could have been better during lunch hour instead.
Small restaurant serving Iranian/Italian cuisine. Unusual and tasty cocktails. Mussels plump and delicious. Calamari ok. Both rather small portions. Meat dishes good. Waiter very attentive.
Wow. So mediocre. The wait staff seemed confused and overwhelmed at 6:30 at night. With all that North Beach has to offer, they need to step up their game in terms of food.
Great food and service. Prices are reasonable. Will go back many times!
A definite repeat!Very good food, excellent service, fun atmosphere, good fit for most!

column4: 223 Corte Madera Town Center Corte Madera, CA  94925
column13: The food at il fornaio is always good. I usually have the roasted chicken salad but at this visit I chose the salmon over spinach salad and it was delicious. I love I'll fornaio for dnh meal-- brunch, lunch or dinner. House wines are very good abc the bread is the best! Will return again and again.

We changed our reservation from a party of 4 to a party of 6 with NO problem. We were all family who hadn't seen each other for a number of months and spent a lovely 2+ hours at dinner. The wait staff was attentive, but never pressured us in any way to hurry. We will certainly return to Il Fornaio on our next visit to Palo Alto.
We were put at one of the smalles tables in the place next to a large group of people. Inside was very warm so we asked for a table outside. Then we were fine.

column4: 302 South Market St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Service was good but overall felt rushed the whole meal. We were asked if we were ready to order within a few minutes of sitting down. We did even look at the wine list yet. I was asked if i wanted to box up my food half way through my meal. Finally when dropping the check off I felt rushed because be tried collecting it right after dropping it off and my card was not yet in there. I notice these things because I was a server for over 4 years. Overall the atmosphere was nice, food was good.

column4: 1430 Mt. Diablo Blvd. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Waitress needs training. Could not pronounce the menu.
Excellent food and service in an unpretentious environment. Very nice evening.
Love this place. Gnocci with truffle is amazing, sand dabs were incredible. Delightful atmosphere, too. We will continue to come here.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Very nice setting in Hayes Valley. Friendly and knowledgable staff serving very good food and drinks. Loved it

column4: 3295 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: Everything about this place is perfect, Bryan and his guys were on top of their game. Great food!

Great creative menu, cozy relaxed atmosphere. We went early before it transforms to a dance club and was not disappointed! We've been here twice now and the food and service has been excellent both times! Try everything! It's all good

column4: 120 Sir Francis Drake Blvd San Anselmo, CA  94960
column13: Who are these reviewers who say the food here is inconsistent? We had another delightful meal at Insalata's with excellent food, professional service, and a lovely, relaxed atmosphere. Just great.
Great Saturday evening treat..waiter attentive, we did not feel rushed into leaving, as we like to chat through & after dinner with coffee & dessert
Limited but tasty selection of pizzas (esp arugula/fig/prosciutto). Great bison burgers. Convenient to ATT PArk.
An amazing restaurant, amazing cuisine, but too noisy!

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Great food, the prices can't be beat. We arrived for an early dinner and there was no one there, by the time we left the place was almost full. The food was great, my curry was excellent with lots of spice and heat. Loved the decor, a nice hip place to eat.

column4: 401 Main Street Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: A great, friendly place to dine with friends and family. Food is consistently top notch.
I was pleased that I could make reservations on line. love the Prime rib! service is fast and friendly with out being overbearing.

column1: Jack and Tony's Restaurant and Whiskey Bar
column13: Our first visit to a whiskey bar. Our server was very polite and helpful, educating and guiding us through the drink and food menu. The selection of whiskey is amazing, the guidance of our server was truly appreciated. I would recommend letting your server know if it's your first time visiting. The craftsmanship displayed by the bartenders was amazing, top notch in all regards. The food was outstanding, fresh ingredients, well prepared, and the obvious attention to detail was evident in every dish. The dining area filled up quickly after 7:00, if it's your first time visiting I'd recommend arriving a little earlier.

column4: 60 Crescent Drive Suite A Pleasant Hill, CA  94523
column13: Loved the food and great service.

Shrimp ala Jack--no flavor whatsoever. A bolognese dish (different name) no flavor. Tortellini dish with prosciutto--quite good. Not thrilled with this place. I know it is a local favorite. Homemade biscotti--terrible.

When we dined there, there were only 3 tables set with customers, including ours!!! It is quite a shame, since chef Jai Yun's cuisine has brought Chinese cuisine to another level. Haute Chinese cuisine is rare to find and Chef Jai Yun masters every technique. This restaurant needs to update its decor, revamp the whole place in order to attract more customers.
Went for Sunday Brunch. Was disappointed. Food very ordinary. Prices are reasonable.
Great place with innovative take on middle eastern dishes. Reasonable. This place should be busier than it is. Is it the parking? Not that bad and you could park in garage across street.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Monday night prix fixe is the best deal in town!
Underwhelming food. Decor is odd and dull. Service was very good, however. Their web page was not reflective of the restaurant.
Food was great comfort food with high quality aspects that made it worth a full meal. Steak was top notch and the sweet potato fries were terrific. The deserts were all outstanding - we had several.

column1: Jeanne D'Arc - Cornell Hotel De France
column13: Extremely charming and romantic restaurant. Great ambiance and easy to have a conversation. Perfect for a date.

For the most part, we had a really nice experience in this historical, old San Francisco, bar and grill. Though I often stop by for lunch, this was the first time in awhile for dinner.The ambience was "John's," however, they had live music upstairs, which was so loud, it made it almost impossible to have a dinner conversation downstairs in the main dining room.Service-wise, the waiter was the worse I have ever experienced at that establishment, which usually rates top-notch in my experience. The waiter seemed to tolerate being at work, and did not seem particularly welcoming. He did not even want to serve us coffee with our dessert. After delivering dessert, while he was standing there, I had to ask the table if anyone else wanted coff
Loved it! Yummy selections - not your ordinary dining experience. Always different each time we've been there, but always good.
Great mix of food options, with small and large plates. The Papas are always outstanding.

This is our "go-to" spot, just the two of us. We always order the house 1/2 carafe, Tuna tartare, French onion soup, and the burger with bleu cheese medium rare. Very romantic. Service is gracious and attentive!
A little expensive for Japanese food. Food is tasty, service is very good, upscale atmosphere.

column1: Katia's Russian Tea Room and Restaurant
column13: A very cute spot in the Richmond district. Our first experience with Russian fare, and it was great. Leave room for the dessert - Napolean.

This restaurant is well hidden in an a very classy appartment building. The tasting menue was the only choice and it was spectacular. Every dish contains numerous ingredients carefully crafted into very well balanced textures and tastes. Every step into the meal was rising our level of satusfaction. What a great find. For wine fans like us, the list contains some numerous wines, including some older vintages at good prices considering their curremt market value.
I actually enjoyed lunch with a good friend.

Disappointing. I placed my order for the Omakase (Chef's choice tasting menu) several weeks in advance. Of all the the omakases I have had, Morimoto's in Napa was by far the best and this was the worst. The offering was nothing unsual and mostly sushi. I could have saved a 3 hour round trip drive and had an equally satisfying meal at a local sushi restaurant at half the price.

We went to Kincaids since it was our anniversary. Been here many, many times and it never disappoints. The food and service was impeccable. We brought our 6 month old (who was an angel at dinner) and the staff was super accommodating. Plus I think half of them came by just to say hi to the little guy. They were featuring their crab dishes and as both my wife and I love crab, we sampled quite a few - crab won tons (amazing), crab and artichoke dip (always a favorite) but the highlight was my wife's macadamia nut crusted petrale sole stuffed with crab. My surf and turf Oscar style (salmon and sirloin) was not too shabby either. The celebratory creme brûlée was a nice touch as well as we were way too full for regular dessert. Thanks Kibcaids!

I had the steak and crab sliders which I found distasteful. I should've inquired about them with my server. I've had the open-faced crab sandwich in the past and have enjoyed- I am not sure what the difference was with this. The steak was cooked well, I just didn't find the steak and crab blending well together. When I came to the last one, I just removed the crab to enjoy the rest of the meal.

column4: 201 South B. St. San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: The food and the service was fantastic. I had not been here in years, actually got the recommendation from Open Table. We will not wait years to return. Already suggested to two friends this week.
Great thai food. Love the sirloin salad and can't get away from the off-the-menu spicy noodles. Yum!

Kokkari will not dissapoint! Great ambiance and lighting...the focal point in the dining room is an oven where you will see a lamb roasting; the decor is very tasteful, with a touch of Greece here and there. Management and waitstaff were very polite and attentive to the customers.

I was so pleasantly surprised by Koto's! The quality of the fish and meats were excellent, and the accompanying rice and veggies tasted awesome. The chef was skilled at all the showmanship, but accommodated expertly when he noticed the noise scared the kids at our table. In about 15 minutes, he had my 3 year old nephew clapping along to the cooking "show."

The quality of food and service at the end of the night overcame the problem of locating a parking space in the neighborhood for at least 35 min. The restaurant should have a valet parking and/or recommend the closest public parking.
This was a perfect place to meet an out-of-town guest for a taste of San Francisco at it's finest.

column4: 1875 S. Bascom Ave. Suite 2500 Campbell, CA  95008
column13: Entertaining show, average food.

column4: 2 New Montgomery St. San Francisco, CA  94105
column13: It's closing at the end of this week, after 21 years.

A hidden treasure just a couple of blocks from AT&T Park (and CalTrain). Food is delicious and reasonably priced, service is warm and friendly, ambiance is quiet and pleasant, and we had no problem getting a reservation even before a playoff game. In fact, we couldn't believe how few tables were occupied on such an occasion. Giants fans who want to have a good meal before a game: leave MoMo's and Marlowe's and Paragon to the crowds and check out La Briciola. Two other groups seated near us (also going to the game) were obviously regulars, and no wonder. This is a place we'll go back to.
As always AMAZING food and wine. Max and Lorella knock it out of the park every. single. time. LOVE it here. I cannot recommend it highly enough.
Good food, staff not very personable, but prompt and attentive.

Manager and staff acknowledged our anniversary celebration and comped our dessert and brought us 2 glasses of sparkling dessert wine as well. Absolutely fabulous margaritas and unique Mexican cuisine and dishes. Nice upscale restaurant to celebrate a special occasion.
Incredible food. Cebiche to die for. Extraordinarily good Peruvian food. My cousin's wife is from Peru and swears it's as close to home as she has found. I can't wait for my next visit!

My second time here and still is a great restaurant. The "Tasting of Passot Roe" is simply incredible. All the staff is very attentive and the chef is a really nice person. All in all a great experience. Will definitely go back.

The experience at La Fondue is always good.....just one complaint and that's that there's way too much food! I love their Chef's salad but it's massive.....I wish it were half the size.....the cheese fondue we got(Stinking Rose) was delicious, the main dish (Fondue Feast) was lots of choices and again, too much, and the dessert (which is the main reason for me being there!) is always the best part. Our server was friendly and chatty, which was great, and we felt a nice slow pace for the meal.

I brought a group of Midwestern visitors and others here who had never tried Peruvian food and rarely had fish other than fish sticks. They were apprehensive until we were seated and the first few dishes arrived. Our table was excellent, the wait staff friendly and helpful, the food was incredible - some things were a bit adventurous and others safe - and my guests had a wonderful time.

A warm welcome as Madame Masek showed us to our table. The service was impeccable, the ambiance perfect. My opinion is the menu food has a country French orientation, less stuffy and intimidating than the. " high French menus ". Certainly will return.
The food was excellent, as was the service. My only complaint would be that it's very noisy since there's nothing in the room to absorb noise. It made dinner conversation a little difficult.

column4: 233 West Santa Clara St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: I think this restaurant is ok. Best if you order something recommended. Great service and ambiance but the menu could be updated and the execution of the preparation improved.

We walked in for breakfast, 1 person sitting in there having coffee. It took about 5 minutes for anyone to come seat us for our reservation. She got annoyed when we asked to sit by the window. They do not have cocktails for the morning, like a mimosa. So we got up and left.Now, when we had walked by the place the night before, it was full of people and it looked like it was a nice place to eat. So I can't judge the food, but it was a cute place.
Consistently good food whenever we have dined at La Strada. Our waitress was wonderful. Just the right amount of being there for us without hovering.
Great food and outstanding service. Really enjoyed the hamachi, ravioli in parmesan broth and duck. Although I am not a dessert fan, the salted caramel ice cream was really good.
I love La Tosca; have been going here for years. The food is great, with a nice variety of dishes, the deserts are incredible, and the service is always very pleasant. Always a pleasure to dine here.

I ordered one of the specials and it was awful! It was some sort of eggplant dish. The eggplant was dry and the tomatoes were not ripe-flavorless and crunchy. It is tomato season so they should have no excuse for this. It was totally overpriced for the quality it was. The service was OK but nothing special. We had to ask for enough water glasses to go around and we had to ask for more water several times. We were there on the earlier side for dinner with few other parties there-so they can't say it was to busy. Overall, the meal was nothing special. I will not be going back.
Very impressed with quality of food, pasta sauces, very nice daily specials, and reasonably priced. Very Nice Menu!! I was surprised it wasn't more packed. Great service!

column1: The Lake Chalet Seafood Bar & Grill
column13: I last ate at the Lake Chalet right after it first opened, and thought the food wan't that great and that it was overpriced. But this last experience was a welcome surprise. The food was delicious (really liked the tuna ceviche) and the prices seemed reasonable. I would go back.

The food was outstanding except for the dessert which was billed as sthg exotic but turned out to be just unripe, bland slices of melon with cheese on the side. The appetizer was out of this world, scallops, mussels and avocado, just wonderful! And the flank steak with thick cut potatoes in a cup and steamed greens was also terrific. Drinks and wine were ok, and service was better than in the past. The connection between the food and the bar is sometimes losy.

column4: 636 San Anselmo Ave San Anselmo, CA  94960
column13: Fabulous meal perfectly paired and excellent service!!
Best food I've ever experienced!

I felt a little removed from the action, sitting outside under a heat lamp on the sidewalk on a bust Santana Row evening. The pulled mozzarella would have been better if it hadn't turned into a difficult to serve blob in the cold of the night. I did enjoy the salmon, and my companions commented that the tuna and crab was also quite tasty.

column4: 845 Market Street - 4th Floor San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: If you want a steak this is the place to go!! Food was delicious and service was perfect. You will put a dent in your wallet but the value is there!

We are big fans of One Market, which is also in this restaurant group, and LCWC didn't let us down. Very tasty food, generous portions, and reasonable prices. Our server was very accommodating (one person in our party was on a restricted diet)and gracious. I particularly like how various menus are offered, and how diners can also construct their own menus for extra flexibility. A winning evening!

column4: 452 First Street East, Suite H Sonoma, CA  95476
column13: What a wonderful hidden gem! Will definitely be back. Don't skip dessert.

column4: 993 N. Point Street San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: Wonderful, welcoming and engaged owners, husband and wife I believe who helped describe what was on offer and helped us with our choices. The Cuban Roast Pork was really excellent, sort of like a less greasy (not that I object to grease) but very succulent version of Carnitas. My wife had camarones dish also excellent. A great choice if you're taking the Powell-Hyde from SOMA over the hill to go to the Magic Theatre at Fort Mason as Latin Grill is on your way for the Cable Car turn around to the Theatre.

column1: Laurel Court Restaurant & Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
column13: Food is very overpriced for the quality--risotto too salty, chicken soup too small a portion, bread not very good. Tables have no table cloths and cheap-looking placemats. Service is almost nonexistent--no refilling of water glasses, slow clearing of the plates--understaffed if they have many customers. Parking in the area is also overpriced. Nob Hill used to have lots of great restaurants--a shame they don't any more.
Michael our waiter is the Best!

column4: 898 Santa Cruz Avenue Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: A great big welcome to LB Steak from this 9-year Menlo Park resident!I have visited these folks twice, and both visits have been excellent. Not sure if it is the bountiful supply of bread (butter/olive oil/tomatoes), or the fantastic sunday evening Prime Rib special?My bet is the very friendly competant service Staff!:)

Le Central is a traditional old style French restaurant, where service is discreet and quiet, just like being back in France. The atmosphere is very pleasant and the quality of the food and presentations are first rate. The frites compare with the best, and the rest of the menu follows suit. Try the cassoulet or blood sausage, as well as any of the daily specials.
The patio dinning is spacious compared to a lot of French diners. The Prix Fix menu is a great choice. Would come back and try other dishes.
Le Colonial has some wonderful dishes. It's expensive, but worth it.

column4: 85 Liberty Ship Way Ste 109 Sausalito, CA  94965
column13: Just a great place. I've been there many times and its always superb. The staff is a match for the fantastic food and wine.

Le Papillon is one of the best Restaurants in Silicon Valley and is competitive with any in San Francisco. It has wonderful food, relaxing and elegant environment, but not pretentions. The service is attentive without being oppressive. Great place for special dinners including business dinners, but also great for just a quiet night out for no good reason at all.

tThe charm of a true French bistro in a wonderful, easily accessible location (1 block from BART Glen Park station. It's amazing how the old "Bus Stop" bar could be transformed into a stylish and intimate restaurant. Did I mention the food was excellent? The escargot was overly slathered with parsley, but the tender morsels were delighfully tasty, with not too much garlic or butter. My dining companion had the escargot for the first time and was impressed. My starter of onion soup was a harbinger of a great meal. The stock was deep and rich and clearly had been prepared with hours of care. Although not traditionally a "beef" eater, I could not pass up the bouef bourguignon. Again, the gravy was superb. I will return!

Just one week after lunch at Le Soleil, we returned for lunch again to one of our favorite restaurants. We were presented with an expanded menu with new lunch specials that included heavenly coconut chicken soup and their "must" Imperial Rolls and had another wonderful lunch. We chose their spicy but flavorful Lemongrass Chicken and Lemongrass Beef for entrees, a fruity white wine from South Africa, and had a hard time deciding on desserts from the longer, mouth-watering menu including three-bean sundae and Pandan Creme Brulee. The service is always very good and friendly in this delightful neighborhood gem.
Thanks Max for an outstanding evening!

I always have a fun time when I visit this restaurant. So much charm and history at this location. ALways a good time whether I have a casual bite at the bar or a more formal dinner in the main dining room.

column4: 635 Santa Cruz Ave. Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Ordered the ribeye and had to send back, for it was overdone. Second time a charm but omg was it ever salty. This place caters to an older crowd, so..it approached Golden Corral levels of salt.

column4: 377 Santana Row, Suite #1100 San Jose, CA  95128
column13: Every dog lover will enjoy brunch at this local spot. They even have special water bowls for four legged friends. We love the Pain Perdue.

I made a reservation for my wife and I at 7pm thinking it was a good idea. You never know how busy a restraunt will be right? Having never been there it took a second to find. Parking is a nightmare in this area as there are NO parking garages nearby. When we got to the Lemongrass and went in, I was shocked. We were the only customers in the restaurant! We were greated cordially and seated against the wall in the middle of the resaurant. The decor was pretty standard for a Thai restaurant and a little dark inside due to the wood paneling. Perfect for a romantic meal with a loved one. We ordered an appetizer which was delicious and not too quick in coming out so we could menu surf. We both had a curry dish and they were fantastic.

Great food and service. The location is a definite plus: near a lot of venues around Union Square and Nob Hill. I think the marketing is pushing too much the bar scene and groups; we came for a semi-romantic dinner in a quiet place, and Level III was able to provide that. Also, I was not aware of any outdoor dining.
Year after year, this place excels at good food and excellent service.

It was a quiet morning so we took brunch outside on the patio overlooking 4th street. What a wonderful way to start a Fall day in San Rafael. The food was hearty and we had a great selection to choose from. Our waitress was gracious and attentive.
Good food but a bit pricey. A $25 corkage fee unnecessary in Morgan Hill.
The food was delicious at a very reasonable price. Staff was friendlym, accomodating, and attentive.

I LOVE the food at Limon. It is unbelievably tasty. You MUST have the rotisserie chicken. They also have lots of good drink options. A few downsides: their menu isn't strong on vegetarian options. Also,the restaurant can get EXTREMELY loud!

column4: 1001 S Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94110
column13: Wow! The food here is amazing, it comes out super fast and isn't very expensive. Get the chicken chicharron.

column4: 1023 North Fair Oaks Ave. Sunnyvale, CA  94089
column13: The food is soncistenly good, and the staff are eager to please.
Chicken Tikka Masala buffet was actually just Chicken Masala; the meat was not all white... This place was much more inviting when it was on Broadway.
ZVery good mid-priced Sushi. Great service, friendly and delisious food.
Slow service! Loud space. Good food.
One of my favorite restaurants, food is always inventive and interesting, and the staff is fantastic.

The anchovies, oysters,heirloom tomato and pole bean salad were amazing. Their menu is set up to share (small plates) and between two people, it's perfectly romantic. We tasted the salads and seafood portions but will go back soon to try out the rest: the food is savory, light, and it's a place meat eaters and vegetarians can go. Our server was pretty awesome too.
Some of the best Italian cuisine I've had on the peninsula.Much more Italian than "Italian-American".

column4: 90 S. Second St San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Food was just okay....not enough to get me to return

column1: Logan-Ives House at Long Meadow Ranch Winery
column13: Really good time. Make us feel like we are guests in their house

column4: 130 N. Santa Cruz Avenue Suite G Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: This is a fun restaurant with a varied menu from salads and hamburgers (great ones) to steak and fish. Good desserts, too. It is alive and loud so not so good for conversation but energetic. Our server was excellent and well trained. It was a good night out with friends. We ordered ribs, fish and chips, pasta and salads. All very good. They make their own beer and sausage which is excellent.

column1: Los Gatos Brewing Company - San Jose
column4: 163 W Santa Clara St San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Went on a Friday night. The energy in the restaurant was great. The band on the outside patio adds great value to the scene because it makes it fun. My waiter Frankie was fantastic. He was always making sure we liked our food, wanted to know if we were satisfied or if he could get us anything else. His personality is a plus

Only the uni creme brûlée was a winner. I would go back for happy hour drinks n snacks only. The dinner menu, for the price they charge, did not stand out enough for me to warrant a second try.
