My last restaurant i went to for same price range was Range -- and I would go back there again as every ingredient for every dish was well thought out, and everything on plate would compliment each other. The 2 main entrees we ordered at Lot 7, tuna and steak, both had diced potatoes in the mix. One of them had salad. Not too imaginative. Need to branch out to be different and expand on uni type dishes to succeed in row of competing restaurants.
Excellent location and atmosphere for a business meeting. The service is excellent without being intrusive.

column1: Lucy Restaurant and Bar at Bardessono
column13: I would recommend this place for the food. It was good, fresh and tasty. But i have slight issues with the price and service. Because of the decor, Lucy comes across as being more casual dining but the prices do not reflect this. Appetizers were expensive considering all the apps were veggie/salad dishes. Entrees were delicious but presentation was lacking, especially if you are paying the high price.As for the service, again this did not reflect the high prices. We ordered cocktails and wine and it took a long time to come. Food came out first! And the food was ordered AFTER drinks. Server should be more attentive and notice we haven't received our drinks. Busser/runner paid a lot more attention with clearing plates and filling water.
Great restaurant. Service was great, reasonably priced, but the parking is horrible (but parking is always horrible in SF).
The food was okay, but the service is slow. I expected better. The owner is nice and friendly though.

One of my favorite places to dine in SF, often use it for business meetings as the setting is casual, generally unhurried and the food is always good. I've eaten there for business meetings 4 times now and always had a great experience.

The staff were friendly and fabulous. The booth in the back was perfect for our party of 7 (including one 5 year old). The food, was mediocre. Not great, but not bad. I liked my salad and mojito best.

"Neighborhood gem" describes Lupa perfectly. I might not drive across town to go there (though I do live across town and have been there several times), but if I lived nearby, I'd be there at least once a month or so. The staff is personable, engaging, and laid back. Service is well-paced, they're accommodating and make you feel at home. Some of the dishes are really excellent -- the broccoli soup (not always on the menu) is fabulous. The fettucine with mushrooms (and black truffle sauce) is consistently excellent - fresh, interesting mushrooms and homemade pasta. Other dishes miss a bit -- the seafood pasta, while it comes with lots of fresh seafood, has a somewhat lackluster sauce. The salads are generally very good, if not inspired

First time guest; menu was limited; steaks expensive, other options included chicken, Mac 'n cheese, burger;Maybe acceptable 200 miles into the middle of nowhere, not in Palo Alto. The others in party liked their food.
Lovely dining in an historic mansion B & B. Food was thoughtfully presented and well-paired with wine on the tasting menu. Our server was attentive but not smothering. The scallops were perfect!

column4: 2825 Sand Hill Road Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: I've been at Madera many times for dinner and the food was outstanding but the venue slightly noisy. For lunch outdoors on a sunny day there was a lovely peaceful view from the patio. I brought a friend from out of town who loved the view. The salads are usually excellent but was very good or OK. I'm really waiting for the lemon brussel sprout side order to return.

Really a special place. Dinner was a three hour adventure of "Top Chef" flavors. Unbelievably attentive staff that work as a team. Expensive with only a couple of tasting options, but worth a visit for that special occasion

column4: 555 Golden Gate Avenue San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: The noise level was unbearable. The proximity of the bar to the eating area and a live band made conversation nearly impossible.

column4: 3055 Olin Avenue, Suite 1000 Suite 1000 San Jose, CA  95128
column13: Great food, especially with familiy style dining. Great for a large group.
It was my first time and it was great. I loved the intimacy of the outdoor dining and the service was timely and friendly.
They did not even have my reservation
Loud, loud, loud. Food is average.

A great place for dinner - and wow, Mamma Tanino's is starting to get busier! We've been fans for a while and it's the closest thing to "back home" Italian we've had in Sonoma County. The chef is amazing - he's multi-talented and the staff welcomes you like you're family. Always delicious!!

The food here was really yummy. There are appetizers and entrees, but also "small plates" which are great for ordering a few and sharing. The polenta was amazing! The wine list is extensive and the staff are very knowledgable about wine pairings. I had a good salmon dish, but my b/f had the lamb shank which was DELICIOUS!
Pleasant evening! Chicken pide and falafel and Iskenderun kebab all delicious. So was the appetizer platter.

My husband and I were accompanied by our Canadian friend.. We decided to dine out do we could enjoy catching up with our conversations with our visitor.. Your restaurant was an ideal place closer to our home. The atmosphere and service were friendly..
Excellent food, service and ambiance. Like being on a side street superb restaurant in Italy. Enjoy!!!

column4: Pier 39, Fisherman"s Wharf San Francisco, CA  94133
column13: This place has a nice patio that's well protected from the wind and has a great view. We came in with a group of 7, place was nice not to crowded made reservations and we had no wait at all,definitely will be returning here again.

I found this restaurant on open table by chance and made the reservation for my son's birthday. We all had a wonderful time and the food was very good and the portions were generous. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The manager had heard that it was my son's birthday and presented him with delicious dessert with we all shared. My wife will be recommending the restaurant to her employees and plans on having her monthly top producers lunch there.
Nice simple decor.Very expensive but service is worth it.Food is good. Some of the courses seemed to have common themes (lots of salads).vegetarian food is more than salads.

This is perhaps our sixth or so visit to the restaurant, and the most satisfying of all. The owners have managed to keep the comfortable, low-key environment intact, and to present a menu that is well above the offerings at other so-called "fine dining" establishments in this part of the region. Our dinner was exceptional.

column4: 218 Sir Francis Drake Boulevard San Anselmo, CA  94960
column13: Steakhouse/grill vibe. Chop house meets south-of-the-boarder. Great!

Great food. The restaurant was very busy and the wait staff seemed stretched, perhaps it was our table location in the front window behind all the arriving diners. Maybe the wait staff could not see us.The special meat loaf was a treat as was the filet. Both entrees were well prepared and quite tasty. Although the table service could have been more prompt, I would definitely Market again. The food is worth it.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: None of the above applies. Dining there was a big mistake! The service was awful, the food: the clam chowder was surely coming straight out of a can, the meet was hard and overcooked, and the wines on the menu were not available! Never again.
Such great food, excellent mimosas!

Loved it! The food was terrific! Please try the pork chop. Probably best I've had in the city, even better than NOPA. The salmon was to die for but I think the appetizers were the stand-out. Our group was pretty boisterous but our server made sure we were taken care of the whole time...kept our glasses full and made sure our plates were cleared. Nice ambiance too and great location next the Caltrain for people coming from peninsula and south bay.
Service, food, and overall was excellent!

The venue is much smaller than the website makes it sound. Our server was awesome; quick and great attitude. The music was really good too but they closed really early and pretty much kicked us out. My friend forgot his credit card and went back 20 minutes after we left and they charged him a 20% gratuity for "abandoning" his card.

Superb meal in a romantic setting. This is a five star restaurant. If you are looking for a place for a very special meal, this is it. Food quality was of the highest order. Outstanding service. Menu selection is limited. My only complaint during a four course meal with wine pairings is the portions were a little too small and the wine pairings were definitely too short. With what you are paying I feel each wine pairing should of been about half a normal glass pour, but received only about half of this amount. Other than this, I highly recommend Masa's.
It is always great food with good service. Close to everything in Downtown Walnut Creek. Good parking.

column4: 5200 Mowry Avenue Suite M Fremont, CA  94538
column13: Nice, dress up restaurant for special occasions.

column4: 2323 Van Ness Ave. San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: Eine gute Option für Leute die das Schweizer Essen vermissen
Very impressive food. Nice small portion. Every bit of the food is worth much appreciation.
Good food with a variety of kid-friendly items! Food is served hot and fresh.

column4: 1001 El Camino Real Redwood City, CA  94063
column13: Food was typical Max's--ok, not fantastic. Waiter wasn't attentive. Other parties were very loud including numerous screaming kids, which made discussion difficult. A good stop for a late lunch that we needed, but not someplace we would aim for except as a last-minute stand in for something else better than McDonald's.

column4: 2015 Crow Canyon Pl. San Ramon, CA  94583
column13: Good American food and deli prices. Great burgers and deli style sandwiches. Presents itself as a deli/diner, and does both well. Menu offers a lot of choices from really good and generous salads, to sandwiches and burgers. Hot plates include family diner choices such as meatloaf, turkey with mashed potatoes and gravy, chicken fried steak. A smattering of pastas, decent wine, beer choices. SIZABLE desserts - not a low cal choice anywhere on the dessert menu. Not to worry - this is comfort food HQ. enjoy. Even food snobs will be glad they went.

column4: 601 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Hate to say it, but the food we chose was drowning in overly sweet sauces that overpowered the ingredients (a barbequed pork wrap and a spinach salad) and made them almost inedible. The location near Davies Hall is great, but if we come again, we'll avoid sauses and prepared dressings completely.

column1: Max's Opera Cafe of Palo Alto
column4: 711 Stanford Shopping Center Palo Alto, CA  94304
column13: We were lucky to visit on a Sunday night when the restaurant wasn't that crowded and there was a very talented piano player providing the entertainment. A lot of the waiters took turns singing, probably because the restaurant wasn't full and they didn't have to neglect any tables. We went with teenage kids and Max's has so many options on the menu that everyone can find something that they like. I had the chicken pot pie which is excellent and truly good "comfort food." One daughter had the roasted chicken special, the other had ribs, and my husband had meatloaf. The portions are enormous which also means you can all taste each other's food without causing trouble. We took desserts to go as we were all stuffed. Delicious!

Made a last minute reservation for six and was seated immediately even though the restaurant was very busy. Fresh, made to order food and friendly staff - we loved the meal and can't wait to come back! A fabulous find!

I was celebrating my birthday and reserved a table for 6. My son called Maya's at noon to buy all of us a round of margaritas and whoever answered the phone did not know I was there. It was not crowded at all so that was a shame. The waitress did not continue to fillour glasses of water and she was difficult to wave over.

column4: 855 El Camino Real, Ste. 110 Palo Alto, CA  94301
column13: Mayfield Bakery is consistently good - one of our very favorite spots. The food is exceptional but not fussy, wine list is reasonable with a well thought out selection, and service is friendly (but can be a bit rushed). It is comfortable, lively and neighborhoodish with consitently great food. It's owned by the same group as the Village Pub in Woodside and Spruce in SF - and they share the same Executive Chef. Mayfield has equal quality of food, but much more reasonable. Plus you get a loaf of fresh bread from the bakery as a gift after dinner!
Authentic Persian food and owner.

column1: Mayo Reserve Room - Mayo Family Winery
column13: This is the best wine tasting experience in Napa or Sonoma. Gourmet small plates ,7!! ,with 7 wines to match, and all for $35Of course we bought a case of their wine so we were all happy.No more wine tasting that day for us till dinner,didn't want a DUI.

column4: 900 North Point Street at Ghirardelli Square San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: We took a chance on one of the most busy weekend nights in San Francisco history. With Fleet Week, America's Cup, Giants' playoff, Hardly Strictly Bluegrass all on Saturday, I thought a reservation would be impossible. It wasn't, and after a short 15 min wait, we were seated. The waitstaff was so busy. Our guy seemed to be used to it; I thought maybe he had been a stock trader on the NASDAQ before a career switch to restaurant service. The cocktails were good, food was good although the desert we could have passed on (carmel/banana pie sounded good at the time but....) Anyway, still an enjoyable evening located at one of San Francisco's iconic areas in Ghirardelli Square.

column4: 170 South Market Street San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Most of the food was tasty, but two of the four orders were prepare ver incorrectly. For example, a friend ordered her burger rare and it came well done. Staff tried to remedy the food prep errors. Since we were not on a time schedule, it worked out.

As always we had a lovely dinner at McNamara's Steak House. Over the years we continue to experience the same excellent service with their fine dining. Our food was cooked perfectly just as we ordered.

The decor was very modern, gave a good vibe. I went for lunch right when they opened. The prime rib spring rolls melted in my mouth, they were so delicious. The tomato gruyere soup was good, could have been a little cheesier. I also had the caesar salad with salmon on top. My first salad was delivered with chicken, but they were very fast to get a new salad made with salmon. It was cooked perfectly. The food was overall great and decently priced. The service was a bit to be desired though, I sat with my water glass empty for a bit, I didn't get asked once if everything was okay, and every time I wanted to say something, I was catching the waiter in mid-stride walking away. Go for the food, not the service.

We went there for date night and it was really good. The food was good and felt/tasted clean and healthy. The only thing is it wasn't as hot - not temperature wise - as we expected it. So probably could've asked for sauces or asked ahead of time. But then didn't want to insult them after they brought it out. But if you like more of a kick to your indian, let them know before you order so you can order accordingly. But it was really good, not expensive at all and the service was great!!

column4: 536 Golden Gate Ave San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Working in the area, there aren't a lot of places to eat. The lunch buffet is a good deal and the service is great. Easy to get in and out in an hour.
The host was super accommodating, engaging and fun, the food was heavenly, the price was just right, what's not to like!

column4: 2 N B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: The food is great overall, but I would change the following:For the cheese fondue I did not like having chips, I have been to other melting pots and like the bread but the chips are not the best, they take away from the experience.I also did not like that they automatically added 18% gratuity when we used a st Jude coupon. We would have generously tipped the waitress anyway, it was like almost implying that we were cheap to use the coupon so to compensate for our cheapness the restaurant increases the gratuity. I personally found this very offensive, in fact we always tip extra beyond 18% but because of this we did not bother giving any extra. I am rethinking coming back here just because of this which is a pity.

column4: 125 E. Sir Francis Drake Blvd Larkspur, CA  94939
column13: They worked really hard to accommodate our request for a booth. The waiter was excellent...
best magerita in townowner greeting always

column4: 41 East Gish Rd. San Jose, CA  95112
column13: delicious food, excellent service, nice decor and ambience, fun watching the bellydancers

column4: 100 El Camino Real Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Service was very slow due to not enough waiters. They tried their best. This is a management issue, not a waiter issue.

column4: 1029 El Camino Real Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: I had a nice lunch with a friend at Menlo Hub. We had the Cobb Salad and the Beef and Prosciutto Tortellini. The bread and hummus-like spread were very good. The Tortellini came with soup or salad and I chose the sald with the house dressing. A really delicious, flavorful, well-tossed sald. The tortellini was excellent. The Cobb Salad really good. I really enjoyed this restaurant and would definitely revisit!

First time at the Meritage and really enjoyed it. Went for a special dinner and it was a great spot for that - service, ambiance, and food. Another great find for a special dinner in the Berkeley area.
Great food and the wait staff provided excellant service and advise.
Brought a dear friend for lunch and it was a delight. We felt well taken care of and the food was delicious. Great lunch place.

column4: 459 Prospect Way Half Moon Bay, CA  94038
column13: This is a great Italian restaurant. It is a warm, friendly place with an open kitchen. Although there are window tables they face away from the sunset. You can see the marina but I wouldn't come here for the view. We were not drinking at this meal but the wine list looked extensive. We started with the goat cheese bruschetta and it was fantastic. I had the gnocchi gorgonzola which was very good but the butternut squash ravioli that my wife had was amazing.
We had a great time at Mezze. I had a salmon with polenta entre which was amazing. Afterward we went to a movie at the Grand Theater and got a drink around the corner. Great for a nice date!

Nice out of the way spot. The Guac was very tasty. My Margarita left a little to be desired. The place is small but bigger that it looks from outside. Overall the food was good and I would recommend. Good place for a quite dinner with friends.

The 7 course chef's menu with wine pairing was delicious although the course descriptions sometimes were over the top. Wine pairings mostly good, would upgrade the Pinot noir and 30 year old Tawny port if I had a say but possibly hard to fit into the budget.

We have eaten at Milagros over 20 times. The food is consistently good and the vibe is great. This trip was a bummer as the service is getting worse, not better. It was a Friday night and they were busy, but they are always busy on the weekends. Everything was out of sorts, first course was major late, (the server did comp the guacamole.They tried to service someone else's entrees TWICE. We will try again but if service stays inconsistent, we will move on

Pleasant surroundings , quiet restaurant. We wanted to enjoy the food, but all four entrees we ordered were lacking in flavor. Waiter service was just OK. Menu items were well priced.Overall, just a fair experience.

Have made two visits so far. Service on 1st first was very good, 2nd visit not so much. Food ok on first occasion, 2 out of 3 entrees ok on second visit, the chicken parmesan on the 2nd was pretty much inedible and although the server asked and was informed that it wasn't very good (in fact, she asked "was it rubbery?", which was indeed the problem)she didn't do anything about it, we still got to pay for it.

Ordered the 5-course tasting menu for my first visit here, and a delicious non-alcoholic drink. This was not only the best vegetarian food I've ever had, it was the best restaurant meal I've had in a long time. There is NOTHING like this where I live (although there should be, vegetarians & vegans abound!) and I'm strategizing how to get up to SF next so that I can return to Millenium. Service was also good.

column4: 131 Mirada Road Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: I found out it is a hit and miss with the quality of service. Pity. I love the location and the food. The other times I have been here the service has been great and super friendly. BUT NOT THIS TIME!

The food and service was great. My only disappointment was that my girlfriend and I moved over to a table for four by the window so we could see the water and the sunset. We were told that the table was reserved for a party of four, so we had to move back. A party of two arrived and were seated at this same table. No explanation or apology was given. So, for my next reservation at Miss Pearl's I will make it for a party of four by the window.
The food was ok. There is better Vietnamese food in Oakland. But the people serving we're wonderful.
Always a nice meal with friendly and attentive service.

column1: Mission Grille - Marriott Downtown San Francisco
column13: Mission Grille was recommended to me for a breakfast meeting. I was surprised how many people were waiting for a table. There were only two of us but thankfully I had made reservations. We ordered off the menu instead of the buffet. I was very disappointed in the food - which isn't cheap. My omelet was dry and the crust on my toast was burnt. The waiter was ok, nothing special. There were two instances were food was delivered to us that wasn't ours. Since they are located in a nice hotel and close to Moscone, they get a lot of convention traffic. If you want to meet over a meal, it's a good place to go. No one will be heads-down eating. If you just want breakfast, go somewhere else.

column4: 817 Terry Francois Blvd. San Francisco, CA  94158
column13: A lovely place to spend a sunny afternoon, with water views not often seen in SF. Great staff. Superb fish tacos.
The chicken in the Mistral salad, recommended by the waiter, was full of gristle, most awkward in a business lunch. Makes you wonder about ingredient quality overall. Not recommended.

column4: 325 Sharon Park Drive, Suite A2 Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: The service was great, pre-fixe menu was fun to try, and they gave us a special dessert because it was my birthday!

Mivan is an standard lunch / casual dinner type of place with better-than-standard food. They have greek standards and a few innovations --- my friend had a all-cheese pizza that was excellent. Good value for the money --- I recommend it.

column4: 1035 S. Winchester Blvd San Jose, CA  95128
column13: Large selection of sashimi, nigiri sushi, and creative rolls. A little pricier than other Japanese restaurants but service and up-scale ambiance are what you pay for. Loud place.....
The food is good, but I think that the prices are high for the location and service. Our server brought us the appetizers and entree at the same time!!!
Great place for Japanese tapas. I love their table setup and although ambiance is dark...completey unassuming from the outside.

Went just after a sellout Giants game. No problems with the reservation even though they get slammed after a game. Service was a little slow after they filled up as should be expected. Food and wine were good. Go Giants!!!
lime chicken was slightly under cooked, large outside dinning area, bar was packed

This is a nice looking restaurant with great service. I can't find anything to complain about. I tried. The wine menu is extensive, and at first I thought I could criticize the overpriced wines that went into the $400 dollar range as being elitist robbery. But no, they had some down to earth wines that were nice. I just couldn't find anything too be critical about. I'm definitely off my game. Disappointing I know. It seemed a ripe opportunity to pick fun at the wealthy digs of Montclair, but then they took my yelp coupon without trying to embarrass us. How can I complain about that?
We were very impressed with this restaurant. Waiter recommended a great wine -- reasonably priced. Everyone liked their entree -- mussels, braised lamb shank and salmon. We'll go back again.

Although the less experienced/younger did not have the finesse of the more seasoned staff, they were still wonderful (and it's just a matter of time for them!) The service was otherwise perfect. Our waiter, John (and also the pastry chef) was timely, helpful, thoroughHe was engaging and friendly, but just enough; as in, we did not feel like he was on our date with us. The decor is lovely—simple and elegant—and really allows the spectacular ocean view, and in our case, the sunset, to be the showcase. The food was wonderful... very fresh, perfectly prepared and beautifully presented. Looking forward to going back.

the girl at the door , she need to give a little more attention to guest , and a smile sometime is nice to !!and when someone tell you , you have a reservation , check it !!i don't think i will go back ,
The owner knew it was our first time at his restaurant and he made us feel very welcomed. Lovely seasoned dishes and the best pomogranite margaritas ever!
Had a great time. Wasnt sure about going to Morimoto while in Napa since there are so many amazing places in the area, but we are so glad we did!

Way too over-priced. Especially on your wine. Funny how you charge for some wine over a hundred dollars wich I can buy for less the 30 dollars ... Food very standard. Nothing special. But the bread was nice... Have had much better steaks in third world country's for the price of your glass of wine.

column4: 177 Park Avenue, Suite 100 San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Overall it was a great experience. Everyone was so nice and very courteous. They took a picture of my boyfriend and I because it was our anniversary and printed it and framed it for us! So nice. Food and cocktails were excellent. The only flaw was that we had ordered one of steaks Oscar style and it came out plain. They quickly fixed it though. And the potatoes came out a few minutes after everything else did. A small timing issue. I would go back here again.

The mini burgers and food for kids is cute. The menu sounds much better than the actual product that arrivwes at your table. The calamari was fine but the sauce terrible. When i asked for a simple aoili i was given thousand island dressing. The cesar salad should not have kalamata olives in it. Otherwise our main courses were okay for the price. Bring warm clothes. We were freezing the whole time.

Beautiful ocean views. If you want to eat outside at the fire pits, order something easy to hang onto. There are no tables out there, only benches, and it's dog friendly out there, so watch out for little beggers!. I recommend this place to anyone.

column4: 55 Music Concourse Drive San Francisco, CA  94118
column13: An oasis of calm within the Academy of Science. This is a lovely space with good food. Loved the tempura long bean appetizer. It could be a meal by itself. You don't have to purchase a ticket to the Academy in order to dine here.

Indian food in the Bay Area has been getting much better in the last few years, and this place is raising the bar even higher. The "Kurauni Jhinge" special (prawns with milky almond coconut gravy) was extraordinary, and the Navratan Korma was rich and flavorful. The special naan (stuffed with coconut, cashew, raisin and cherry) was light, yummy, and crispy with no burnt spots, and the drinks (a lemonade and a lassi) were delicious and as beautiful as fancy cocktails.

We have dined at this special mountain retreat many times over the years. Typically we have a memorable dinner. However on our last visit we found the dinner to be somewhat average. The selection of choices and presentation were top notch in my opinion. The service was friendly and not overly attentive. However the water service person was a bit too enthusiastic. Once he sent some ice from the water pitcher skidding across the table. OK. Accidents can happen, but another time he nearly dipped the bottom of the water pitcher in the plate of my companion when he reached across left to right to fill her glass. The flavor of the meal was good, but not of the quality we previously experienced.

The owners (he an architect and she an MFA/Chef) started at Cafe Pastoral in Berkeley in the 80s, then opened the now shuttered Soziac near Jack London Sq. in Oakland. Mua is their 3rd restaurant and is a fun and unique spot, especially for the East Bay. Hidden on a quiet stretch of Broadway's Auto Row, the former cavernous Body Shop has been transformed into a wonderful bar/restaurant. I initially expected a GrubPub experience but the food turned out to be really excellent, the bar quite amazing and the energy wonderful. The artwork (much of it by the owner) makes the room feel like a gallery. If I didn't know better, I'd have thought I was in the West Village. Highly Recommended.

They gave such a personal touch! It was our anniversary and we were surprised at the end of a meal with a fancy dessert plate with a piece of chocolate that had Happy Anniversary written in icing on it. Service was excellent, and while I'm not much of a foodie, I have to say the chicken was the best I've ever had in my life.
Great restaurant, very family-friendly.
I think one of the most over rated restaurants I have ever been to The only thing they have going for themselves is the location a great spot.
Fabulous Indian food with a fairly priced wine selection that compliments the food. Service is always great with our last visit exceeding expectations.

The service was extremely slow. We asked for bread which we got at the end of the meal.Food came out late and cold!Water was never refilled.Ambience, Live music is good.This place seems more of a lounge place than a restaurant.

column4: 1201 San Carlos Avenue San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: Mythos is a nice Bistro in downtown San Carlos where you can enjoy the vibrant evening community and good food.
Good value but the food could be more flavorful. Service was great.

We love Naschmarkt Restaurant. Food is always great, prepared to order. Service is always friendly, timely. We have been there several times and will most definitely return there again soon. Everything on the menu is excellent.

column1: Navio at The Ritz-Carlton, Half Moon Bay
column4: 1 Miramontes Point Road Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: Fabulous experience, great food, service and wine.

column4: Hilton Sonoma 3555 Round Barn Road Santa Rosa, CA  95403
column13: 4 of us ordered burgers for lunch - 2 rare, 1 medium rare, 1 well done. All 4 came out well done and they forgot a salad that was ordered.
The staff was so so nice and engaging. We decided to sit at the bar and were treated to many tastings and amazing apps. This may be my new favorite place!

Both times we went to Neptunes we were disappointed with the server. The restaurant was nice with a beautiful view of the bay. The food was ok, a little overpriced. Each time once at dinner time then at lunch time our server was unsatifactory. They were slow to come to the table and both of them had a, I rather be somewhere else feel about them. Will not go back again or recommend.

We came here for a 60th birthday celebration for a very close friend. I've been here at least 8 times over the years, the food is consistently very good. It was a quiet night, which was perfect. We'll be back again; it is a perfect midway point to meet when we are coming from Palo Alto and others live in the east bay.
Fair to poor food. The absolute worst service I have ever experienced. Would never go back.

Great food.. In fact, really one of the best Indian meals I've had here. The owner is very engaged and involved and guarantees that you can turn anything away if it is subpar at all. The flavors and ingredients seem to be fresh.

I mentioned when I made the reservation that it was a special occasion - birthday and anniversary - and that I wanted a table with a view. We were put at a very small table for two, limited view, but were easily seated at another table. The food ans wine were expensive, and my flank steak was almost inedible - overcooked and very tough.. The manager removed it from the check. Although the crab mac and cheese was very good, it was not worth $17 for a side dish. Nothing was offered to enhance our celebration.
Very nice overall , some of the plate could have been bigger . Great ambience and service was excellent !
I checked "great for brunch" because nobody is there for Saturday brunch--it's conducive to conversation and you get treated royally.

We frequent Nolas monthly. two out of three dishes were over cooked. A hamburger and a skirt steak. It took 45 minutes for our meal to arrive. We sent both items back. The manager was very attentive. He noticed we had problems with our order and he took care of our bill for the three of us. There was a change in shifts for the waiter/waitress. Our waitress did alert the manager of the problem with our meal. Once our order was returned correctly, the steak was good. The hamburger was fair. Empanadas were very good.

We had the first seating at 6pm. The alcove in the front of the second room fit the seven of us perfectly with street views and away from traffic. We all had the seven-course kaiseki meal with the nuances of flavors including the amuse bouche of yuzu foam with marigold petal, uni custard, the sashimi, grilled beef tongue and fried pig's ear, the beet and watermelon radish salad, the oxtail donburi with poached egg and ending with a plum ice cream with crispy, salty rice puffs. The portions are very small, so we added the seafood and pork belly ramens and the tan tan mian. The broths of both ramen dishes were very salty and disappointing. Do not go if you have a big appetite or starved, you will still be hungry. Lots of sake choices.

What a find - what a gem! Love that you can order a bowl of salad to share - and the basil dressing and hot rolls served with it were beyond yummy! Everyone in our party loved their entrees and we all enjoyed five shared scrumptious desserts! Awesome staff and service with fabulous food made for a fantastic experience that I look forward to repeating!
Poor service. Restaurant was very busy, but they should have been ready for a crowd given the weekend in question.
I thought this place was excellent. Great food and great service.

column4: 550 Stanford Shopping Center Palo Alto, CA  94304
column13: I had the shrimp cliantro salad and it was one of the best salads I've ever had

We were seated at a window table. Our waiter made us feel like the only two in the restaurant. The wine selection was superb. Highly recommend this restaurant for a first date, anniversary, or any romantic occasion.

column4: 475 E. Strawberry Drive Mill Valley, CA  94941
column13: Food was very good... right on the Bay... house wine was Delach Chardonay at $16 a bottle!
The food was absolutely delicious. I have the french toast with apples and brown sugar....LOVED IT!

When are we going to have good Brazilian food in Marin? We were so excited to be there on a day the chef made feijoada and it was delicious! We'll definitely be back. Everything written about this place is true - really good food in generous portions with extremely personable service.

column4: 524 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: O3 really exceeded my groups expectation. From the attentive wait staff, to the food, and ambiance of the restaurant. We had a large party which required us to order from a family style menu in advanced. I liked how the manager and staff were very polite and prompt in following up with me. Our menu that night consisted of: App-baby spinach salad & ribs, Entree-salmon & hanger steak, baby bok choy and a side of brown rice. Everything was prepared and cooked very well. Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

column1: The Oak Room - The Westin St. Francis
column13: Slow service, but I don't think it is the type of restaurant I'd go to expecting a quick bite to eat. Our two courses ended up taking about 2 hours from start to finish, which I found to be a little too slow, but it happens. I really enjoyed the chopped salad and lobster ravioli, I thought the french onion soup was a bit on the salty side. Overall very high quality food served in a beautiful room that even when full is still quite quiet. I look forward to going back.
Very happy and I would highly recommend.

column4: 17500 Depot Street, Suite 180 Morgan Hill, CA  95037
column13: Fabulous food, ambience, wine. Busboy was a bit sloppy and in a hurry :( but the waitress was engaging and made up for that.Food had spectacular flavors and wine was great. Really romantic setting covered by the trees on the patio - lovely afternoon all round. thank you
Delectable...as always!!! We never find ourselves going anywhere else. Thank you for the 'best' of everything.

The calamari steaks were tender and succulent and the clams escargot in butter & garlic went down well with the good, crusty French bread. Prices are very moderate; the food is definitely good value for the cost. We particularly enjoyed having our martinis with the shakers left at our table to pour as we wished. Service was attentive.

column4: Jack London Village 14301 Arnold Drive Glen Ellen, CA  95442
column13: Repeat visits for dinner showcase the complete consistency of this fine restaurant. Specials are innovative, interesting, unusual, and delicious. Wine choices are superb and service is impeccable with a highly trained and informed staff. One only has to note the elegant, small decor touches throughout this eclectic and comfortable room to understand how the restaurant is run: detail, attention to detail, and more attention to detail.

Really a fantastic evening. Took two friends from out of town who are serious about dining. Oliveto delivered: from the excellent food (standouts include rabbit wrapped in pancetta, pigeon my friend said was better than what he had in Italy) to a very special wine list. We had an 85 Riesling and a 99 barbaresco. Really awesome to be able to order these older wines at reasonable prices. When our server, Daniel, told us he was new to the restaurant, I was amazed. His descriptions of the food were outstanding. More than the food and the wine we all appreciated the spirit of hospitality exuded from every member of the staff (should not forget to mention the very warm and professional hostess). This is what dining is all about.
Quite a nice surprise, the food was good and fresh, service was quite nice and there were no lines, which is remarkable
Our server was very friendly and attentive
We are consistently choosing this restaurant over and over. The more we go, the more we want to go back. All aspects are done well with a consistent quality and care.
A great spot to eat at! Tables are somewhat crammed together, but I like that fine.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Absolutely perfect place to go if you are really in love! The fact that you lose one of your senses forces you to communicate with in other ways with your significant other. This place is the definition of ambiance~

Always loved the room since it was Fiore D'Italia, and Joe D'Magios. Love the new upgraded restaurant and am happy to see how the neighborhood has embraced the updated version of Original Joe's! Well done!

column4: 2855 Stevens Creek Blvd Westfield Shopping Mall San Jose, CA  95128
column13: The food is fantastic and spicy! We will return!

column4: 139 South B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Always a great meal with excellent service. The availability of delicious gluten-free pasta and pizza provides a real treat for customers with wheat limitations. My al dente style pasta bolognese with a true Italian brown sauce was terrific. My wife loved the Tajarin. Strong wine by the glass selection, particularly Italian wines.
A gem in the middle of almost nowhere. If you are there for lunch, have the grilled cheese. We went back for dinner.

column1: OTD (aka Out the Door – Bush St.)
column13: So you want to have an experience? This could be the place, with delicious food and a happening and energetic atmosphere. You will have a sore throat screaming to be heard, however. Why restaurants think this is essential or even acceptable is beyond me. But the food is quite remarkable and I'd go back... if I wanted to shout and smile.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Otoro Sushi is most definitely a neighborhood gem. It's Michelin rated and it's food meets the foodie expectations. Otoro is a bit on the pricey side for their specialty rolls and drink menu, but this place is set up for a dining "experience." They take open table reservations, and I highly recommend doing that as the later night craze can push a wait time close to an hour. The space is tight so be prepared for a lot of surround sound. Every night is a full night, so when packed the decibels can escalate quickly!

column4: 1606 North Main St. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Excellent Italian with a Venetian influence. Different dishes than you will find in a typical Italian restaurant. I have eaten there probably 10-12 times. I have never had a dish that was not excellent and interesting.
Ugly restaurant and the food was not very good, although our server was very nice. We missed it, but sometimes there is live music which could make the place fun during those times.

Monday's sushi special was awesome! Not a buffet set-up but an intimate seat at the sushi bar, where the excellent sushi chefs were kindly attentive and suggestive. The sake menu is nicely extensive and their special wasabi ice cream with stewed peach nicely wrapped up the dinner. I like Ozumo in Oakland more than the SF Ozumo because the staff are more friendly and the food is made w/ precision.
Best turo I've had this side of Tokyo and in incredible sake selection. Went back two nights in a row. Would have gone for a third and fourth but the time slots I was available were booked up.

column4: 1875 S. Bascom Ave #550 Campbell Campbell, CA  95008
column13: The Hawaiian menu was fantastic - almost everyone had the macadamia nut crusted Mahi Mahi. The service was good but sluggish. Took 3 requests to get a high chair as we received a booster instead. The outdoor dining was delightful and comfortable. Ambiance was great and not stuffy, and my 9 mo old wasn't out of place for grandpa's birthday. Portion sizes were just right. Would definitely return...

column4: 133 Corte Madera Town Center Corte Madera, CA  94925
column13: We love the fresh food here. The menu meets a wide range of preferences. One of the best places for seafood. Bothe the rice bowls and the salads are very satisfying.
Easy walk from DeYoung, Academy Sciences and other GG Park location. Small parking lot, but lots of street parking. One block from N Judah.

column4: 115 N. Santa Cruz Ave. Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: Food was good, service was good however the location of our table caused waiters to bump into my chair on a regular basis.
Always a pleasure eating at Palio D'Asti.. Never dissappointed and always surprised.. Thanks
One of our favorites, before or after a Giants home game. The bar menu is a gem. Both for food & drinks.I am a member of the Wine & Dine for this restaurant

We had a group of 5 and had so much fun. The food was different in a very good way and very abundant, we all ate our little hearts out. We were downstairs and the atmosphere was wonderful. The server we had was a delight and everything was excellent. If you want a romantic dinner I would suggest eating downstairs rather than the entrance dining.
On the expensive side, but the food is very good!

I've been to the Panama Hotel Restaurant 3 times now. I always get the same thing the poblano pepper with quinoa and goat cheese. It is such a simple dish yet so tasty to me. My friend got the calamari salad which is also simple, but so delicious. The next time I go I will order something different and I'm sure whatever I get will be delicious. I love sitting outside on the "veranda" on a nice evening. They play music which is pretty loud if you are sitting inside, but very good and enjoyable to listen to. You feel like you are on a mini vacation when you go here. Something about the ambiance and simple elegance about the restaurant makes it simply divine!

We were celebrating a birthday, and our waiter and staff were absolutely wonderful. The food was stellar. The birthday celebrant was comped a dessert; tiramisu which was one of the best we ever tasted. In addition, the whole party was comped a shot of Limoncello. Service was definitely above and beyond. We are planning to return soon.

column4: 333 West San Carlos Street San Jose, CA  95110
column13: Food and service were good, but overall experience was average. The seating area seems very secluded and would be good for a private event. Had an overall good experience with friends, but there wasn't anything particularly special that would bring me back.
Pappo seems to have stepped the food up a notch or two since our last visit there. Both salads we had were dressed to perfection, I had a perfectly cooked filet, and my wife's burger was spot on.
excellent food and service. Seating accomadations were a little tight.

column1: Paragon at The Claremont Hotel Club & Spa
column13: Always love this place when it's nice outside, the view is fabulous! Service & food are both pretty good too! Haven't been disappointed any time I've went!

Paragon is great for all activities at PacBellPark. We had a meal before going to the SFOpera event and had a very good caesar salad, with anchovies! And roast chicken, a glass of wine and we were good to go!

column4: 600 Stockton at California Street San Francisco, CA  94108
column13: I'm always surprised at the divergent reviews for Parallel 37. We have always founc the food to be exceptional - and other than an over-priced wine list, this is one of the best meals in town. Unfortunately, the "chef" has just left to join Michael Mina. It may be a challenge to find a replacement of Ron Seigel's talent.
Extremely pleasant, relaxed atmosphere with great service. Food is very good, but not exceptional.

I'm a long time customer, been eating here and referring customers here since they opened. Although, I Love the food, staff is " friendly" enough to order a meal, but definitly NO personalities so i find myself not referring so many friends because of the staff at times. Beach Chalet and Park Chalet have a high staff turnaround so I'm not sure what the problem is, but the food is pretty great. So if you can tolerate their poor sense of customer service and no personalities try the Park Chalet burger - its tiny and arrives by itself in a basket its tasty.

column4: 10030 S. De Anza Blvd. Cupertino, CA  95014
column13: The food is well prepared, taste good, but with their lunch meal expect to walk away hungry.
What makes Park Tavern a great place is the service and lively energy that is evident thoughtout the restaurant. The wait staff makes you feel like you are a guest in their home.

column4: 884 Portola Road A-1 Portola Valley, CA  94028
column13: Nice spot and good food. Unfortunately, our waiter seemed quite oblivious to our presence; happier instead to talk with his colleagues. Dishes languished, bill never came, etc. Hopefully, an outlier...

The food and margaritas were good. The service was fine and did well with 6 people . Was good location and close to Red Devil lounge, where we went after. The dining room looked nothing like picture shown and could use some improvement.
We had a great experience at Pasion celebrating my daughter's 21st birthday! Food was delicious, service was great and the ambiance was perfect!

column4: 1991 W El Camino Real Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: Food was very good. Service was a little slow, had to wait for bread for a long time, even after asking requesting a couple of times. Buffet was pretty good.

column4: 315 Main St. Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: This is one of my all-time favorite restaurants. Not fancy, not pretentious. Just consistent and very good. I have a set routine when I go to pasta moon. I get a flat brick oven pizza as an appetizer for two, then I have the lasagna (among the best anywhere), then the butterscotch pudding. Anytime I am close to Half Moon Bay, I go here.

column4: 3124 Crow Canyon Place San Ramon, CA  94583
column13: After waiting forever the just okay food was delivered. The restaurant was not crowded, so it's hard to tell why four pasta dishes could take so long. The waiter did apologize for the slow service. We won't be going back any time soon.
Using open table really makes thing quick and easy....i love it!!!
The fresh salmon was delicious and the service was superb.
Great place. And great music featuring Trio Sin Lio with David Belove on bass.

Great place if you want some entertainment with dinner. Not cheap, but the service was exceptional and food was 5 star. You can have a low key dinner upstairs and they'll reserve a table for you downstairs.

Par Diem has fantastic food and wine at a great price. It's a great place to go for a drink or dinner with friends. The booths are big and comfy, and the rest of the restaurant has a unique vibe. It's relaxed yet still a nice place to spend your evening.

I absolutely love Pera. The food is excellent! And the service is so warm, friendly and welcoming. I recently brought 10 members of my family there for a special get-together, and they took wonderful care of us.

the food was delicious and wine was a good selection. The servers had good knowledge of the food and wine so was very helpful in that aspect. We were limited on time since we were going to a show afterwards, the servers made sure we were finished in enough time to get us to our show on time. Thank you so much!!
This is a great lunch spot to take coworkers, clients, family with a diverse menu and decent prices. Very attentive wait staff both times I've been.

I've always liked Perry's. For this occasion, I had a group on a super-busy Saturday night. I increased the group size twice and the staff at Perry's were HAPPY to accommodate. Superb customer service.

Peter Lowell's provides consistently great food--clean, healthy and well prepared. It is by far our favorite food in Sebastopol. This visit I turned another friend on to the Macro bowl--she does not usually eat vegetarian entrees. She was blown away and can't wait to return. My other friend and I split the seitan reuban which was rich and delicious, and a salad. The service was friendly and attentive. No complaints!

Piacere has had its up and downs over the years in terms of consistency. The waitstaff has gone up a notch and with the female chef at the helm it continues to grow and expand.We have been eating out side as of late and it has been lovely.
Food, wine, and service were top-notch,Noise level was high however,A little pricey, thoughOverall, a nice place with excellent, unique dishes
Piatti is a beautiful restaurant in a lovely setting, but the food is not that good. Also, the place is just too noisy.

Our overall experience was great. The food was great. The service was excellent. The follow up was very good. The only issue was the large table next to us. They let two young girls run around the restaurant as if it was their house disturbing our table and many other tables, plus making it difficult four our waitress to serve us. This was a blemish to an otherwise great experience.
My glass of Chianti smelled and tasted like a "wet dog." The pasta with ragu I ordered was lukewarm and simply wasn't that good. I have had much better meals there in the past.

Authentic Italian food and staff and ambiance. Reminded me of being in Italy. Excellent lobster ravioli in tomato cream sauce. Wish they had more wine by the glass selection, but otherwise great experience

Food excellent (4th visit). Fried chicken and gouda mac 'n cheese remains killer app although I think portions smaller than last visit in May. Service was ungodly slow - waitress disappeared between each course. Should have been a leisurely 1.5 hours, took 2.5 hours. Surprising as sevice has always been top notch in past. Also lost our open table reservation, but seated us after short delay. Overall food 4, service 1 star this visit.
Excellent food and service. We were seated at one of the two tables in the bar - which gets crowded and noisy as the night goes on. Next time, I will insist on the dining room.

column4: Pier 23, On The Embarcadero San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Pier 23 is a fun restaurant/bar with good food. It's not gourmet by any means, but they have good comfort food in a cool enviroment, whether you eat inside or outside. It's a great place to meet a friend(s).

column1: Pier Market Seafood Restaurant - Pier 39 SF
column13: The seafood there is delicious with reasonable price and good service.Great view outside.Highly recommend.

We were seated on the back patio, which was really nice and cozy, until a large party arrived and they were so loud that it sort of ruined the atmosphere for me. The food was good, although nothing really stood out as being fantastic.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Scandavian Food is an acquired taste.

column4: Pier 3, The Embarcadero San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: It was good/great, not fantastic. It's hard to articulate what it could improve on.
I'll never forget the taste of that chicken!
Celebrated my wifes birthday here staff were fab food spot on a view to remember table near the window with Alcatrz view, top night great staff will deffo go again when in town. Steve from UK
Our family celebrated my daughter's 21st Birthday and we had a memorable experience at the Plaza Bistro! We definetely will go back again! Sincerely, Katerina
It was good. Also they did not serve cheese dip of any kind.
Wow! One of the best restaurants we've ever eaten at!!!
The table wasn't ready whene arrived on time. We had to wait 30 minutes.The food was OK, fish slightly overcooked. Service very slow.

Had the Chef's Grand Tasting Menu and it was fantastic. The uni and crab souffle was amazing. Definitely recommend trying that. Our host was very pleasant and knowledgeable. Our dinner ended up being about 3 hours of amazing food and great conversations.
Heard a lot of great things about Poesia. The appetizers were fantastic but the entree was nothing special.

We had an outstanding meal at Poggio! While the restaurant is a bit "energetic" (noisy), the food was fantastic. The service was attentive without being annoying. Also thrilled to fine one of my favorite Pinot Noirs on the wine list! We would highly recommend and will definitely come back!

column4: 1700 Coyote Point Dr San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Took a friend and her two children here on a Sunday Brunch outing...told our serverFernando it was her birthday and he brought her a birthday sundae at the end of our meal.I give gold stars when a server remembers occassions!!!!Great place ... the Irish Cream French Toast was the best!!!!!

The food and cocktails at Poquito were great! The service was also strong. Our waitress - though super busy - never made us feel like she was busy, stopping by to check in, very friendly and warm. But there's something just a tad off about the ambiance/decor. It's very clean and the bar is beautiful, but it just feels a little flat. Given the delicious meal, scrumptious and unusual cocktails, reasonable prices and warm service that shouldn't matter, but this being SF, I really wanted to run out and get them some candles, tablecloths and great floor tile to just take things up a notch.

column4: 60 E. Third Ave San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Very good service, & friendly staff. The waiter successfully entertained our 7 year old without being intrusive or forgetting about the food. Tasty food. I had a great filet, and the rest of the family really enjoyed their meals; excellent risotto, onion soup, mac & cheese. Not inexpensive, but a good value. We'll be back and encourage our friend to go as well.

column1: Porter's Restaurant - Poppy Ridge Golf Course
column13: The food was awesome and the band was great. I had a party of seven and the ages went from 13 to 84 and everyone had a wonderful time. Thank you.
I think the menu is too limited.

column4: 1801 E. Cotati Ave Rohnert Park, CA  94928
column13: this was opening night and so the staff was still getting the routine. Overall we enjoyed it and would return!

We ate outside, and the weather was beautiful. The Blue Angels were practicing overhead, and excitement was high. The food was splendid. I have never had swordfish prepared the way it was presented, and all I can say is, I wish I had some now.
Funky and fun--this upscale diner is definitely worth a trip to the Presidio. Food was excellent. A really nice place for a lunch date.

column4: 587 St. Helena Hwy (Hwy 29) St. Helena, CA  94574
column13: One of the best meals we had in the Napa valley. Best filet we have ever eaten

As a repeat customer, gotta say that the food is wonderful, but menus need to change and be creative. Rodney is excellent chef but the menu needs to change once in awhile, even though items may be similar. Customers want good consistent food but change can be better. esp. in this market!!!The $25 burrito challenge is worth it!
Great salmon dish. Too bad bar food can't be ordered at tables.

column1: The Pub BBQ at Ghiradelli Square
column13: We went there after a 49ers game, thinking it might be busy because it's open later than most places near the Wharf... It was nearly empty, but the the grub was decent - quality, well priced pub food. Maybe we just chose the wrong spot on the the wrong day??

An overall enjoyable experience. We were seated promptly upon arrival time of our reservation and service was prompt and pleasant. Food was good quality. Would definitely eat there again the next time I visit San Francisco.
Clean restaurant with aside choice of foods. Food was good and service fair. Place was empty on a Wednesday night. We will return and try rest of food. May try a weekend.

Sat down and your 2 hostess where great and sat me down fast and told me they where practicing on how pronounced my name which impresses me! But it went down hill from there. Waiter came by got my drink and for next 15 mins I was passed by and he would never come back. I look for him but he qould position him self to not make eye contact. I will give them second chance tonight only because of two hostess.

column1: Quattro Restaurant and Bar - Four Seasons Hotel
column4: 2050 University Ave @ University Circle East Palo Alto, CA  94303
column13: very pleasant dining experience. Our waitress was most informative on wine selections. I informed hostess my guest has a birthday. She to our table and informed me the kitchen will do a special dessert for the birthday girl on the house. Very generous and most enjoyable!My guest went back the same weekend with her family!!
Absolutely fantastic. Food, service, wine - all top notch. One of our favorite fine dining establishments.
I've been eating here for over 6 years and it is always an enjoyable experience. Great beer selection and nice view over the water and marina.

The food was great! It's a shame they charge extra to make items gluten-free but it tastes so good that it's worth it! The staff was attentive at first but once we received our food, they didn't check in on us at all, and seemed to be more helpful to their regulars/friends.

I really liked the concept of this restaurant however the food was just okay. I had the lamb shoulder which was over salted, to the point that I didn't care to eat it. My boyfriend had the pork chop which was actually quite exceptional. So I am not sure if my meal was just a miss and everything else was good. I also had the corn soup (pretty good). I would go back again but who knows if I actually ever will with all the other great options.
The main dining room was really packed with tables and as a result was very loud...to the point of not being able to hear your date across the table at a normal speaking volume.
Good food, ample servings. service was fine.

column4: 7335 Bollinger Road Unit C Cupertino, CA  95014
column13: Excellent food as always. We recommend the mushroom pizza, chili crab, coffe glazed short ribs, basil eggplant, crispy crab bites, kim chee and shave ice. Service was very attentive. We were there for wine Wednesday, which we did know, we got half off the bottle of wine.

A little gem at the end of Claremont Ave. Easy parking, great menu and perfect recommendations. Our server suggested bringing the dishes in a family style plate which was great for browsingall of the items in an easy, fun format.

Food was authentic and tasted great however service was the complete opposite. If you leave hungry, it's your own fault. Portion sizes are huge. Only one server who had the personality of a rock. Extremely slow so don't expect to have a quick meal.

From the amazing Manhattan, to the ahi tartar appetizer, through to the scallops and enchiladas, every bite and sip was fantastic. The service was matched to the quality of the food. This us a great restaurant.

I had a friend visiting from out of state, and wanted to take her for lunch to a cute place where we could sit outside. We went to Redd Wood with the intention of ordering pizza. However, after hearing about the burger special (and then seeing the folks at the next table enjoy it), we both ordered it and were not disappointed! Neither of us typically eats red meat, but this burger was amazing! It was primarily ground beef, but contained a small percentage of ground pork as well. Served on a freshly baked bun, it was topped with fontina, caramelized onions and garlic aioli. Complemented by greens and parmesan fries, it was delicious! Our server was great, too - very attentive, personable and fun. Overall, we had a wonderful experience.
We had an wonderfully enthusiastic and friendly waitress.The ambiance is nice.The food is a little overpriced and not especially inspired.
a Southeast Asian/Chinese fusion. Had Vietnamese-type spring rolls with Beijing Duck - delicious!

Generous helpings of good French bistro food--the hamburger is wonderful, with its caramelized onions, etc. Friendly, efficient and helpful service. Only drawback for us is that there's no noise absorption, and when it's full--which is usually--the noise can be a bit nerve-wracking.
Meal wasn't the best I've ever had there - but still a very solid place.
Good for a casual meal and watching sports

My wife and I dined at the Restaurant at Meadowood on October 4th. We have dined at Alinea, Next, Charlie Trotters, Tru, Everest, etc. The service and environment is on par or exceeds these places. The food, although presented interestingly, can not keep up. The chefs tasting menu at the Farm the night before was much better, and less than half the cost.
Great ambience and service. Very good food and wine.

Everything we ordered was delicious, and we ordered various meat and vegetarian dishes. We had the vegetarian spring rolls, hot and sour soup and the spinach and mushroom dumplings to start, then ordered the braised tofu, buddha's delight, kung pao chicken, mongolian beef and the vegetable chow mein....topped off with the fried banana dessert....seriously everything was amazing! The service was also wonderful and friendly....we can't wait to go back!
Chicken was terrific. Table service was great. Little slow in kitchen on Sat night. Ask for Chris. Live music the night we were there. Lots of fun.

I continue to get excellent food here. Everytime I've gone, the dishes have been great and I've left satisfied. I look forward to returning soon. The vol au vant appetizer is great. Go for the salmon or mussels for an entree.

column4: 303 N Santa Cruz Ave Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: Every time I come to Restaurant James Randall, I have an exceptionally amazing time. The food always exceeds my expectations and the service is right on point. I came here on 10/3 for my boyfriend's birthday dinner and we had a great time and the gnocchi's and burger were amazing. I absolutely recommend RJR to anyone who wants to eat great food & treat themselves to a classy experience.

column4: 675 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94301
column13: We have had brunch here many times and always find the food varied and very good.
It was a great experience. The food was well done.

The Richmond is the perfect neighborhood place when you really want to talk to the people with whom you are dining - quiet, wonderful food, great service, and reasonable prices. Consistently good! A favorite for us for years
Best service ever, and deeeeeelish food.

Our family enjoyed dining al fresco at this yummy Italian restaurant in downtown Petaluma. The eggplant parmigiana is more torte-like and cleanly elegant. The heirloom caprese was delicious. We enjoyed the polenta chocolate cake. Cocktails and beers with local roots added to a festive dining experience.
Ristobar was wonderful, as usual. We will return soon.
Everything was outstanding. All four of us cleaned our plates entirely
Not much curb appeal, but once you walk in the front door, it's an amazing experience. Very authentic - great wait staff - and phenomenal food.
Super Italian food and fantastic service. Can't wait to go back!
Home made desserts and excellent risotto di mare made for a wonderful dinner.

column4: 827 Santa Cruz Avenue Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: The polenta and eggplant dish is awesome!!
Rude greeting by lady hostess, very noisy and the prices keep going up, up, up. Pane e Vino and Amarena are both better neighborhood choices.
Seating a bit stiff (hard chairs) pillows help but need some flat ones for sitting on.
Enjoyed the beautiful view and our food was great.

This was my second time at Rivoli. The first time was really amazing, the mushroom fritters are amazing and my entree was delicious. That was the reason I decided to come back and buy a gift certificate for my friend the other night.

Fashion forward menu, with some unorthodox combinations but all worth the risk of ordering. Fun ambiance, fun night, one of my new favorites. Sea Urchin 1st course the best bite we had. Enjoyed the twist on classic cocktails too.

The lamb dish and past dish were excellent, However the chicken dish was like rubber. The salad with parmesian cheese was not presented well. Just piled on the lettuce and very little parmesan. Also too much dressing.

A wonderful restaurant, Rocca is truly the place to go in Burlingame if you love Italian food, great service and pleasant surroundings. However, there is one drawback (yes, only one!)and that is the noise level. At times it can become overwhelming, especially if a table has more than 4 people. In such a case, we choose to have a table upstairs if possible if we know a large party won't be following us. It's a great resaurant, noisy or not!

We made internet reservations and we called to let them know that we were going to be a little late. They told us no problem and that they were also running a little behind. We arrived and we were seated within 5 minutes! It was really busy and we were pleasantly surprised that we were taken in so quickly. The food was delicious. I had the nightly special and my wife enjoyed the gnocchi. The wine list was good and we really had a nice dinner. I don't think I would travel so far out of my way again, but I would return any time I was in the neighborhood.

I made a reservation for 15 people, and though it took them a little while to set up our table (~15-20 min), we were provided a few munchies while we waited. This was also at prime dinner time (6:30pm). We ate outside, which was beautiful. The only downside was that there wasn't enough of those heater lamps to keep us all warm, so bring a sweater if you're going to be there after the sun sets. The food was very good and arrived together, which for 15 people is great service. The pretzel appetizers were great; everyone especially liked the sauce it came with. The bacon chicken mac and cheese was a favorite. The meat was overcooked a little, i.e. rare came out medium-rare and medium-rare came out medium. I recommend them for casual dining.

First time there, my husband wanted to take me out to dinner for my birthday before we went to the symphony, we got there early for our reservation, but it was no problem since they had just opened for the dinner shift. Our waitress was excellent, I wish I remember her name but she was extremely nice and very knowledgable about the menu and all the daily specials. The food was amazing and the prices were very reasonable. We loved the Hawaiian spring roll , the White Walu sashimi it was to die for, and many other yummy dishes. We would definitely go back

I went here for an anniversary dinner- it was perfect! The food is always excellent and it adds a fun element because you cook your meat yourself. My boyfriend loved it and we'll be coming back in the future!
Food was very good, staff was attentive, decor was nice - BUT restaurant was empty. This fact did not affect the quality of the food - still fresh and definitely cooked to order.
We are from Holland and every year we visit SF. Also Rosa Pistola is a must to go to :-) Great food and wines. Just go there and we are sure you want to go back again.
didn't knock our socks off but these days we settle for competent.

Awesome coffee to go with a tasty breakfast selection. Drawback is club music being played loudly during breakfast service. We asked to have it turned down and they werekind and accommodating. I would recommend this breakfast place to others.

food and service were good - to very good - and I would return. However, several items from the nightly special menu were unavailable which was both odd and annoying. So, recommend you order off the main menu and you should be fine.

column4: 53 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: Excellent Indian, some different dishes, but the classics were excellent too.
We popped in for a quick dinner with our young children. Great kids menu and awesome rotisserie chicken. Appetizers were ok but not great. Great service. A bit cold and breezy even inside.

column1: The Rotunda at Neiman Marcus - San Francisco
column13: I have been to the Rotunda many times. It is a must for lunch when I visit San Francisco. Last week I had the Ribollita soup special, it was outstanding. One of the best versions of Ribollita I have tasted. That, along with the lovely popovers and a great flat bread made for a memorable lunch.
Pretty meh.
Always enjoyable, food and service outstanding

Enjoyed our meal. As we were greeted there was no spirit of aloha no Hawaiian shirt no smile. He looked down on the ground never made eye contact with us. Previous visits the girls would greet us be dressed nicely smile so you fell welcomed. Here it is just a job as if you have a chip on your shoulder need to work hard on customer service the Asian boy was on Wednesday night when we were there. The calamari appetizer was a bit spicy and if I were to order again no peppers way too hot. Dipping sauce made this dish double hot and from previous visits the foods were all over salted so we asked that no extra salt be added. We called to say we were late due to the Oracle convention and the boy answered didn't seem to care.
the food and service were excellent.

Second visit. We knew the menu would be limited but it was less appealing than on our first visit a few months ago. We thought the dishes were decent at best--bar food. Not really appropriate for dinner. Service was flippant and almost hostile. In addition, forget the wine list--many bottles are priced at 4x retail, an outrageous markup. I don't know South American wines well at all but the online community views of the five bottles I researched before giving up was pretty dim, ranging from mid 80s to mid 70s on cellartracker. Stick to beer or margaritas if you decide to go. We won't return.
This is a rock solid and dependable neighborhood bistro with a good variety, especially for a non-red meat eater.
Food and service were superb. Knowledgeable wait staff. Great patio.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
column4: 1601 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94109
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: great steaks - we ordered ribeye and filet. they came on sizzling hot platters and were prepared nearly perfectly. the appetizers were really good too.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Walnut Creek
column4: 1553 Olympic Blvd. Bldg. E Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Great food and a great staff! I will return soon!
The restaurant was not open for business when I arrived. It was dark and empty.
We ordered prime rib, oysters, halibut and a filet. Everything was done perfectly and delicious. Best steaks in Sonoma. Great service. Wonderful ambiance.

column4: 1143 San Carlos Ave. San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: If you know your Indian food like we do, then you will know this restaurant's food & service should not be rated better than "Fair", and that is being generous. You really have to compare the food with Clay Oven (San Mateo) and Suraj (Redwood City) to gain a good ability to discern the quality of Indian food, chiefly dishes like Butter Chicken or Chicken Tikka Masala, and also the Nan bread. If you have been to either of the restaurants I mentioned then you have to downgrade this experience considerably. And like most Indian resteraunts, the friendliness factor is consistently questionable, and this is no different. You have to love the way the check is brought back with a drop on the table and not word of thanks said. Perfect ending...

column4: 1075 Sutter Street Hotel Carlton San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: Saha was ranked # 2 on TripAdvisor for vegan food, but they have a great selection of non-vegan fare as well. The trout special that I had was fantastic. Everything was great. had a great time and enjoyed the staff, even though they were short-handed and rushed.

The restaurant was a Gourmet's experience. Every dish was prepared with stress both on the visual side - together with proper dishes for each course - and the tasty side - each dish was a culinary piece of art.

The food was quite good, but we were given a table at the back of the restaurant in a room that was very congested (little room for the waiters to move between all the chairs) and had poor ambience compared to the front dining hall. I've enjoyed coming to Sakoon in the past, but this visit was sub-par in terms of dining experience as well as value.
Food was good but service really lacked attention. Appetizer plates stayed on the table after we were served our entrees.
Disappointed in the menu. Just wanted crab. Not crab smothered in garlic butter

I thought the food was quite so-so. I ordered the soup, which was fine, but the tomato salad was not. It's the first week of October: there's really no excuse for serving tomatoes that are somewhat hard and not colorful through to the middle. Coincidentally I ate at Perbacco the next day and also ordered a tomato salad, which was excellent.
A GREAT FIND-- GREAT FOOD-- GREAT SERVICE--GREAT DRINKS--GREAT LOCATION-- SOOTHING VIEW
Wonderful view of the water and a local favorite.

column4: 4210 Cabrillo Hwy Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: The Gazpacho soup starter was delicious as was the Blue Crab Sandwich. I always recommend Sam's Chowder House to people who are visiting the San Mateo county coast and Half Moon Bay in particular. The employees are pleasant, attentive and efficient.
Delicious and well priced lunch special. Sit by the windows and you can look out onto Yerba Buena gardens. Random place being inside the Metreon but convenient location.

I made the reservation but was the last one to arrive. My friends were so impressed that they were greeted like a VIP and seated right away. The food was always a treat. Some of my friends came to Livermore for the first time. They were pleasantly surprised with the lunch experience and the downtown.

column1: Santé at the Fairmont Sonoma Mission Inn
column13: Outstanding food. Preparation of each dish was special, deserving of the praise we've heard for years. So glad our travels took us there to enjoy it. Morgan and Kawiki (sp?) are a great serving team. Wine list is impressive and well represented by the sommelier.

Excellent food, excellent service and a great value. Food was fresh and bright. Prices were very affordable for both the quality and quantity of food that was presented. We had a large group and they were able to accommodate us in every way. Will definitely recommend and visit again.

column4: 105 Town and Country Drive Danville, CA  94526
column13: The flat bread and dipping sauce are great!
The carpaccio veneto is fantastic. The mustard mixes very well with the raw meat. The minestrone soup had a lot of vegetables and tasted really good.

This restaurant, in a strip mall, has no ambiance at all. However, the food is good, fresh, plentiful, made to order, and reasonably priced. The service is friendly and attentive. This is obviously a family owned and run operation. The people are working hard to provide good fresh food to please their patrons and make a success of their restaurant

column4: 1432 N. Main Street Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: This is absolutely one of the best restaurants in Walnut Creek and one of my favorites! Sasa has original, amazing dishes, many of which you cannot find anywhere else.

Belden Place sauce is the second Sauce restaurant and has it's own look and feel. The tomato bisque soup is divine. Service is always wonderful. We had a birthday group there and were taken care of very well.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: we went prior to the opera. we had brussels sprout salad and portobello mushroom bisque which are standouts that i would gravitate to again and again. my husband had the fried chicken which he likes to have as a repeat entree. i had the salmon as my entree which my husband likes and wants to try the next time he goes. we had a peach cobbler for dessert which was also very good. they always do a seasonal cobbler. most of their entrees are regular items on the menu which they don't vary very much so if you're looking for variety it's good but not necessarily stand out food. but if you like to get reliably delicious food made simply and you like to get the same items over and over this is a great restaurant. also good for opera crowd.
