We had a whole fish for two that was cooked to perfection. Our waiter was in his first week. Very nice, but service was slow between courses. We will dine here again and bring friends.
Saylor's is a neighborhood gem, always a warm welcome, great people and very good food.
Most authentic Ceviche I've tasted outside of Peru! Muy rico!
We took out of town guests to dinner before a ACT play. The waiter was helpful in suggesting itemss on the menu. Pizzas, risotto, soup,salads...everything was fresh and flavorful.

The view absolutely makes this cozy restaurant perched right on the water. The decor and the food need some updating. Both are a bit old-fashioned. But the staff couldn't be nicer or more accommodating.

column4: 1333 North California Blvd. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Great place for a simple get together or a special celebration!

We came to Scott's after watching the blue angels. The restaurant looks nice but the service was lacking. Our salads took around 20 minutes to be delivered to the table. After another 30 minutes, our entries arrived. I ordered the 16 oz NY strip which was cooked properly but lacked the peppercorn sauce. Overall I would give it a 3.5 out of 5.

column4: 855 El Camino Real Building #1 Town & Country Village Center Palo Alto, CA  94301
column13: Scott's has a lively bar scene and is a meeting spot for many groups, but it's also possible to have a reasonably quiet dinner. Food is reliably good if not amazing and prices are reasonable. Salads are large so you will probably want to share.
Great food, awesome rooftop dining. The one downside is its under the flight path to the SJC airport.

column1: Scott's Seafood Mountain View (fka The Cantankerous Fish)
column13: Friday lunch with friends.
Food was awful, service ok. Steak was ordered medium and arrived very rare. Halibut was dry and overcooked.
Tasty eclectic comfort food in a bright and welcoming setting. Once quibble is that for the price the food felt too pre-prepared.
Even better that San Rafael! Just very satisfying in every way and reasonable as well.

I went to Sear's for dinner with my son and his girlfriend while I was visiting them in San Francisco. In found it to be a warm, comfortable enviroment - similar to some of the established restaurants I am used to in downtown Chicago. They serve good food in the classic American style. They offer the types of dishes that I might serve to the family at home, for example pot roast, roast chicken, etc. They executed these very well I thought. The substantial meals felt very comforting on a cold, foggy San Francisco evening.

column1: Seasons at the Four Seasons Hotel
column4: 757 Market St. Four Seasons Hotel San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: Our server Josephina was outstanding, but clearly you need more servers. She had to cover so many tables andthe kitchen was slow. Something I typicallydon't experience at the seasons. This was on a Saturday night.

For the prices, the food was very average. I would not return as the taste and temperature of the food did not match the prices they are charging. The portion size was good. The chocolate cake was the best part. However, the main courses should have been the best part. Overall, the food was not impressive at all.

Very good sushi restaurant, with fresh ingredients and good quality. Innovative appetizers and spicey rolls, but few really exotic seafood items except for monkfish which was so so and pricey. No uni on the night we went; their supplier was on vacation. The kurobuta appetizer is also excellent. No ramen or udon or other hot dishes to balance out the sushi. Prices are also a bit on the high side and add up rapidly with the small dishes. We were a party of 5, given a table in an enclosed area, and were not aware that 18% service charge was already put on the bill, and ended up double tipping. Upon notification the next day, the restaurant graciously credited back the second tip. Will go back again, but only for special occasions.
Disappointed in the new way the octopus is prepared.

We felt the food was very good. We were disappointed that the ambiance seemed a bit dated. We were most disappointed to have such a pricey and romantic meal spoiled by a couple who thought it would be a good idea to bring their toddler to the restaurant, who they allowed to run around their table and yell. We were also shocked when the man at the table next to us, who we overheard saying was celebrating his wife's birthday, have his phone ring and then take the call!

Enjoyed the food very much (had skirt steak), wines okay-good, a little loud, fantastic friendly service, kind of hip, cool space, great proximity to 280 if you are passing through and don't feel like driving all over sf, easy parking.
Great restaurant in Tiburon, easy to walk to from nearby hotels.

Had not heard of Seven Hills, but read about it on Tripadvisor. The food was excellent and reasonably priced for the quality. The staff were very amicable and knowledgeable regarding the menu. We had a very nice experience. The only negative is parking, but welcome to San Francisco. You will have a great time.

We usually go to the shiki sushi in San Mateo but decided to try the san carlos location. The service is not the same. They are much friendlier in San Mateo. I like the atmosphere in San Carlos but wiuld rather go to the san mateo one for the service.
Love the food at Shiok! Very well-cooked. The prix fixe menu is a bargain and very delicious. I would definitely recommend and return.
This is a local spot that should have them standing in line. Sonoma just doesn't appreciate a good restaurant if it isn't on the plaza. Give it a try; you'll return again and again.
Nice ambience, good waiter, not so great food.

Slow and salty. It's an hour before our first dish (the tom kha gia soup) to come out and then another 40 minutes for the second dish (massaman nuea) to come. And all of them were way too salty and not worth the super long wait.

It was poor overall. The waitress did not inform me the vintage of the wine was sold out and brought me one 3 years younger. There did not seem to be enough wait staff for the number of tables. The food was overall substandard.

Noisey..we were put next to a routy 4 some.. tables close together. The food??? A simple beet salid... they put layers of goat cheese between small slices of beets-- over done, something "Denny's" would try.

column1: Silver Clouds Restaurant and Karaoke Bar
column13: The restaurant was clean but the service was very slow. They ran out of baked potato's and the fish tasted like dish soap. We had a big group of people and they would not split our check and gave us a hand written ticket that we could barely read and a calculator.

column4: 3020 N. St. Helena Hwy Suite A Saint Helena, CA  94574
column13: We had a large family with two small grandchildren. We ate outside, perfect for the kids, big picnic table, they were very accommodating.
Food was good. Service very good
Excellent service Food was good for being on the Embarcodero.
Very pleased with our experience.Thank you
Very fresh flavorful food. Loved the use of tomatoes in the Korma. Good casual dining.
We arrived at 2:30 pm for a late lunch. Got lucky and secured a table by the window. Watched the Blue Angels show while we ate a delicious lunch. A great experience.
Great clean, light food. Fantastic service. Fun cocktails. Wonderful outdoor patios.

I have been going to SLANTED DOOR for many years and its astounding how bad the service has gotten.unattentive, food never comes on time or your orderes are completely forgotten.even rude rude busboys.our waitress was so obnoxious this last time and the busboys were even worse.
We always have a terrific meal at the Slow Club but last Friday night was really exceptional.
We had a wonderful evening .... food, service, atmosphere ... all terrific. Our out-of-town guest raved. Thanks.

column4: 421 Cypress Avenue South San Francisco, CA  94080
column13: A family owned old style Italian restaurant. Good food, good portions reasonable prices. Wait staff was new And struggled a bit, but not really a problem since we were not in a hurry. Wine list was appropriate for this type of place and prices not crazy 2 x retail. They can accommodate bigger parties. If I lived nearby, it would be a place I would go to on a fairly regular basis. No surprises.
Stopped in for lunch. Had a "flight" of three wine tastings along with a "Harvest Hoagie" and a Steak Salad for lunch. Really enjoyed the food, service and setting.
Great Mediterranean cuisine near the Metreon. Restaurant is attached to a hotel, even though it has it's own entrance. Ambiance is OK.
Not what I expected---but that was my fault and ignorance.
Excellent food. The shortribs were perfectly done. Our waitress was very patient with us as it was our first time there. They had a nice wine menu too. Great experience overall. We will go back.
The best meal I have had for years-and well priced.

column4: 417 South California Avenue Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: Table for four, this time a business lunch. Place is light, airy, and efficient. Discovered that you can come in the back door (helpful tip here!) directly from the parking lot (and not have to walk around the block from Jacaranda to S Cal Ave). Easy access is large in my book.
Spasso - beautiful decor, wonderful wine list, excellent food!Chicken Parmigiana was perfection.
I was disappointed in the food and, although the service was friendly, it wasn't special.

Went on a Saturday night and it was packed but the service was still good. Really great ambiance, we sat in the back room but could still hear the live music coming from the bar. The food is exactly what you would expect, tasty and comforting. The prices are very reasonable with most of the entrees under $20.00.

column4: DoubleTree by Hilton San Jose 2050 Gateway Place 2050 Gateway Place San Jose, CA  95110
column13: It's the beef that will get your attention here, prepared at a very high temperature that sears in flavor and juices. But the apps and vegetables are all well prepared as well, and it's well worth the freight for a special occasion.
Cioppino had little in it other than crab & tiny clams in a brown sauce rather than the typical red sauce. Server never came over after meal was served.

column4: 33 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: Spazzio's is always pleasant dining and great Italian dishes. Too bad about no dining points there however. . .

column4: 223 East Fourth Ave San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Pastas and pizza are very reasonably priced. The entree prices were a bit high. They have a nice area where they can open the windows when it's a nice evening so you feel like you are dining outdoors while you are in the restaurant.

WE CELEBRATED OUR DAUGHTER'S BIRTHDAY THERE & ALL OF OUR MEALS WERE EXCELLENT. THE WINE LIST WAS GOOD WITH REASONABLE PRICES. SAKI, THE OWNER SAT US AT OUR TABLE & IS VERY PERSONABLE. OUR WAITER WAS FANTASTIC & MADE US ALL FEEL AT HOME. WE WILL BE RETURNING NOT ONLY FOR SPECIAL OCCASIONS EITHER.
A very pleasant dining experience. High quality service, with good ambience, lead to a thoroughly good evening, in a super restaurant, and at a reasonable price!
Love the windows that fold open creating a wonderful inside outside feeling.

This is a fine restaurant -- unless you have special dietary needs. I'd noted mine on my OpenTable reservation -- I'm lactose intolerant -- but nobody bothered to read that. When I asked my waiter which dishes had little or no butter/cream/cheese he didn't have a clue. But he did go ask the chef and came back with word that many of the appetizers were fine but all of the entrees were drenched with butter. He and the chef didn't offer to modify any dishes but I was told I could have a bowl of spaghetti.I ended up with appetizers and a piece of veal on a bed of butter-soaked puree I couldn't touch. We didn't even try dessert.

The kitchen gets better and better. Had fresh local albacore, finished perfectly. Other meals on the table were also outstanding. Wine pairings by waiter were perfect. Would have given 5 stars for food, but the desserts were not on par with the rest of the kitchen.

column4: 1300 S. Main St Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: love the happy hour food!!!! drinks are always good.
We will not go back again. Not good experience at all. Service was so poor, we had to wait for our food for over an hour. Not at all recommended.
Dinner was wonderful. Service was great, food was excellente, but bring your checkbook as they are very expensive. Would go again but only for a special occasion.
A unique and charming environment, reminiscent of another, more gracious time. A lovely solicitous staff with consistently good food.

Went for my husband's 40th, just the two of us. This was our 2nd visit and it was GREAT. Delicious food, really creative. Exceptional service and man do their mixologists know how to make a mean cocktail! My only complaint was temperature. We sat in the enclosed porch area and I was pretty cold in a dress (bare legs), even with a sweater on. They need to work on temperature regulation back there. The heat came on a couple times, blasted for 2 min then went off. But other than that a great experience.

column4: 601 Old County Road San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: The food was excellent, the service fantastic, and the staff was wonderful. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to all of my friends!

column4: 11180 Highway One Point Reyes Station, CA  94956
column13: Station House has a huge menu with great variety, there's something for everyone. From the local oyster to a Ruben, you can get it. The kids menu has nice options as well. It is definitely a comfortable spot for brunch, lunch, or dinner when you are visiting Pt. Reyes.

I expected much more. The menu was limited. The preparation was unimaginative and frankly done to minimum standards. Service was so so. We were asked about the food and service. An example would be an orienal salad that consisted of a prepared chicken breast on top of lettuce with a few cucumbers. Scant dressing was applied.We dined here because we attended a convention zt the Marriott. The beef tenderloin was ok. It had a standard brown sauce, served with sad mashed potatoes and asparagas. The breakfast bar compared to a middle rate hotel breakfast.

column4: 4 Embarcadero Center Street Level San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Taco Tuesday from 4-7pm and the beef bulgogi is delicious, perfect combo with beef.

we celebrated a birthday here and had a very good time, the fish and chips and burgers were excellent. The drinks are very good, but pricey. The atmosphere is very Irish Pub, with a beautiful and extensive bar. The service was excellent. They have an excellent beer and alcohol list and a good varied menu. We highly recommend it.

Straits Restaurant is a fun, high-energy spot in the long stretch of suburbia south of San Francisco. The wide of variety of food satisfies groups with many different food particularities, and their family-style way let's you try all their scrumptious dishes. I can't help but order my long-time favorites, such as the origami seabass. I brought a friend visiting from the midwest, and we were not disappointed. Our waiter was especially great, giving us many helpful suggestions at each stage and accommodating us in the friendliest of ways. We'll be back.

column4: 845 Market Street   Suite 597 San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: Went fir dinner. 4 people. This restaurant is in a Mall. Food was great. Service was poor. It was very noisy! They sat us right by the door.

column4: 333 Santana Row, Suite #1100 San Jose, CA  95128
column13: Good Food and it was super busy evening for them so service was a little slow. But overall an A+ Experience.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: I was expecting more out of this place from all the buzz and reviews. I was disappointed with the food. Service was great-very attentive. There's no kid menu and dishes were over priced for the quality.
We were treated like royalty and the food was delicious! Definitely coming back!

column4: 1149 El Camino Real Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: There was a nice patio in the back that I will try next time. The food was traditional Greek. I was in the mood for that, so I liked it. My friend is vegatarian and there were plenty of choices for her. The noise level was high because there were two large parties. That probably isn't typical but I hope they install a real door between the two rooms.
We always enjoy this fine Thai restaurant. Consistently great food, service, & wine. No reason to go anywhere else for Thai food!

Sumo Sushi is a hidden treasure in Livermore. There have been several restaurants that went out of business in the same location so we were skeptical. We were wrong! The sushi was excellent and the presentation was amazing. The chef drizzled sauce on our plates to make a butterfly and a bird. This is something you'd find in San Francisco. The only reason I have not rated it 5 stars instead of 4 stars is we were a group of seven - some had sushi - some had the hibatchi dinners. The food was only lukewarm for those of us who had the hibatchi dinners. Other than that - a 5 star experience. We will definitely go back!

column4: 1921 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: The only early evening reservation we could get was at 5:00. We were given a booth which worked well for our party of four. Since we were so early the early bird prime rib special was attractive and we ordered it. The Caesar salad was okay but pale. Plenty of anchovies. The roast beef was rare but only so-so. Not much flavor. The wet overcooked vegetables ran water under the beef. The loaded baked potato was good. We had a nice dinner with our Israeli guests but nothing special. Martinis and wine were very good, as was the ice cream dessert. Our waiter was a bit supercilious but efficient and cooperative.
Supperclub was supper fun and had great entertainment, music and atmosphere. The food was mediocre and if you are wine person I recommend bringing your own.

This is our second visit to this restaurant, we have been in awe of the quality and quantity of food. On this visit, they advised us of a delay in bringing a portion of our order, we told them that we can just cancel since we were already pretty well fed. They still prepared the additional food for us and did not charge us for it. So we have plenty of leftovers. The service was beyond excellent and the food very tasty. Highly recommend this place.
The worst sashimi I had in a long time. Very thick slices of tasteless fish!
It's not just a neighborhood gem but it's a city wide gem. Great place to go. The staff are very helpful.
Always happy with Sushi Mambo, this time was no different! Try the "Fungus Amungus". DELICIOUS.
No complaints with the food, but the service seems to be getting worse with each visit.

Without doubt the best sushi in the area, but it's very pricey. The brussel sprout kimchi is amazing. Unless you routinely spend $100 for dinner for two, this is a place for special occasions, not every day dining.

column4: 1090 Point Lobos Ave. San Francisco, CA  94121
column13: We celebrated my mother's 60th birthday on this occasion and it was delightful! The food was perfect, the view was phenomenal, our waiter was marvelous, everything about our experience was better than I could have hoped for. We will definitely be back again!!

column4: 2097 Stagecoach Rd Suite 100 Santa Rosa, CA  95404
column13: I was a little disappointed this time. The salads were very good, the lemonade, cold and very good, but my pork sandwich was not so good. The pork was very dry, and it was not like the last time I order it. Their prices are very reasonable.

I used to go here regularly years ago and really thought it was a great place to take friends for their birthday brunch. Upon returning after several years' absence, I found that It had aged and was tired looking along with the staff. My friend and I made a reservation for 10 a.m. and arrived on time, but the hostess was not going to seat us until exactly 10:00 a.m. even though the restaurant was almost empty. When she looked at the clock she found that it was 10, so she seated us. That was a strange situation. At any rate, the food was just ok, but the price was high. I won't be going back because it's not as nice as it once was and certainly not worth the price charged.
Wonderful experience from the minute we walked in the door! Impeccable service. Food was amazing! So happy we finally have a great restaurant in Willow Glen!

We all ate something very different - Pizza, risotto, tai salad, and fried chicken and macaroni and cheese. It all arrived at the same perfectly cooked. Nice surprise and parking was not bad for a Saturday night. Oh, and the bacon and cheese fries are awesome!

column4: 2999 A Oak Road Walnut Creek, CA  94597
column13: Not very busy for a Friday night, but we ate early. Very attentive service, and a great meal. I would definitely recommend the garlic appetizer!

I went there for a birthday lunch with my husband. It was a Monday. To our pleasant surprise, the parking outside was quite available and there were just a few tables with customers as we walked it around noon time, we could sit comfortably.
Original, tasty, delicious food. Great for sharing dishes within a group. Don't miss the tea leaf wrapped beef appetizer and the prawn entree.

I love their curries. My favorite entree is the Lamb Tikki Masala. I never use to really like Indian food until I went here. Now, I've been going at least once a week. There personal service is also great. The staff are very polite and personable. The naan is fabulous, too. I like the garlic naan. It's like eating bread… just wonderful.
Decent buffet. The naan was good. They only had one chicken dish (with a cream sauce) and they used tandoori chicken as it's base.

Excellent home-style cooked, authentic quality meals, I had the half mini chicken and my wife the Lamb Kabob, and we shared a salad. The bill was about 40 bucks, very worth it- I felt filled.At 6pm on a Friday, only people in the place- my feeling is the belly dancing comes later when there's more of a crowd.
Great to have an ethnic restaurant close to home that makes food like I remember as a kid.

I went on a weekday for lunch and had the Singapore noodles, which was not the best, but I love singapore noodles in almost any form. It was a bit too sticky and soft. The appitizer was delicous though. It was coconut shreds, tiny lemon wedges, and cold shrimp wrapped it butter lettuce. Very tastey!
Tarragon is an absolute gem! I was amazed at the food -- great selections, great flavor, great presentation. And the service was outstanding!!

Went to TatuyO on a recommendation and it was possibly the worst experience ever. It's a spanish tapas restaurant and the first menu we had was a breakfast menu when we wanted lunch. The breakfast menu had mexican food on it. Then we attempted to order sangria. They claimed they made their sangria from scratch (Better restaurants have it prepared and made prior). They didn't have ingredients for it. We resorted to two regular cocktails that were so-so. The food choices were not impressive in display or taste. The appetizers call came with less food than tortilla chips. The chicken tacos were extremely spicy and unspecified on the menu. The food was not impressive. To top it all off, they messed up our bill which I had to correct for them
Great wine and good veg and vegan options. Delicious!

Excellent food, service and ambience!! This is extremely underrated, the food is scrumptious and organic, it tasted great and we felt great afterward!This place stands above other Mediterranean restaurants in the area, much nicer in terms of food quality than a well known competitor down the street!

column1: Technique at Le Cordon Bleu - San Francisco
column4: 350 Rhode Island Street San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: This was a highlight of our trip to the city. It was a lovely place and the food was superb and beautiful presentation. It's always fun to meet and chat with the students too.We will be back again on our next visit and making the reservation on opentable was so easy. Thanks for a great experience.

The Restaurant was nice enough but the room we were in was kinda small and the tables were almost on top of each other. We looked into a parking lot not the best view. We ordered two appetizers to start with and neither were very impressive. I ordered the tortellini crema and my food was amazing but there wasn't a whole lot. Thank goodness we did order the appetizers. My husband ordered some type of roll with eggplant that they warn you takes longer. My husband is not a picky man but he was not impressed. Again there was three small rolls not enough food to fill you up. Over all was just an ok experience.

column1: Terrace Cafe and Veranda Bar - Best Western El Rancho Inn
column13: This is a passable place for what it is... a place to park your car for an early flight. The meals are better than I remember years ago, but not a place I would recommend unless a car is not available. Drinks in bar are sosso..The breakfast bar is much better than it was in the past...but not a full meal and the usual carb fest. It served us well though......would go again...

column1: The Terrace Room at the Lake Merritt Hotel
column13: I made a 12:15 reservation for brunch on a Sunday. Arrived around 12:10 and waited a few minutes for the hostess to set up our table. Once we were seated, we waited over 20 minutes for someone to acknowledge us. There were people seated behind us that were served 4 times and no one ever came over to our table to at least take our drink orders. Needless to say, we left. The restaurant was not very busy at all, so I'm not sure why we were ignored for over 20 minutes. I don't think I'll be going back any time soon.

We always have a great experience here! The food and service are always great - whether sitting at the bar or at a table. The hummus is top notch and the seasonal concoctions by the chef are always great.

column4: 255 N. First Street San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Amazingly authentic German food and setting. Felt like we had been transported. Our group tried the Sauerbraten, Schweinemedallions, Lentil soup, and Jaegerschnitzel - and we all tried eachother's dishes because they were so good. Highly recommend this place. We loved it.

Food was pretty good, but service was uneven. First they tried to seat us at a table in the back, when the restaurant was practically empty. We asked to be moved to the front (more light, a few more people), and they readily accommodated us. We had to ask repeatedly for some special requests (hot sauce, pot of hot water). The tea served was barely hot, and we had to send it back to be heated up. The food was good, and the decor is nice. The place was surprisingly empty for a Saturday evening -- too many other popular restaurants nearby, perhaps.

column4: 1240 El Camino Real San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: The service was very friendly and attentive but the food was just so-so. The spring rolls were very greasy, and the fried rice was mushy. I probably won't go back.
The chef may have changed...food isn't as good as it used to be.

This place was JUMPING when we were there. But our beers and water glasses were never dry, our food came quickly and was delicious, our waiter was knowledgeable and friendly. It was noisy but that's what I expected at a brew pub on Monday night football during a very large conference. Two thumbs up. If I am back in San Fran I would definitely frequent this place again.

The Thomas at Fagiani's is certainly off to a great start. We had our first dinner there, and we were impressed. The food was terrific, the service was very good, and the interior is gorgeous. We will definitely be back, and next time we want to try the third floor with the view.

column4: 140 South Santa Cruz Avenue Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: Great setting. Food medium.
Lovely restaurant, and it is noisy. We were a group of four, and it was difficult to have a conversation due to the noise. The food was good, especially the fresh veggie spring rolls. Good service.

I made a reservation for a party of 15 for my birthday party, and we all had a great time! The ambiance was nice, it was cozy and the waitstaff were very friendly and helpful. I didn't tell the restaurant that it was my birthday but the server must have overheard my friends wishing me and decided to surprised me with a complimentary slice of cheese cake! It was quite lovely of him. The food came a little slow, but tasted wonderful. I had a Linguine Ala Vongole. (Manila clam Linguini)

Off the bay, along Tiburon Boulevard is "The Lodge at Tiburon". Inside is the Tiburon Tavern. There are tables for outdoor dining, if you prefer, but the only view is that of the road...or the Lodge. The food was actually GREAT, and I was surprised. The problem appears to be a Gilligan's Island crew. They don't work together in an organized fashion to make your meal special. A bunch of part-time/temporary workers? And the restaurant is dark and gloomy.

Everything in the menu looked delicious and what we ordered was in fact outstanding. We shared the appetizer board to start which we tailored to include our favourite meats, cheeses and roasted vegetables. Then I had the crab gnocchi which was really yummy. For dessert I had a chocolate cake which was a bit disappointing. Overall the food was really nice but the service was terribly slow! There was one waitress covering most of the tables. Poor girl, she was not a bad waitress but it was too much for one person. The meal took absolutely forever! It took ages to order and pay, appetizer plates were not removed before our entrees were served and are utensils didn't get changed between courses.
Inexpensive decent North Indian Food

Really great find. Like a great English Gastro pub. Friendly helpful staff, fantastic cocktails and popcorn shrimp to die for! My only moan would be the massive portion size of my main chicken course. Way too much!

Great fun! REally jumpin'. High energy. Edgy and beautiful decor, gorgeous slabs of finished wood on sawhorses. (My hubby had to bump his knee a couple of times to negotiate these, though) Fun, attentive, engaging wait staff. We shared small plates -- don't miss the eggplant, the meatballs, the salumi. So glad they finally opened! Looks like a great success for our neighborhood... but make reservations!! Congrats to you all
Tony was awesome!!!! The TNT roll, house cold sake, kanpa chi house specialty, hamachi belly sashimi and banana tempura dessert were my favs. Looking forward to going back to try more

Outstanding and consistent with the Sheraton brand. I alerted the restaurant that it was my daughter's birthday lunch and they bent over backwards to make it cheery and personal for her. The Chef even visited with us at least twice and sent out a special dessert for us both on the house! The waitress was ultra attentive and cheerful. The food was farm-fresh, par excellence, flavorful and satisfying! Very reasonably priced I felt. Thank you Chef and Staff of the Sheraton Petaluma!

column4: 655 Montgomery St./ Financial District San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Always an amazing experience. You must get the duck!

column1: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
column13: The Tonga Room is one of those places you have to do "at least once". Located in the historic Fairmont hotel, the restaurant is set up around where the swimming pool used to be. Now there's a floating barge in the middle with a pretty decent band playing oldies and top 40 hits. Service was a bit slow, food was decent. Drinks are STRONG

column4: Number One Nob Hill San Francisco, CA  94108
column13: Let's be blunt: you should have the Sunday Champagne Brunch. Go on a clear day so you can really enjoy the amazing view. It's buffet style, so you're seated, then the fabulous server starts pouring the champagne, so you'll toast the morning, then select from an incredible culinary bounty! The staff is excellent, paying attention to details. Every item on the buffet is labeled clearly and well-presented, along with a meat carving station and custom-cooked omelettes. Add some live piano music and stunning views of our city by the bay, and you'll want to linger at the Top all morning.

column1: Top of the Market - San Mateo
column4: 1855 S. Norfolk St. San Mateo, CA  94403
column13: Tried the top of the Market as the food down below in the main restaurant is not very good. I would say the Top of the Market is better but the prices are to high for the quantity and the quality of the food. We received a a gift card as a gift and decided to use it I am glad the card covered the entire meal. We will not return to the Fish Market for Lunch or Dinner in the near or distant future.

Had dinner on a Friday night. Convenient to walk to from our flat. Food was ok. Very loud. Host and hostess were less than friendly. We arrived promptly for our reservation and asked if we could have a booth. Host immediately said, "Not a chance. Those are for reserved." Interesting that there were 4 booths available and we had a reservation. They did eventually give us a booth but their attitude was a bit terse. Doubt we will eat here again.

Every time I eat here I am impressed. The food is absolutely top quality; fresh and elegantly presented. They use seasonal foods and provide an array of different cuisines from California to Meditteranean, Japanese to "Someone's Mom's Meatloaf". Great wine list and heavenly bar with magnificent martinis. You need reservations as it is quite popular, for good reason. It can be a bit noisy and someone dark, especially in the back. The Friday and Saturday night singles scene at the bar can be amusing if you like people watching.
I found the food, the ambiance, the service, and whole experience to be a bit lackluster....not on my list of places to which I'll return or recommend to others.

We had a short wait for our table for four. To compensate us, the manager gave us a free oder of sweet potato fries, which were excellent. Our server was inexperienced and poored our entire bottle of wine into four glasses, two of our party only drank half a glass and two went home thirsty. Two of our party shared their orders and the server was very accomodating to this.

One of the best meals I've ever had - from the warm mozzarella appetizer, to an amazing rabbit pappardelle, to a great short ribs, to the phenomenal service from our waiter, this was an overall wonderful experience and I'd highly recommend it to anyone!
Delicious, organic food and great service!

I would definitely recommend this place for drinks and appetizers but not so much for dinner. They had us wait at the bar for our reserved table (we were on time) but then seemed to forget about us. Dinner service also seemed inattentive. But their Mai Tai is the BEST. I would come back for drinks and appetizers.
Food always good, staff always friendly and always a good time and meal....very enjoyable!
Excellent Italian restaurant in Little Italy off the main drag = intimate and vibrant with obviously lots of local regulars.

My NYC-based husband and I make a point of dining at Corso whenever we visit family in the East Bay. It's everything you'd hope for if you went to a neighborhood trattoria in Rome: interesting-looking diners having interesting conversations around you, casual but highly professional service, dishes that nod to tradition but are freshly conceived with top-notch ingredients. On our most recent visit, my pasta dish surpassed the pasta I'd had at Chez Panisse the night before, and I enjoyed myself more, too. Enough said!
Nice neighborhood restaurant. Small menu, but quality ingredients prepared nicely and very tasty.

column4: 1077 El Camino Real Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: As always, great food, great restaurant, great owner!
Way too much crowd noise - almost left when we walked in

We're so glad the Trident had reopened at last! We were regulars before, and the brunch menu is excellent. They've nicely remodeled too, and exposed the original floor also - beautiful. Great to have it back.

Great place to dine if you're going out to any of the bars in the neighborhood after. Service is generally attentive and friendly, they have a nice beer list that is affordable, and the food is varied and you can't do wrong!

column4: 75 Yerba Buena Lane San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: I have dined here many times. Service is always very friendly and very efficient and the food is consistently very good. I have never ordered the same dish twice and have never had a bad meal here.

I would have been happier here if things hadn't been pre-made. I have several food allergies, and the flatbreads -surprisingly - were already made, so nothing could be omitted. The moussaka was HUGE, bubbly hot and delicious.

I really loved this restaurant because they have great service, a wonderful ambiance and really tasty food. After going to Turkey a few years ago, it has been hard to find good Turkish food in the area. This place has all the great stuff I remember, Borek, Manti and plenty of great tea with very helpful, and pleasant servers!:)I came here with my boyfriend and it was very romantic, they even have little candles on the tables. We did not have any wine but there was a very nice wine list available with a bar. I would definitely go back to try the other goodies on the menu and I would for sure recommend it to a friend.
Delicious food, friendly, top notch service. Moderate pricing. Will definitely be back!
This place used to rival Blowfish. No longer...

I went to Tuba for my birthday with a group of 8 and it was simply the best!!!! They were 100% attentive, accommodating, friendly and the food was unmatched. They have a nice wine list, all the traditional Turkish selections including shish kebab, dolmas, etc. Would absolutely recommend this restaurant to everyone :-)

Seemed to be a popular place, and the location is just far out of downtown to make parking relatively easy to find. Most dishes come out very well, though presentation could be improved up with some. Not much of a wine list, which is not good for those who can't drink beer.

column4: 5101 Great America Parkway Santa Clara, CA  95054
column13: This is one of the best hotel restaurants we've been to in a long time. Their pizza was so good we had them make the margherita pizza even though we were full because we've been trying to find a good one since our last trip to Rome. Well, it wasn't quite as good as the pizza in Rome but it was the best one of the many we've tried in the US-by far. Our waiter Carter was spectacular. He made a great meal even better. We were staying next door at the Hilton but since i'd had a business meal here in the past, i brought my wife over and she agrees. We will go back.
Great food and wine list. Located in the middle of town and very easy to get to. Very nice decor and service was wonderful. Would recommend everyone to try this place.

I have been to this restaurant several times and the food wasn't as good this time. I had the chicken piccata which was dry and very lemony. The pasta it was served with on the other hand was cooked to death and very starchy and stuck together on the plate. The vegetables were very good and cooked perfectly. I hope this was just an off night.
love the kari kari roll and the tuna tataki. sashimi excellent
The bar-b-que sea bass is always our favorite. The wine list is exceptional and they serve half glasses too.
We are a Limousine company that recommends the UnderDog to our clients for a great small plate Food and the wine atmosphere.

column1: Unicorn Pan Asian Cuisine - San Francisco
column13: The vegan menu is a great deal and a wonderful mix of tasty treats.
Had their lunch buffet. They had a wide variety of dishes and everything was really tasty. Only problem is you tend to overeat because you want to try everything!

column4: Hilton San Francisco 333 O'Farrell St. San Francisco, CA  94102
column13: The ambiance was nice, the food and service very good. It is very convenient for dinner before a play. Overall a very good find. I would go back.
fun spot, good food at a fair price
This was my second visit, and I enjoyed it even more than the last time (a year ago). Our server was knowledgeable, the food was excellent, and the atmosphere fun and upbeat.

column1: Va de Vi Bistro & Wine Bar
column4: 1511 Mt. Diablo Blvd. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: I've dined here several times. While I enjoy the atmosphere, inside and outside, I find the food to be very uneven.

column4: 1329 N Main St. Walnut Creek, CA  94696
column13: The tapas were delicious. Love the variety offered on Happy Hour menu. The alcoholic beverages were deliciously made. I recommend the Jasmine-tini
The food and service was great!

column4: 164 South B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Food is so-so. Our server was unfamiliar with the wine list. Decor is nice. The tuna tower starter has way too much cucumber filler that overpowers the tuna in the dish. The pork chop was good, but had too much sweet sauce. The spinach/onion side that accompanies the filet was literally inedible because it was so bitter. Little finesse, big portions.
Great food and service. Sautéed spinach and gnocchi = yum.
Vegies are fresh, the chicken that I ordered was hormone free, so, it was delicious.

Very attentive service and great food. The salads were not that impressive, but the pizza, pasta, and both desserts were excellent. We had a Living Social deal for a prix fixe menu, and we were very pleased at the prix fixe selection and quality. The service was also nicely paced.
excellent servicefood was fantasticGem of a restaurant in the Nob hill area

A friend recommended Venus and I was so happy to have the opportunity to try it. Portions were generous, the wine list was modest but with a helpful range and good choices, and our server was helpful and gracious. My food was tasty--especially the salad and the kale. My hanger steak was flavorful if a bit chewy. I'm definitely returning to Venus: It's a new find for me in downtown Berkeley, though I hear that it's been there for years.
Excellent food! Nice little place with seating out front. Portions are just right. Would for sure recommend. No corkage! Got to love that in wine country.

Very disappointing...service was bad and slow, not authentic Italian at all. The burrata and eggplant parmesan was very good. The clams vongole lackluster, poor quality clams. The mussels and shrimp appetizer were poor quality shellfish.

We organized a corporate dinner & knew we wanted our group of 12 to go to North Beach. After doing some research online for best restaurants (& seeing what was available/had reservations) we chose Vicoletto. We were not disappointed whatsoever. The food was very good, the service was personal & warm & the wine list was amazing- especially if you like Italian wines. The owner was extremely helpful & knowledgeable with selecting wines & gave our table extra TLC. We loved the buratta salad, the lobster ravioli was nice as was the veal. This is an intimate restaurant with good ambiance. Overall, Vicoletto is a great find in North Beach!

A very retro-old-fashioned sort of a place. The price for how much food you get is good. Nothing from the kitchen seemed to be especially interesting with the rather salty entree 'plugged' into a generic dinner framework.

Village always delivers on food, service, etc...although this time, I wasn't wild about the Ahi Nicoise Salad....the tuna wasn't the best quality, the egg was overcooked, etc...one of the people I was dining with had the Bruschetta with egg on top and said it was delicious, as was the Tombo Tuna Melt that another had...
This was our first visit to the Village Inn. The service was great, the food incredible and the ambiance perfect. Made for a very nice night out.
Magnificient heirloom tomato salad, great wine selection and fabulous preparation of the King Salmon. For us seniors, the proportions are perfect! Not too much but just right!
Delish farm to table meal - Hands down the best restaurant in Marin.

It was a quiet Saturday night at Vin Santo, thanks to the playoff games. We were able to have a great,people-watching table, and settled in for a wonderful experience. Since this was our first time there, we had a hard time selecting what we wanted to eat. Let me rephrase - so many things looked delicious, we didn't know how to narrow it down.We started with the ravioli sample plate, then the hot Napa Valley cabbage salad. Hubby had the chicken Marsala, I had the osso bucco. Everything was delicious!This will become a new, regular restaurant for us. Can't wait to taste all the other menu items!

column1: VINeleven at the Napa Valley Marriott
column13: Adequate, but in NapaValley this is not a contender for foodies. Best feature is convenience if you are staying at the Marriott and don't have independent ground transportation.

column1: Vineyards Chop House - Crowne Plaza Hotel Concord
column13: Three Filet Mignon steaks and one New York steak were ordered. All medium rare.Two Filets and the New York were thick, tender and cooked as ordered.The third filet was much thinner, more medium than medium rare and tasted old.Our waitress was very nice and took the steak back, however, the new steak was'tmuch better and by that time the other three persons had already finished eating.Priced too high and not worth a return visit.
Menu was somewhat eclectic. Preparation and presentation were outstanding. Service impeccable.

column1: Vitrine - St Regis Hotel San Francisco
column4: 125 Third Street 4th Floor San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: Very nice - even the person among us that didn't like fish, enjoyed his fish meal!
It is always a pleasure to dine at Viva la Vita. The manager and his staff are always attentive and friendly.

column1: Viva! Neighborhood Eatery of Los Gatos
column4: 15970 Los Gatos Boulevard Los Gatos, CA  95032
column13: Great spot----good food, with a well-balanced menu. Viva staff was friendly and seemed happy to serve their customers. This was our first visit and we live about 10 miles away, but it was obvious this is a local neighborhood fixture. We'll be back----
Had a new dish, Tuscan Rabbit, it was quite good. Dessert was excellent.
It was very quiet at 6pm on a Saturday night. Service was prompt and friendly. The food was very tasty. It was good value.
Parking around the Yacht Club was the only thing I did not like. All the parking is two or more blocks away... But we will be back..

column4: 399 The Embarcadero South San Francisco, CA  94105
column13: Overpriced and very small portions. I'm a foodie and I think the food (what there was of it) was good but $16.00 for 4 teeny pieces of sashimi was a bit much. They could serve the whole restaurant with one piece of tuna. My husband had the snapper which was very fresh but wasn't boned and he spent the entirety of his meal picking bones out of his mouth. Don't order it. The oysters were delicious and since we ordered them before 6:00 pm we got them for $1 each. A very good deal. I ordered the scallop pasta which was very good but 1 scallop sliced for the whole dish and 5 or 6 pieces of pasta.

column4: Pier 7 on the Embarcadero San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Requested a table near the window for my brother's birthday. Even after switching our reservation time they still gave us a table right on the water with a great view. The food is good especially the seafood. No complaints about the service either. Great spot for special occasions.
We loved everything about Wayfare Tavern. We can't wait to go back!
This is why we keep coming back. Food was great and service was very good.
This is sleeper. Really, really good food and great service

column4: 3143 Stevens Creek Blvd San Jose, CA  95117
column13: White Shallot offers French and Vietnamese cuisine. We went for French. Portions are not typical for french restaurants, at White Shallot they are decent and you won't fill hungry. Don't skip desert menu and tea, that part I liked the best. Web site doesn't say what wine list restaurant has, but they carry some variety. Waiters are attentive but not noisy.

Nice menu selections and wine selections. The summer salad with grilled prawns and watermelon was excellent. Fettucine with chicken also excellent. We definitely will frequent Wild Vine Hideway after just recently discovering it. Being a Saturday night with music outside, it got difficult to have a conversation, but nothing to put us off.
Very expensive for the average foodie
This is an excellent place if you want a wide variety of great tasting, local food. Who doesn't??

column4: 4404 Old Redwood Hwy Santa Rosa, CA  95403
column13: Not worhty of a Chronicle Top 100. Many dishes were overly seasoned(salted). The Cauliflour Shooters with Grilled Cheese Toasts were the standout. Otherwise, Good but not Great food.

Even though I had made a reservation we were kept waiting 30 minutes and it set the tone for the evening. We were not even offered a drink. When we were seated the table was far too small for 4 people. The food was fair and the service spotty and the table was not laid properly. This was a birthday celebration and just not up to such a celebration. Disappointing because lunch there is good.

column1: Wine Spectator Greystone Restaurant at The Culinary Institute of America
column13: Food was very good, but by no means outstanding. The charcuterie plate laked significant creativity. Beer list very mediocre (Amstel, Trumer??), what about all the small microbreweries that have sprung up in area.

It was my birthday and I decided I wanted to try something new, something a little fancy. When I found the website and saw the open table reservations, I made my decision. Walking in to The Wishing Crab I was disappointed. It was not fancy at all, if anything is was very casual and a little dive ish. Not that that is bad, some of my favorite places are whole in the wall dives, I just felt the website was a little deceiving. The service was fantastic, our server was very attentive and helpful. We started with the calamari and it was a little bland. But the rest of our food was fantastic, my daughter had the seared tuna salad and said it was fantastic. but if you order the garlic crab legs, I hope you like garlic! a little to much!
What can I say Pham is a rock star when it comes to great food at a reasonable cost.I will be stopping there frequently

Had lunch with a friend who came down from Rio Vista. We had the porchetta sandwich and the cod sandwich (my fave) with their mayonnaise-free cole slaw and housemade pickles. Service is always friendly and non-intrusive; servers discreetly notice and fill the water and iced tea glasses, careful not to interrupt conversations. I look forward to my next lunch at Wood!

The only drawback, to the uninitiated, is that there is almost no indoor seating, so you have to sit on the patio at night. Tables are very small and cramped (at least for 4), and the outdoor heat lamps are barely sufficient. On a cool evening, I would suggest elsewhere--or make sure to bring a warm sweater. They don't warn you about this when you make a reservation. Otherwise, a fine dining experience.
Still one of San Francisco's best kept secrets.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: The problem with this otherwise very pleasant restaurant--good food, nice variety of food choices, attentive service, and a clean/pleasant interior (though somewhat overloaded with TVs)--is its location (the Ambiance rating is for the location rather than the interior). At night, it simply feels unsafe to be around this restaurant. Perhaps the daytime experience is different...

Second visit here, first time for lunch. We were not disappointed. Took a group from work (first time for them) and everyone was delighted with their meals. Three of the group had the lunch special allowing them to choose 2 items. I had the Udon with 3 pieces of sushi. We all agreed we'd come back again and try different items, not because what we had wasn't good, but to see what other things tasted like.
A consistently great experience. Best lobster role west of Maine.
Fried clams are delicious and reminiscent of the great clams on the East Coast. Friendly staff and helpful management add to a very enjoyable dining experience.
We like to eat outside but the yellow jackets were in hyper drive, inside was okay but they need air condition on those warm summer nights. LOVE the food!

Yoshis was amazing. They catered to my wife and I on my Birtday. We saw Kenny Lattimore right after there and they were kind enough to give us the best seats in the house and free desert for my birthday! This is our new favorite. The sushi was delcious and the organic terriyaki chicken was pure perfection.
Great place for my wife's birthday

I've been going here for years. It's a very modest place with good, fresh food at a great price. I always get the You See Special (used to be on the chalkboard and not on the menu)and my companion gets the chicken teriyaki bento. Service is efficient, if not overly friendly when they're busy. A very good place to go for a quick, tasty meal.

Very fresh sushi and rolls and a variety of cooked Japanese food as well. Service was excellent. Tea and water constantly refilled. Reasonable prices and good sized portions. Would like to have had more unagi in the unagi fried rice. All in all, a great neighborhood find. We will be back.

Yuzu is my favorite sushi spot in the Marina. When you are looking for fun innovative rolls and don't feel like waiting for a table at umami, Yuzu is a great spot. The service is great and it's always an excellent dining experience.
convenient location as there is plenty of street parking and near enough to down town oakland. food was less than average. fruit served as a side looked like it had been sitting overnight..
So many gluten-free options! My brother-in-law wanted to come back again the next day.
My friend and I had a few tapas and drinks. The service was prompt,friendly. The drinks were excellent. Out of the 5 tapas we shared, the dates with cheese were the best and memorable.
Fantastic favors! Excellent and original food! Great restaurant! Will definitely go back!

First-rate neighborhood place! No pretence here - just good goof, casual elegant atmosphere and all the appropriate goings on of a real reasturant. I could easily have been in a bistro in France and the feeling would have been the same. Food was great, friendly service and the overall expierence was so pleasant that we didn't mind the slightly extended wait for our entrees. We'll go back for sure.

Extremely noisy - opposed to "vibrant bar scene". Very diappointed.The waitress never came back to take our order even after the appetizers were served and almost halfway through - we had to track her down to give her the order (she was surprised that she hadn't taken our order - there was only one other waitstaff there)Poor wine list – very few choices in terms of quality and variety.We ordered the blue fin toro at market price ($30 for 5 slices) and was served half frozen grey fish. Very unappetizing. Also ordered a couple of spicy rolls which were actually good. But generally, the food, the ambiance and the service was disappointing.
Great experience! I will visit this restaurant again.

AMAZING! Dinner at Zero Zero this week was the best meal experience I have had since I can remember! The cocktail list is amazing, and I took the server's recommendation for the top one on the list. It was some gin, basil delicious-ness and I could not have been more pleased! I had three :). For dinner, I had the Castro Pizza and it too was the best thing to touch my lips in quite some time. The thin crust was perfectly crisp, and despite having sopressata and sausage, the pizza was not at all greasy. Without a doubt, I will be returning to Zero Zero the next time I'm in San Fran.
Better than any other Persian restaurant I've been to. As good as the best home-cooked Persian food.
It was lunch and only 4 tables were occupied, we had good attentive service. The food was pretty good. Not as spectacular as I was expecting...but we had a vry good time
We had a great experience and will definitely go back the next time we are in San Francisco.
Had reservation 6:30 pm but would not let us order from menu until 7:00 pm. Annoying and wasted time

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: This is a fabulous spot! My husband and I are from Houston and have been coming here since 1995! We have consistently received the highest quality service and food. It is our first choice to dine when we arrive in the city and have brought many friends with us over the years!

What a great find. Found this place on Open Table looking for a place near Pac Bell park as we were going to a Giants game. The bartender was just great as we ate our dinner at the bar, she made a great Margarita and pours healthy glasses of wine. The happy hour menu at the bar is the best, small to medium plates and good choices. Will go back.

Great beet salad! Falafels were very dry and pittas too large for a decent sandwich. My friend had a bacon panini which sounded great, but bread was burned. Waited a while before being approached by wait staff.
